◆ ApplyWindowFlags()

void ApplyWindowFlags ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_WindowFlags flags )
static

2237 if (!(flags & (SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED | SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED))) {
2238 SDL_RestoreWindow(window);
2239 }
2240 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED) {
2241 SDL_MaximizeWindow(window);
2242 }
2243
2244 SDL_SetWindowFullscreen(window, (flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) != 0);
2245
2246 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED) {
2247 SDL_MinimizeWindow(window);
2248 }
2249
2250 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_MODAL) {
2251 SDL_SetWindowModal(window, true);
2252 }
2253
2254 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_GRABBED) {
2255 SDL_SetWindowMouseGrab(window, true);
2256 }
2257 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED) {
2258 SDL_SetWindowKeyboardGrab(window, true);
2259 }

◆ AutoShowingScreenKeyboard()

bool AutoShowingScreenKeyboard ( void )
static
5544{
5545 const char *hint = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_ENABLE_SCREEN_KEYBOARD);
5546 if (!hint) {
5547 // Steam will eventually have smarts about whether a keyboard is active, so always request the on-screen keyboard on Steam Deck
5548 hint = SDL_GetHint("SteamDeck");
5549 }
5550 if (((!hint || SDL_strcasecmp(hint, "auto") == 0) && !SDL_HasKeyboard()) ||
5551 SDL_GetStringBoolean(hint, false)) {
5552 return true;
5553 } else {
5554 return false;
5555 }

◆ cmpmodes()

int SDLCALL cmpmodes ( const void * A,
const void * B )
static
538{
539 const SDL_DisplayMode *a = (const SDL_DisplayMode *)A;
540 const SDL_DisplayMode *b = (const SDL_DisplayMode *)B;
541 int a_refresh_rate = (int)(a->refresh_rate * 100);
542 int b_refresh_rate = (int)(b->refresh_rate * 100);
543 int a_pixel_density = (int)(a->pixel_density * 100);
544 int b_pixel_density = (int)(b->pixel_density * 100);
545
546 if (a->w != b->w) {
547 return b->w - a->w;
548 } else if (a->h != b->h) {
549 return b->h - a->h;
550 } else if (SDL_BITSPERPIXEL(a->format) != SDL_BITSPERPIXEL(b->format)) {
551 return SDL_BITSPERPIXEL(b->format) - SDL_BITSPERPIXEL(a->format);
552 } else if (SDL_PIXELLAYOUT(a->format) != SDL_PIXELLAYOUT(b->format)) {
553 return SDL_PIXELLAYOUT(b->format) - SDL_PIXELLAYOUT(a->format);
554 } else if (a_refresh_rate != b_refresh_rate) {
555 return b_refresh_rate - a_refresh_rate;
556 } else if (a_pixel_density != b_pixel_density) {
557 return a_pixel_density - b_pixel_density;
558 }
559 return 0;
560}
SDL_PIXELLAYOUT
#define SDL_PIXELLAYOUT(format)
Definition SDL_pixels.h:320
SDL_BITSPERPIXEL
#define SDL_BITSPERPIXEL(format)

◆ GetDisplayForRect()

SDL_DisplayID GetDisplayForRect ( int x,
int y,
int w,
int h )
static
1562{
1563 int i, dist;
1564 SDL_DisplayID closest = 0;
1565 int closest_dist = 0x7FFFFFFF;
1566 SDL_Point closest_point_on_display;
1567 SDL_Point delta;
1568 SDL_Point center;
1569 center.x = x + w / 2;
1570 center.y = y + h / 2;
1571
1572 if (_this) {
1573 for (i = 0; i < _this->num_displays; ++i) {
1574 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = _this->displays[i];
1575 SDL_Rect display_rect;
1576 SDL_GetDisplayBounds(display->id, &display_rect);
1577
1578 // Check if the window is fully enclosed
1579 if (SDL_GetRectEnclosingPoints(&center, 1, &display_rect, NULL)) {
1580 return display->id;
1581 }
1582
1583 // Snap window center to the display rect
1584 closest_point_on_display = center;
1585 SDL_GetClosestPointOnRect(&display_rect, &closest_point_on_display);
1586
1587 delta.x = center.x - closest_point_on_display.x;
1588 delta.y = center.y - closest_point_on_display.y;
1589 dist = (delta.x * delta.x + delta.y * delta.y);
1590 if (dist < closest_dist) {
1591 closest = display->id;
1592 closest_dist = dist;
1593 }
1594 }
1595 }
1596
1597 if (closest == 0) {
1598 SDL_SetError("Couldn't find any displays");
1599 }
1600
1601 return closest;
1602}
NULL
#define NULL

◆ SDL_AddFullscreenDisplayMode()

bool SDL_AddFullscreenDisplayMode ( SDL_VideoDisplay * display,
const SDL_DisplayMode * mode )
1261{
1262 SDL_DisplayMode *modes;
1263 SDL_DisplayMode new_mode;
1264 int i, nmodes;
1265
1266 // Finalize the mode for the display
1267 SDL_memcpy(&new_mode, mode, sizeof(new_mode));
1268 new_mode.displayID = display->id;
1269 SDL_FinalizeDisplayMode(&new_mode);
1270
1271 // Make sure we don't already have the mode in the list
1272 modes = display->fullscreen_modes;
1273 nmodes = display->num_fullscreen_modes;
1274 for (i = 0; i < nmodes; ++i) {
1275 if (cmpmodes(&new_mode, &modes[i]) == 0) {
1276 return false;
1277 }
1278 }
1279
1280 // Go ahead and add the new mode
1281 if (nmodes == display->max_fullscreen_modes) {
1282 modes = (SDL_DisplayMode *)SDL_malloc((display->max_fullscreen_modes + 32) * sizeof(*modes));
1283 if (!modes) {
1284 return false;
1285 }
1286
1287 if (display->fullscreen_modes) {
1288 // Copy the list and update the current mode pointer, if necessary.
1289 SDL_memcpy(modes, display->fullscreen_modes, nmodes * sizeof(*modes));
1290 for (i = 0; i < nmodes; ++i) {
1291 if (display->current_mode == &display->fullscreen_modes[i]) {
1292 display->current_mode = &modes[i];
1293 }
1294 }
1295
1296 SDL_free(display->fullscreen_modes);
1297 }
1298
1299 display->fullscreen_modes = modes;
1300 display->max_fullscreen_modes += 32;
1301 }
1302 SDL_memcpy(&modes[display->num_fullscreen_modes++], &new_mode, sizeof(new_mode));
1303
1304 // Re-sort video modes
1305 SDL_qsort(display->fullscreen_modes, display->num_fullscreen_modes,
1306 sizeof(SDL_DisplayMode), cmpmodes);
1307
1308 return true;
1309}
SDL_free
SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_free(void *mem)
Definition SDL_malloc.c:6499

◆ SDL_AddVideoDisplay()

SDL_DisplayID SDL_AddVideoDisplay ( const SDL_VideoDisplay * display,
bool send_event )
841{
842 SDL_VideoDisplay **displays, *new_display;
843 SDL_DisplayID id;
844 SDL_PropertiesID props;
845 int i;
846
847 new_display = (SDL_VideoDisplay *)SDL_malloc(sizeof(*new_display));
848 if (!new_display) {
849 return 0;
850 }
851
852 displays = (SDL_VideoDisplay **)SDL_realloc(_this->displays, (_this->num_displays + 1) * sizeof(*displays));
853 if (!displays) {
854 SDL_free(new_display);
855 return 0;
856 }
857 _this->displays = displays;
858 _this->displays[_this->num_displays++] = new_display;
859
860 id = SDL_GetNextObjectID();
861 SDL_copyp(new_display, display);
862 new_display->id = id;
863 new_display->device = _this;
864 if (display->name) {
865 new_display->name = SDL_strdup(display->name);
866 } else {
867 char name[32];
868
869 SDL_itoa(id, name, 10);
870 new_display->name = SDL_strdup(name);
871 }
872 if (new_display->content_scale == 0.0f) {
873 new_display->content_scale = 1.0f;
874 }
875
876 new_display->desktop_mode.displayID = id;
877 new_display->current_mode = &new_display->desktop_mode;
878 SDL_FinalizeDisplayMode(&new_display->desktop_mode);
879
880 for (i = 0; i < new_display->num_fullscreen_modes; ++i) {
881 new_display->fullscreen_modes[i].displayID = id;
882 }
883
884 new_display->HDR.HDR_headroom = SDL_max(display->HDR.HDR_headroom, 1.0f);
885 new_display->HDR.SDR_white_level = SDL_max(display->HDR.SDR_white_level, 1.0f);
886
887 props = SDL_GetDisplayProperties(id);
888 SDL_SetBooleanProperty(props, SDL_PROP_DISPLAY_HDR_ENABLED_BOOLEAN, new_display->HDR.HDR_headroom > 1.0f);
889
890 SDL_UpdateDesktopBounds();
891
892 if (send_event) {
893 SDL_SendDisplayEvent(new_display, SDL_EVENT_DISPLAY_ADDED, 0, 0);
894 }
895
896 return id;
897}

◆ SDL_CheckWindowDisplayChanged()

void SDL_CheckWindowDisplayChanged ( SDL_Window * window)
static
1771{
1772 if (SDL_SendsDisplayChanges(_this)) {
1773 return;
1774 }
1775
1776 SDL_DisplayID displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindowPosition(window);
1777
1778 if (displayID != window->last_displayID) {
1779 int i, display_index;
1780
1781 // Sanity check our fullscreen windows
1782 display_index = SDL_GetDisplayIndex(displayID);
1783 for (i = 0; i < _this->num_displays; ++i) {
1784 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = _this->displays[i];
1785
1786 if (display->fullscreen_window == window) {
1787 if (display_index != i) {
1788 if (display_index < 0) {
1789 display_index = i;
1790 } else {
1791 SDL_VideoDisplay *new_display = _this->displays[display_index];
1792
1793 // The window was moved to a different display
1794 if (new_display->fullscreen_window &&
1795 new_display->fullscreen_window != window) {
1796 // Uh oh, there's already a fullscreen window here; minimize it
1797 SDL_MinimizeWindow(new_display->fullscreen_window);
1798 }
1799 new_display->fullscreen_window = window;
1800 display->fullscreen_window = NULL;
1801 }
1802 }
1803 break;
1804 }
1805 }
1806
1807 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_DISPLAY_CHANGED, (int)displayID, 0);
1808 }
1809}
SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_DISPLAY_CHANGED
@ SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_DISPLAY_CHANGED
Definition SDL_events.h:154
SDL_SendsDisplayChanges
static bool SDL_SendsDisplayChanges(SDL_VideoDevice *_this)

void SDL_CheckWindowDisplayScaleChanged ( SDL_Window * window)
static
1833{
1834 float display_scale;
1835
1836 if (_this->GetWindowContentScale) {
1837 display_scale = _this->GetWindowContentScale(_this, window);
1838 } else {
1839 const float pixel_density = SDL_GetWindowPixelDensity(window);
1840 const float content_scale = SDL_GetDisplayContentScale(SDL_GetDisplayForWindowPosition(window));
1841
1842 display_scale = pixel_density * content_scale;
1843 }
1844
1845 if (display_scale != window->display_scale) {
1846 window->display_scale = display_scale;
1847 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_DISPLAY_SCALE_CHANGED, 0, 0);
1848 }
1849}

void SDL_CheckWindowSafeAreaChanged ( SDL_Window * window)
static
4152{
4153 SDL_Rect rect;
4154
4155 rect.x = window->safe_inset_left;
4156 rect.y = window->safe_inset_top;
4157 rect.w = window->w - (window->safe_inset_right + window->safe_inset_left);
4158 rect.h = window->h - (window->safe_inset_top + window->safe_inset_bottom);
4159 if (SDL_memcmp(&rect, &window->safe_rect, sizeof(rect)) != 0) {
4160 SDL_copyp(&window->safe_rect, &rect);

◆ SDL_CreatePopupWindow()

SDL_Window * SDL_CreatePopupWindow ( SDL_Window * parent,
int offset_x,
int offset_y,
int w,
int h,
SDL_WindowFlags flags )

Create a child popup window of the specified parent window.

The window size is a request and may be different than expected based on the desktop layout and window manager policies. Your application should be prepared to handle a window of any size.

The flags parameter must contain at least one of the following:

  • SDL_WINDOW_TOOLTIP: The popup window is a tooltip and will not pass any input events.
  • SDL_WINDOW_POPUP_MENU: The popup window is a popup menu. The topmost popup menu will implicitly gain the keyboard focus.

The following flags are not relevant to popup window creation and will be ignored:

  • SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED
  • SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED
  • SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN
  • SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS

The following flags are incompatible with popup window creation and will cause it to fail:

  • SDL_WINDOW_UTILITY
  • SDL_WINDOW_MODAL

The parent parameter must be non-null and a valid window. The parent of a popup window can be either a regular, toplevel window, or another popup window.

Popup windows cannot be minimized, maximized, made fullscreen, raised, flash, be made a modal window, be the parent of a toplevel window, or grab the mouse and/or keyboard. Attempts to do so will fail.

Popup windows implicitly do not have a border/decorations and do not appear on the taskbar/dock or in lists of windows such as alt-tab menus.

By default, popup window positions will automatically be constrained to keep the entire window within display bounds. This can be overridden with the SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_CONSTRAIN_POPUP_BOOLEAN property.

By default, popup menus will automatically grab keyboard focus from the parent when shown. This behavior can be overridden by setting the SDL_WINDOW_NOT_FOCUSABLE flag, setting the SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_FOCUSABLE_BOOLEAN property to false, or toggling it after creation via the SDL_SetWindowFocusable() function.

If a parent window is hidden or destroyed, any child popup windows will be recursively hidden or destroyed as well. Child popup windows not explicitly hidden will be restored when the parent is shown.

Parameters
parentthe parent of the window, must not be NULL.
offset_xthe x position of the popup window relative to the origin of the parent.
offset_ythe y position of the popup window relative to the origin of the parent window.
wthe width of the window.
hthe height of the window.
flagsSDL_WINDOW_TOOLTIP or SDL_WINDOW_POPUP_MENU, and zero or more additional SDL_WindowFlags OR'd together.
Returns
the window that was created or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateWindow
SDL_CreateWindowWithProperties
SDL_DestroyWindow
SDL_GetWindowParent
2578{
2579 SDL_Window *window;
2580 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_CreateProperties();
2581
2582 // Popups must specify either the tooltip or popup menu window flags
2583 if (!(flags & (SDL_WINDOW_TOOLTIP | SDL_WINDOW_POPUP_MENU))) {
2584 SDL_SetError("Popup windows must specify either the 'SDL_WINDOW_TOOLTIP' or the 'SDL_WINDOW_POPUP_MENU' flag");
2585 return NULL;
2586 }
2587
2588 SDL_SetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_PARENT_POINTER, parent);
2589 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_X_NUMBER, offset_x);
2590 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_Y_NUMBER, offset_y);
2591 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, w);
2592 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, h);
2593 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_FLAGS_NUMBER, flags);
2594 window = SDL_CreateWindowWithProperties(props);
2595 SDL_DestroyProperties(props);
2596 return window;
2597}

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateWindow()

SDL_Window * SDL_CreateWindow ( const char * title,
int w,
int h,
SDL_WindowFlags flags )

Create a window with the specified dimensions and flags.

The window size is a request and may be different than expected based on the desktop layout and window manager policies. Your application should be prepared to handle a window of any size.

flags may be any of the following OR'd together:

  • SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN: fullscreen window at desktop resolution
  • SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL: window usable with an OpenGL context
  • SDL_WINDOW_OCCLUDED: window partially or completely obscured by another window
  • SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN: window is not visible
  • SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS: no window decoration
  • SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE: window can be resized
  • SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED: window is minimized
  • SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED: window is maximized
  • SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_GRABBED: window has grabbed mouse focus
  • SDL_WINDOW_INPUT_FOCUS: window has input focus
  • SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_FOCUS: window has mouse focus
  • SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL: window not created by SDL
  • SDL_WINDOW_MODAL: window is modal
  • SDL_WINDOW_HIGH_PIXEL_DENSITY: window uses high pixel density back buffer if possible
  • SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_CAPTURE: window has mouse captured (unrelated to MOUSE_GRABBED)
  • SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP: window should always be above others
  • SDL_WINDOW_UTILITY: window should be treated as a utility window, not showing in the task bar and window list
  • SDL_WINDOW_TOOLTIP: window should be treated as a tooltip and does not get mouse or keyboard focus, requires a parent window
  • SDL_WINDOW_POPUP_MENU: window should be treated as a popup menu, requires a parent window
  • SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED: window has grabbed keyboard input
  • SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN: window usable with a Vulkan instance
  • SDL_WINDOW_METAL: window usable with a Metal instance
  • SDL_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT: window with transparent buffer
  • SDL_WINDOW_NOT_FOCUSABLE: window should not be focusable

The SDL_Window is implicitly shown if SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN is not set.

On Apple's macOS, you must set the NSHighResolutionCapable Info.plist property to YES, otherwise you will not receive a High-DPI OpenGL canvas.

The window pixel size may differ from its window coordinate size if the window is on a high pixel density display. Use SDL_GetWindowSize() to query the client area's size in window coordinates, and SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels() or SDL_GetRenderOutputSize() to query the drawable size in pixels. Note that the drawable size can vary after the window is created and should be queried again if you get an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_PIXEL_SIZE_CHANGED event.

If the window is created with any of the SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL or SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN flags, then the corresponding LoadLibrary function (SDL_GL_LoadLibrary or SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary) is called and the corresponding UnloadLibrary function is called by SDL_DestroyWindow().

If SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN is specified and there isn't a working Vulkan driver, SDL_CreateWindow() will fail, because SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary() will fail.

If SDL_WINDOW_METAL is specified on an OS that does not support Metal, SDL_CreateWindow() will fail.

If you intend to use this window with an SDL_Renderer, you should use SDL_CreateWindowAndRenderer() instead of this function, to avoid window flicker.

On non-Apple devices, SDL requires you to either not link to the Vulkan loader or link to a dynamic library version. This limitation may be removed in a future version of SDL.

Parameters
titlethe title of the window, in UTF-8 encoding.
wthe width of the window.
hthe height of the window.
flags0, or one or more SDL_WindowFlags OR'd together.
Returns
the window that was created or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateWindowAndRenderer
SDL_CreatePopupWindow
SDL_CreateWindowWithProperties
SDL_DestroyWindow
2563{
2564 SDL_Window *window;
2565 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_CreateProperties();
2566 if (title && *title) {
2567 SDL_SetStringProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_TITLE_STRING, title);
2568 }
2569 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, w);
2570 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, h);
2571 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_FLAGS_NUMBER, flags);
2572 window = SDL_CreateWindowWithProperties(props);
2573 SDL_DestroyProperties(props);
2574 return window;
2575}
SDL_SetStringProperty

◆ SDL_CreateWindowFramebuffer()

SDL_Surface * SDL_CreateWindowFramebuffer ( SDL_Window * window)
static
3489{
3490 SDL_PixelFormat format = SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN;
3491 void *pixels = NULL;
3492 int pitch = 0;
3493 bool created_framebuffer = false;
3494 int w, h;
3495
3496 SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels(window, &w, &h);
3497
3498 /* This will switch the video backend from using a software surface to
3499 using a GPU texture through the 2D render API, if we think this would
3500 be more efficient. This only checks once, on demand. */
3501 if (!_this->checked_texture_framebuffer) {
3502 if (ShouldAttemptTextureFramebuffer()) {
3503 if (!SDL_CreateWindowTexture(_this, window, &format, &pixels, &pitch)) {
3504 /* !!! FIXME: if this failed halfway (made renderer, failed to make texture, etc),
3505 !!! FIXME: we probably need to clean this up so it doesn't interfere with
3506 !!! FIXME: a software fallback at the system level (can we blit to an
3507 !!! FIXME: OpenGL window? etc). */
3508 } else {
3509 // future attempts will just try to use a texture framebuffer.
3510 /* !!! FIXME: maybe we shouldn't override these but check if we used a texture
3511 !!! FIXME: framebuffer at the right places; is it feasible we could have an
3512 !!! FIXME: accelerated OpenGL window and a second ends up in software? */
3513 _this->CreateWindowFramebuffer = SDL_CreateWindowTexture;
3514 _this->SetWindowFramebufferVSync = SDL_SetWindowTextureVSync;
3515 _this->GetWindowFramebufferVSync = SDL_GetWindowTextureVSync;
3516 _this->UpdateWindowFramebuffer = SDL_UpdateWindowTexture;
3517 _this->DestroyWindowFramebuffer = SDL_DestroyWindowTexture;
3518 created_framebuffer = true;
3519 }
3520 }
3521
3522 _this->checked_texture_framebuffer = true; // don't check this again.
3523 }
3524
3525 if (!created_framebuffer) {
3526 if (!_this->CreateWindowFramebuffer || !_this->UpdateWindowFramebuffer) {
3527 SDL_SetError("Window framebuffer support not available");
3528 return NULL;
3529 }
3530
3531 if (!_this->CreateWindowFramebuffer(_this, window, &format, &pixels, &pitch)) {
3532 return NULL;
3533 }
3534 }
3535
3536 if (window->surface) {
3537 // We may have gone recursive and already created the surface
3538 return window->surface;
3539 }
3540
3541 return SDL_CreateSurfaceFrom(w, h, format, pixels, pitch);
3542}

◆ SDL_CreateWindowTexture()

bool SDL_CreateWindowTexture ( SDL_VideoDevice * _this,
SDL_Window * window,
SDL_PixelFormat * format,
void ** pixels,
int * pitch )
static
315{
316 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_GetWindowProperties(window);
317 SDL_WindowTextureData *data = (SDL_WindowTextureData *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_TEXTUREDATA_POINTER, NULL);
318 const bool transparent = (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT) ? true : false;
319 int i;
320 int w, h;
321 const SDL_PixelFormat *texture_formats;
322
323 SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels(window, &w, &h);
324
325 if (!data) {
326 SDL_Renderer *renderer = NULL;
327 const char *render_driver = NULL;
328
329 // See if there's a render driver being requested
330 const char *hint = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_FRAMEBUFFER_ACCELERATION);
331 if (hint && *hint != '0' && *hint != '1' &&
332 SDL_strcasecmp(hint, "true") != 0 &&
333 SDL_strcasecmp(hint, "false") != 0 &&
334 SDL_strcasecmp(hint, SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER) != 0) {
335 render_driver = hint;
336 }
337
338 if (!render_driver) {
339 render_driver = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_RENDER_DRIVER);
340 }
341 if (render_driver && SDL_strcasecmp(render_driver, SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER) == 0) {
342 render_driver = NULL;
343 }
344
345 char *render_driver_copy = NULL;
346 if (render_driver && *render_driver) {
347 render_driver_copy = SDL_strdup(render_driver);
348 render_driver = render_driver_copy;
349 if (render_driver_copy) { // turn any "software" requests into "xxxxxxxx" so we don't end up in infinite recursion.
350 char *prev = render_driver_copy;
351 char *ptr = prev;
352 while ((ptr = SDL_strchr(ptr, ',')) != NULL) {
353 *ptr = '\0';
354 const bool is_sw = (SDL_strcasecmp(prev, SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER) == 0);
355 *ptr = ',';
356 if (is_sw) {
357 SDL_memset(prev, 'x', SDL_strlen(SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER));
358 ptr = prev;
359 } else {
360 ptr++;
361 prev = ptr;
362 }
363 }
364
365 if (SDL_strcasecmp(prev, SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER) == 0) {
366 SDL_memset(prev, 'x', SDL_strlen(SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER));
367 }
368 }
369 }
370
371 // Check to see if there's a specific driver requested
372 if (render_driver) {
373 renderer = SDL_CreateRenderer(window, render_driver);
374 SDL_free(render_driver_copy);
375 if (!renderer) {
376 // The error for this specific renderer has already been set
377 return false;
378 }
379 } else {
380 SDL_assert(render_driver_copy == NULL);
381 const int total = SDL_GetNumRenderDrivers();
382 for (i = 0; i < total; ++i) {
383 const char *name = SDL_GetRenderDriver(i);
384 if (name && SDL_strcmp(name, SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER) != 0) {
385 renderer = SDL_CreateRenderer(window, name);
386 if (renderer) {
387 break; // this will work.
388 }
389 }
390 }
391 if (!renderer) {
392 return SDL_SetError("No hardware accelerated renderers available");
393 }
394 }
395
396 SDL_assert(renderer != NULL); // should have explicitly checked this above.
397
398 // Create the data after we successfully create the renderer (bug #1116)
399 data = (SDL_WindowTextureData *)SDL_calloc(1, sizeof(*data));
400 if (!data) {
401 SDL_DestroyRenderer(renderer);
402 return false;
403 }
404 if (!SDL_SetPointerPropertyWithCleanup(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_TEXTUREDATA_POINTER, data, SDL_CleanupWindowTextureData, NULL)) {
405 SDL_DestroyRenderer(renderer);
406 return false;
407 }
408
409 data->renderer = renderer;
410 }
411
412 texture_formats = (const SDL_PixelFormat *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(SDL_GetRendererProperties(data->renderer), SDL_PROP_RENDERER_TEXTURE_FORMATS_POINTER, NULL);
413 if (!texture_formats) {
414 return false;
415 }
416
417 // Free any old texture and pixel data
418 if (data->texture) {
419 SDL_DestroyTexture(data->texture);
420 data->texture = NULL;
421 }
422 SDL_free(data->pixels);
423 data->pixels = NULL;
424
425 // Find the first format with or without an alpha channel
426 *format = texture_formats[0];
427
428 for (i = 0; texture_formats[i] != SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN; ++i) {
429 SDL_PixelFormat texture_format = texture_formats[i];
430 if (!SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC(texture_format) &&
431 !SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(texture_format) &&
432 !SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(texture_format) &&
433 transparent == SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(texture_format)) {
434 *format = texture_format;
435 break;
436 }
437 }
438
439 data->texture = SDL_CreateTexture(data->renderer, *format,
440 SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING,
441 w, h);
442 if (!data->texture) {
443 // codechecker_false_positive [Malloc] Static analyzer doesn't realize allocated `data` is saved to SDL_PROP_WINDOW_TEXTUREDATA_POINTER and not leaked here.
444 return false; // NOLINT(clang-analyzer-unix.Malloc)
445 }
446
447 // Create framebuffer data
448 data->bytes_per_pixel = SDL_BYTESPERPIXEL(*format);
449 data->pitch = (((w * data->bytes_per_pixel) + 3) & ~3);
450
451 {
452 // Make static analysis happy about potential SDL_malloc(0) calls.
453 const size_t allocsize = (size_t)h * data->pitch;
454 data->pixels = SDL_malloc((allocsize > 0) ? allocsize : 1);
455 if (!data->pixels) {
456 return false;
457 }
458 }
459
460 *pixels = data->pixels;
461 *pitch = data->pitch;
462
463 // Make sure we're not double-scaling the viewport
464 SDL_SetRenderViewport(data->renderer, NULL);
465
466 return true;
467}

#define SDL_assert(condition)

References _this, NULL, SDL_assert, SDL_BYTESPERPIXEL, SDL_calloc(), SDL_CleanupWindowTextureData(), SDL_CreateRenderer(), SDL_CreateTexture(), SDL_DestroyRenderer(), SDL_DestroyTexture(), SDL_free(), SDL_GetHint(), SDL_GetNumRenderDrivers(), SDL_GetPointerProperty(), SDL_GetRenderDriver(), SDL_GetRendererProperties(), SDL_GetWindowProperties(), SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels(), SDL_HINT_FRAMEBUFFER_ACCELERATION, SDL_HINT_RENDER_DRIVER, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC, SDL_malloc(), SDL_memset, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_TEXTURE_FORMATS_POINTER, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_TEXTUREDATA_POINTER, SDL_SetError(), SDL_SetPointerPropertyWithCleanup(), SDL_SetRenderViewport(), SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER, SDL_strcasecmp(), SDL_strchr(), SDL_strcmp(), SDL_strdup(), SDL_strlen(), SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING, and SDL_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT.

Referenced by SDL_CreateWindowFramebuffer().

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateWindowWithProperties()

SDL_Window * SDL_CreateWindowWithProperties ( SDL_PropertiesID props)

Create a window with the specified properties.

The window size is a request and may be different than expected based on the desktop layout and window manager policies. Your application should be prepared to handle a window of any size.

These are the supported properties:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_ALWAYS_ON_TOP_BOOLEAN: true if the window should be always on top
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_BORDERLESS_BOOLEAN: true if the window has no window decoration
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_CONSTRAIN_POPUP_BOOLEAN: true if the "tooltip" and "menu" window types should be automatically constrained to be entirely within display bounds (default), false if no constraints on the position are desired.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_EXTERNAL_GRAPHICS_CONTEXT_BOOLEAN: true if the window will be used with an externally managed graphics context.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_FOCUSABLE_BOOLEAN: true if the window should accept keyboard input (defaults true)
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_FULLSCREEN_BOOLEAN: true if the window should start in fullscreen mode at desktop resolution
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER: the height of the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_HIDDEN_BOOLEAN: true if the window should start hidden
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_HIGH_PIXEL_DENSITY_BOOLEAN: true if the window uses a high pixel density buffer if possible
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_MAXIMIZED_BOOLEAN: true if the window should start maximized
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_MENU_BOOLEAN: true if the window is a popup menu
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_METAL_BOOLEAN: true if the window will be used with Metal rendering
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_MINIMIZED_BOOLEAN: true if the window should start minimized
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_MODAL_BOOLEAN: true if the window is modal to its parent
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_MOUSE_GRABBED_BOOLEAN: true if the window starts with grabbed mouse focus
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_OPENGL_BOOLEAN: true if the window will be used with OpenGL rendering
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_PARENT_POINTER: an SDL_Window that will be the parent of this window, required for windows with the "tooltip", "menu", and "modal" properties
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_RESIZABLE_BOOLEAN: true if the window should be resizable
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_TITLE_STRING: the title of the window, in UTF-8 encoding
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_TRANSPARENT_BOOLEAN: true if the window show transparent in the areas with alpha of 0
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_TOOLTIP_BOOLEAN: true if the window is a tooltip
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_UTILITY_BOOLEAN: true if the window is a utility window, not showing in the task bar and window list
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_VULKAN_BOOLEAN: true if the window will be used with Vulkan rendering
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER: the width of the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_X_NUMBER: the x position of the window, or SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED, defaults to SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED. This is relative to the parent for windows with the "tooltip" or "menu" property set.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_Y_NUMBER: the y position of the window, or SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED, defaults to SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED. This is relative to the parent for windows with the "tooltip" or "menu" property set.

These are additional supported properties on macOS:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_COCOA_WINDOW_POINTER: the (__unsafe_unretained) NSWindow associated with the window, if you want to wrap an existing window.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_COCOA_VIEW_POINTER: the (__unsafe_unretained) NSView associated with the window, defaults to [window contentView]

These are additional supported properties on Wayland:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WAYLAND_SURFACE_ROLE_CUSTOM_BOOLEAN - true if the application wants to use the Wayland surface for a custom role and does not want it attached to an XDG toplevel window. See [README-wayland](README-wayland) for more information on using custom surfaces.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WAYLAND_CREATE_EGL_WINDOW_BOOLEAN - true if the application wants an associated wl_egl_window object to be created and attached to the window, even if the window does not have the OpenGL property or SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL flag set.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WAYLAND_WL_SURFACE_POINTER - the wl_surface associated with the window, if you want to wrap an existing window. See [README-wayland](README-wayland) for more information.

These are additional supported properties on Windows:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WIN32_HWND_POINTER: the HWND associated with the window, if you want to wrap an existing window.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WIN32_PIXEL_FORMAT_HWND_POINTER: optional, another window to share pixel format with, useful for OpenGL windows

These are additional supported properties with X11:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_X11_WINDOW_NUMBER: the X11 Window associated with the window, if you want to wrap an existing window.

The window is implicitly shown if the "hidden" property is not set.

These are additional supported properties with Emscripten:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_EMSCRIPTEN_CANVAS_ID_STRING: the id given to the canvas element. This should start with a '#' sign
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_EMSCRIPTEN_KEYBOARD_ELEMENT_STRING: override the binding element for keyboard inputs for this canvas. The variable can be one of:
  • "#window": the javascript window object (default)
  • "#document": the javascript document object
  • "#screen": the javascript window.screen object
  • "#canvas": the WebGL canvas element
  • "#none": Don't bind anything at all
  • any other string without a leading # sign applies to the element on the page with that ID. Windows with the "tooltip" and "menu" properties are popup windows and have the behaviors and guidelines outlined in SDL_CreatePopupWindow().

If this window is being created to be used with an SDL_Renderer, you should not add a graphics API specific property (SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_OPENGL_BOOLEAN, etc), as SDL will handle that internally when it chooses a renderer. However, SDL might need to recreate your window at that point, which may cause the window to appear briefly, and then flicker as it is recreated. The correct approach to this is to create the window with the SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_HIDDEN_BOOLEAN property set to true, then create the renderer, then show the window with SDL_ShowWindow().

Parameters
propsthe properties to use.
Returns
the window that was created or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateProperties
SDL_CreateWindow
SDL_DestroyWindow
2342{
2343 SDL_Window *window;
2344 const char *title = SDL_GetStringProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_TITLE_STRING, NULL);
2345 int x = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_X_NUMBER, SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED);
2346 int y = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_Y_NUMBER, SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED);
2347 int w = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, 0);
2348 int h = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, 0);
2349 SDL_Window *parent = (SDL_Window *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_PARENT_POINTER, NULL);
2350 SDL_WindowFlags flags = SDL_GetWindowFlagProperties(props);
2351 SDL_WindowFlags type_flags, graphics_flags;
2352 bool undefined_x = false;
2353 bool undefined_y = false;
2354 bool external_graphics_context = SDL_GetBooleanProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_EXTERNAL_GRAPHICS_CONTEXT_BOOLEAN, false);
2355
2356 if (!_this) {
2357 // Initialize the video system if needed
2358 if (!SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO)) {
2359 return NULL;
2360 }
2361
2362 // Make clang-tidy happy
2363 if (!_this) {
2364 return NULL;
2365 }
2366 }
2367
2368 if ((flags & SDL_WINDOW_MODAL) && !SDL_ObjectValid(parent, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_WINDOW)) {
2369 SDL_SetError("Modal windows must specify a parent window");
2370 return NULL;
2371 }
2372
2373 if ((flags & (SDL_WINDOW_TOOLTIP | SDL_WINDOW_POPUP_MENU)) != 0) {
2374 if (!(_this->device_caps & VIDEO_DEVICE_CAPS_HAS_POPUP_WINDOW_SUPPORT)) {
2375 SDL_Unsupported();
2376 return NULL;
2377 }
2378
2379 // Tooltip and popup menu window must specify a parent window
2380 if (!SDL_ObjectValid(parent, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_WINDOW)) {
2381 SDL_SetError("Tooltip and popup menu windows must specify a parent window");
2382 return NULL;
2383 }
2384
2385 // Remove invalid flags
2386 flags &= ~(SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED | SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED | SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN | SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS);
2387 }
2388
2389 // Ensure no more than one of these flags is set
2390 type_flags = flags & (SDL_WINDOW_UTILITY | SDL_WINDOW_TOOLTIP | SDL_WINDOW_POPUP_MENU | SDL_WINDOW_MODAL);
2391 if (type_flags & (type_flags - 1)) {
2392 SDL_SetError("Conflicting window type flags specified: 0x%.8x", (unsigned int)type_flags);
2393 return NULL;
2394 }
2395
2396 // Make sure the display list is up to date for window placement
2397 if (_this->RefreshDisplays) {
2398 _this->RefreshDisplays(_this);
2399 }
2400
2401 // Some platforms can't create zero-sized windows
2402 if (w < 1) {
2403 w = 1;
2404 }
2405 if (h < 1) {
2406 h = 1;
2407 }
2408
2409 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(x) || SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(y) ||
2410 SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(x) || SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(y)) {
2411 SDL_DisplayID displayID = 0;
2412 SDL_Rect bounds;
2413
2414 if ((SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(x) || SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(x)) && (x & 0xFFFF)) {
2415 displayID = (x & 0xFFFF);
2416 } else if ((SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(y) || SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(y)) && (y & 0xFFFF)) {
2417 displayID = (y & 0xFFFF);
2418 }
2419 if (displayID == 0 || SDL_GetDisplayIndex(displayID) < 0) {
2420 displayID = SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay();
2421 }
2422
2423 SDL_zero(bounds);
2424 SDL_GetDisplayUsableBounds(displayID, &bounds);
2425 if (w > bounds.w || h > bounds.h) {
2426 // This window is larger than the usable bounds, just center on the display
2427 SDL_GetDisplayBounds(displayID, &bounds);
2428 }
2429 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(x) || SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(x)) {
2430 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(x)) {
2431 undefined_x = true;
2432 }
2433 x = bounds.x + (bounds.w - w) / 2;
2434 }
2435 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(y) || SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(y)) {
2436 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(y)) {
2437 undefined_y = true;
2438 }
2439 y = bounds.y + (bounds.h - h) / 2;
2440 }
2441 }
2442
2443 // ensure no more than one of these flags is set
2444 graphics_flags = flags & (SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL | SDL_WINDOW_METAL | SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN);
2445 if (graphics_flags & (graphics_flags - 1)) {
2446 SDL_SetError("Conflicting window graphics flags specified: 0x%.8x", (unsigned int)graphics_flags);
2447 return NULL;
2448 }
2449
2450 // Some platforms have certain graphics backends enabled by default
2451 if (!graphics_flags && !external_graphics_context) {
2452 flags |= SDL_DefaultGraphicsBackends(_this);
2453 }
2454
2455 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) {
2456 if (!_this->GL_CreateContext) {
2457 SDL_ContextNotSupported("OpenGL");
2458 return NULL;
2459 }
2460 if (!SDL_GL_LoadLibrary(NULL)) {
2461 return NULL;
2462 }
2463 }
2464
2465 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN) {
2466 if (!_this->Vulkan_CreateSurface) {
2467 SDL_ContextNotSupported("Vulkan");
2468 return NULL;
2469 }
2470 if (!SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary(NULL)) {
2471 return NULL;
2472 }
2473 }
2474
2475 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_METAL) {
2476 if (!_this->Metal_CreateView) {
2477 SDL_ContextNotSupported("Metal");
2478 return NULL;
2479 }
2480 }
2481
2482 window = (SDL_Window *)SDL_calloc(1, sizeof(*window));
2483 if (!window) {
2484 return NULL;
2485 }
2486 SDL_SetObjectValid(window, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_WINDOW, true);
2487 window->id = SDL_GetNextObjectID();
2488 window->floating.x = window->windowed.x = window->x = x;
2489 window->floating.y = window->windowed.y = window->y = y;
2490 window->floating.w = window->windowed.w = window->w = w;
2491 window->floating.h = window->windowed.h = window->h = h;
2492 window->undefined_x = undefined_x;
2493 window->undefined_y = undefined_y;
2494
2495 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = SDL_GetVideoDisplayForWindow(window);
2496 if (display) {
2497 SDL_SetWindowHDRProperties(window, &display->HDR, false);
2498 }
2499
2500 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN || IsFullscreenOnly(_this)) {
2501 SDL_Rect bounds;
2502
2503 SDL_GetDisplayBounds(display ? display->id : SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay(), &bounds);
2504 window->x = bounds.x;
2505 window->y = bounds.y;
2506 window->w = bounds.w;
2507 window->h = bounds.h;
2508 window->pending_flags |= SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN;
2509 flags |= SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN;
2510 }
2511
2512 window->flags = ((flags & CREATE_FLAGS) | SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN);
2513 window->display_scale = 1.0f;
2514 window->opacity = 1.0f;
2515 window->next = _this->windows;
2516 window->is_destroying = false;
2517 window->last_displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(window);
2518 window->external_graphics_context = external_graphics_context;
2519 window->constrain_popup = SDL_GetBooleanProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_CREATE_CONSTRAIN_POPUP_BOOLEAN, true);
2520
2521 if (_this->windows) {
2522 _this->windows->prev = window;
2523 }
2524 _this->windows = window;
2525
2526 // Set the parent before creation.
2527 SDL_UpdateWindowHierarchy(window, parent);
2528
2529 if (_this->CreateSDLWindow && !_this->CreateSDLWindow(_this, window, props)) {
2530 PUSH_SDL_ERROR()
2531 SDL_DestroyWindow(window);
2532 POP_SDL_ERROR()
2533 return NULL;
2534 }
2535
2536 /* Clear minimized if not on windows, only windows handles it at create rather than FinishWindowCreation,
2537 * but it's important or window focus will get broken on windows!
2538 */
2539#if !defined(SDL_PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
2540 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED) {
2541 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED;
2542 }
2543#endif
2544
2545 if (title) {
2546 SDL_SetWindowTitle(window, title);
2547 }
2548 SDL_FinishWindowCreation(window, flags);
2549
2550 // Make sure window pixel size is up to date
2551 SDL_CheckWindowPixelSizeChanged(window);
2552
2553#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_DRIVER_UIKIT
2554 SDL_UpdateLifecycleObserver();
2555#endif
2556
2557 SDL_ClearError();
2558
2559 return window;
2560}

281{
282#if (defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL) && defined(SDL_PLATFORM_MACOS)) || (defined(SDL_PLATFORM_IOS) && !TARGET_OS_MACCATALYST)
283 if (_this->GL_CreateContext) {
284 return SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL;
285 }
286#endif
287#if defined(SDL_VIDEO_METAL) && (TARGET_OS_MACCATALYST || defined(SDL_PLATFORM_MACOS) || defined(SDL_PLATFORM_IOS))

289 return SDL_WINDOW_METAL;

291#endif

294 return SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL;

296#endif
297 return 0;

◆ SDL_DelVideoDisplay()

void SDL_DelVideoDisplay ( SDL_DisplayID displayID,
bool send_event )
915{
916 SDL_VideoDisplay *display;
917 int display_index = SDL_GetDisplayIndex(displayID);
918 if (display_index < 0) {
919 return;
920 }
921
922 display = _this->displays[display_index];
923
924 if (send_event) {
925 SDL_SendDisplayEvent(display, SDL_EVENT_DISPLAY_REMOVED, 0, 0);
926 }
927
928 SDL_DestroyProperties(display->props);
929 SDL_free(display->name);
930 SDL_ResetFullscreenDisplayModes(display);
931 SDL_free(display->desktop_mode.internal);
932 display->desktop_mode.internal = NULL;
933 SDL_free(display->internal);
934 display->internal = NULL;
935 SDL_free(display);
936
937 if (display_index < (_this->num_displays - 1)) {
938 SDL_memmove(&_this->displays[display_index], &_this->displays[display_index + 1], (_this->num_displays - display_index - 1) * sizeof(_this->displays[display_index]));
939 }
940 --_this->num_displays;
941
942 SDL_UpdateDesktopBounds();
943}

◆ SDL_DestroyWindow()

void SDL_DestroyWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Destroy a window.

Any child windows owned by the window will be recursively destroyed as well.

Note that on some platforms, the visible window may not actually be removed from the screen until the SDL event loop is pumped again, even though the SDL_Window is no longer valid after this call.

Parameters
windowthe window to destroy.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreatePopupWindow
SDL_CreateWindow
SDL_CreateWindowWithProperties
4329{
4330 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window,);
4331
4332 window->is_destroying = true;
4333
4334 // Destroy any child windows of this window
4335 while (window->first_child) {
4336 SDL_DestroyWindow(window->first_child);
4337 }
4338
4339 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_DESTROYED, 0, 0);
4340
4341 SDL_Renderer *renderer = SDL_GetRenderer(window);
4342 if (renderer) {
4343 SDL_DestroyRendererWithoutFreeing(renderer);
4344 }
4345
4346 // Restore video mode, etc.
4347 SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(window, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_LEAVE, true);
4348 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL)) {
4349 SDL_HideWindow(window);
4350 }
4351
4352 SDL_DestroyProperties(window->text_input_props);
4353 SDL_DestroyProperties(window->props);
4354
4355 /* Clear the modal status, but don't unset the parent just yet, as it
4356 * may be needed later in the destruction process if a backend needs
4357 * to update the input focus.
4358 */
4359 if (_this->SetWindowModal && (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_MODAL)) {
4360 _this->SetWindowModal(_this, window, false);
4361 }
4362
4363 // Make sure the destroyed window isn't referenced by any display as a fullscreen window.
4364 for (int i = 0; i < _this->num_displays; ++i) {
4365 if (_this->displays[i]->fullscreen_window == window) {
4366 _this->displays[i]->fullscreen_window = NULL;
4367 }
4368 }
4369
4370 // Make sure this window no longer has focus
4371 if (SDL_GetKeyboardFocus() == window) {
4372 SDL_SetKeyboardFocus(NULL);
4373 }
4374 if ((window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_CAPTURE)) {
4375 SDL_UpdateMouseCapture(true);
4376 }
4377 if (SDL_GetMouseFocus() == window) {
4378 SDL_SetMouseFocus(NULL);
4379 }
4380
4381 SDL_DestroyWindowSurface(window);
4382
4383 // Make no context current if this is the current context window
4384 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) {
4385 if (_this->current_glwin == window) {
4386 SDL_GL_MakeCurrent(window, NULL);
4387 }
4388 }
4389
4390 if (_this->DestroyWindow) {
4391 _this->DestroyWindow(_this, window);
4392 }
4393
4394 // Unload the graphics libraries after the window is destroyed, which may clean up EGL surfaces
4395 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) {
4396 SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary();
4397 }
4398 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN) {
4399 SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary();
4400 }
4401
4402 if (_this->grabbed_window == window) {
4403 _this->grabbed_window = NULL; // ungrabbing input.
4404 }
4405
4406 if (_this->current_glwin == window) {
4407 _this->current_glwin = NULL;
4408 }
4409
4410 SDL_CompareAndSwapAtomicPointer(&_this->wakeup_window, window, NULL);
4411
4412 // Now invalidate magic
4413 SDL_SetObjectValid(window, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_WINDOW, false);
4414
4415 // Free memory associated with the window
4416 SDL_free(window->title);
4417 SDL_DestroySurface(window->icon);
4418
4419 // Unlink the window from its siblings.
4420 SDL_UpdateWindowHierarchy(window, NULL);
4421
4422 // Unlink the window from the global window list
4423 if (window->next) {
4424 window->next->prev = window->prev;
4425 }
4426 if (window->prev) {
4427 window->prev->next = window->next;
4428 } else {
4429 _this->windows = window->next;
4430 }
4431
4432 SDL_free(window->renderers);
4433 SDL_free(window);
4434
4435#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_DRIVER_UIKIT
4436 SDL_UpdateLifecycleObserver();
4437#endif
4438}

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_CompareAndSwapAtomicPointer(void **a, void *oldval, void *newval)

◆ SDL_DisableScreenSaver()

bool SDL_DisableScreenSaver ( void )

Prevent the screen from being blanked by a screen saver.

If you disable the screensaver, it is automatically re-enabled when SDL quits.

The screensaver is disabled by default, but this may by changed by SDL_HINT_VIDEO_ALLOW_SCREENSAVER.

Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_EnableScreenSaver
SDL_ScreenSaverEnabled
4465{
4466 if (!_this) {
4467 return SDL_UninitializedVideo();
4468 }
4469 if (_this->suspend_screensaver) {
4470 return true;
4471 }
4472 _this->suspend_screensaver = true;
4473 if (_this->SuspendScreenSaver) {
4474 return _this->SuspendScreenSaver(_this);
4475 }
4476
4477 return SDL_Unsupported();
4478}

◆ SDL_EGL_GetProcAddress()

SDL_FunctionPointer SDL_EGL_GetProcAddress ( const char * proc)

Get an EGL library function by name.

If an EGL library is loaded, this function allows applications to get entry points for EGL functions. This is useful to provide to an EGL API and extension loader.

Parameters
procthe name of an EGL function.
Returns
a pointer to the named EGL function. The returned pointer should be cast to the appropriate function signature.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_EGL_GetCurrentDisplay
4577{
4578#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL_EGL
4579 SDL_FunctionPointer func;
4580
4581 if (!_this) {
4582 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
4583 return NULL;
4584 }
4585 func = NULL;
4586
4587 if (_this->egl_data) {
4588 func = SDL_EGL_GetProcAddressInternal(_this, proc);
4589 } else {
4590 SDL_SetError("No EGL library has been loaded");
4591 }
4592
4593 return func;
4594#else
4595 SDL_SetError("SDL was not built with EGL support");
4596 return NULL;
4597#endif
4598}

◆ SDL_EGL_SetAttributeCallbacks()

void SDL_EGL_SetAttributeCallbacks ( SDL_EGLAttribArrayCallback platformAttribCallback,
SDL_EGLIntArrayCallback surfaceAttribCallback,
SDL_EGLIntArrayCallback contextAttribCallback,
void * userdata )

Sets the callbacks for defining custom EGLAttrib arrays for EGL initialization.

Callbacks that aren't needed can be set to NULL.

NOTE: These callback pointers will be reset after SDL_GL_ResetAttributes.

Parameters
platformAttribCallbackcallback for attributes to pass to eglGetPlatformDisplay. May be NULL.
surfaceAttribCallbackcallback for attributes to pass to eglCreateSurface. May be NULL.
contextAttribCallbackcallback for attributes to pass to eglCreateContext. May be NULL.
userdataa pointer that is passed to the callbacks.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
4750{
4751 if (!_this) {
4752 return;
4753 }
4754 _this->egl_platformattrib_callback = platformAttribCallback;
4755 _this->egl_surfaceattrib_callback = surfaceAttribCallback;
4756 _this->egl_contextattrib_callback = contextAttribCallback;
4757 _this->egl_attrib_callback_userdata = userdata;
4758}

References _this.

◆ SDL_EnableScreenSaver()

SDL_ScreenSaverEnabled

4451 return SDL_UninitializedVideo();
4452 }

◆ SDL_FinalizeDisplayMode()

void SDL_FinalizeDisplayMode ( SDL_DisplayMode * mode)
static
812{
813 // Make sure all the fields are set up correctly
814 if (mode->pixel_density <= 0.0f) {
815 mode->pixel_density = 1.0f;
816 }
817
818 if (mode->refresh_rate_numerator > 0) {
819 if (mode->refresh_rate_denominator <= 0) {
820 mode->refresh_rate_denominator = 1;
821 }
822 mode->refresh_rate = ((100 * (Sint64)mode->refresh_rate_numerator) / mode->refresh_rate_denominator) / 100.0f;
823 } else {
824 SDL_CalculateFraction(mode->refresh_rate, &mode->refresh_rate_numerator, &mode->refresh_rate_denominator);
825 mode->refresh_rate = (int)(mode->refresh_rate * 100) / 100.0f;
826 }
827}
Sint64
int64_t Sint64

◆ SDL_GetClosestFullscreenDisplayMode()

bool SDL_GetClosestFullscreenDisplayMode ( SDL_DisplayID displayID,
int w,
int h,
float refresh_rate,
bool include_high_density_modes,
SDL_DisplayMode * closest )

Get the closest match to the requested display mode.

The available display modes are scanned and closest is filled in with the closest mode matching the requested mode and returned. The mode format and refresh rate default to the desktop mode if they are set to 0. The modes are scanned with size being first priority, format being second priority, and finally checking the refresh rate. If all the available modes are too small, then false is returned.

Parameters
displayIDthe instance ID of the display to query.
wthe width in pixels of the desired display mode.
hthe height in pixels of the desired display mode.
refresh_ratethe refresh rate of the desired display mode, or 0.0f for the desktop refresh rate.
include_high_density_modesboolean to include high density modes in the search.
closesta pointer filled in with the closest display mode equal to or larger than the desired mode.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetDisplays
SDL_GetFullscreenDisplayModes
1363{
1364 if (!result) {
1365 return SDL_InvalidParamError("closest"); // Parameter `result` is called `closest` in the header.
1366 }
1367
1368 const SDL_DisplayMode *mode, *closest = NULL;
1369 float aspect_ratio;
1370 int i;
1371 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = SDL_GetVideoDisplay(displayID);
1372
1373 SDL_zerop(result);
1374
1375 CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC(display, false);
1376
1377 if (h > 0) {
1378 aspect_ratio = (float)w / h;
1379 } else {
1380 aspect_ratio = 1.0f;
1381 }
1382
1383 if (refresh_rate == 0.0f) {
1384 refresh_rate = display->desktop_mode.refresh_rate;
1385 }
1386
1387 SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes(display);
1388
1389 for (i = 0; i < display->num_fullscreen_modes; ++i) {
1390 mode = &display->fullscreen_modes[i];
1391
1392 if (w > mode->w) {
1393 // Out of sorted modes large enough here
1394 break;
1395 }
1396 if (h > mode->h) {
1397 /* Wider, but not tall enough, due to a different aspect ratio.
1398 * This mode must be skipped, but closer modes may still follow */
1399 continue;
1400 }
1401 if (mode->pixel_density > 1.0f && !include_high_density_modes) {
1402 continue;
1403 }
1404 if (closest) {
1405 float current_aspect_ratio = (float)mode->w / mode->h;
1406 float closest_aspect_ratio = (float)closest->w / closest->h;
1407 if (SDL_fabsf(aspect_ratio - closest_aspect_ratio) < SDL_fabsf(aspect_ratio - current_aspect_ratio)) {
1408 // The mode we already found has a better aspect ratio match
1409 continue;
1410 }
1411
1412 if (mode->w == closest->w && mode->h == closest->h &&
1413 SDL_fabsf(closest->refresh_rate - refresh_rate) < SDL_fabsf(mode->refresh_rate - refresh_rate)) {
1414 /* We already found a mode and the new mode is further from our
1415 * refresh rate target */
1416 continue;
1417 }
1418 }
1419
1420 closest = mode;
1421 }
1422 if (!closest) {
1423 return SDL_SetError("Couldn't find any matching video modes");
1424 }
1425
1426 SDL_copyp(result, closest);
1427
1428 return true;
1429}
SDL_InvalidParamError
#define SDL_InvalidParamError(param)
Definition SDL_error.h:216
SDL_fabsf
SDL_DECLSPEC float SDLCALL SDL_fabsf(float x)
Definition SDL_stdlib.c:208
SDL_zerop
#define SDL_zerop(x)
Definition SDL_stdinc.h:2626
CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC
#define CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC(display, result)
Definition SDL_video.c:165
SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes
static void SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes(SDL_VideoDisplay *display)
Definition SDL_video.c:1207
SDL_GetVideoDisplay
SDL_VideoDisplay * SDL_GetVideoDisplay(SDL_DisplayID displayID)
Definition SDL_video.c:977

References CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC, SDL_DisplayMode::h, NULL, SDL_DisplayMode::pixel_density, SDL_DisplayMode::refresh_rate, SDL_copyp, SDL_fabsf(), SDL_GetVideoDisplay(), SDL_InvalidParamError, SDL_SetError(), SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes(), SDL_zerop, and SDL_DisplayMode::w.

void SDL_GetClosestPointOnRect ( const SDL_Rect * rect,
SDL_Point * point )
static

If x, y are outside of rect, snaps them to the closest point inside rect (between rect->x, rect->y, inclusive, and rect->x + w, rect->y + h, exclusive)

1544{
1545 const int right = rect->x + rect->w - 1;
1546 const int bottom = rect->y + rect->h - 1;
1547
1548 if (point->x < rect->x) {
1549 point->x = rect->x;
1550 } else if (point->x > right) {
1551 point->x = right;
1552 }
1553

1555 point->y = rect->y;

1558 }

◆ SDL_GetCurrentDisplayMode()

const SDL_DisplayMode * SDL_GetCurrentDisplayMode ( SDL_DisplayID displayID)

Get information about the current display mode.

There's a difference between this function and SDL_GetDesktopDisplayMode() when SDL runs fullscreen and has changed the resolution. In that case this function will return the current display mode, and not the previous native display mode.

Parameters
displayIDthe instance ID of the display to query.
Returns
a pointer to the desktop display mode or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

◆ SDL_GetCurrentVideoDriver()

const char * SDL_GetCurrentVideoDriver ( void )

Get the name of the currently initialized video driver.

The names of drivers are all simple, low-ASCII identifiers, like "cocoa", "x11" or "windows". These never have Unicode characters, and are not meant to be proper names.

Returns
the name of the current video driver or NULL if no driver has been initialized.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetNumVideoDrivers

757 return NULL;
758 }

◆ SDL_GetDisplayBounds()

bool SDL_GetDisplayBounds ( SDL_DisplayID displayID,
SDL_Rect * rect )

Get the desktop area represented by a display.

The primary display is often located at (0,0), but may be placed at a different location depending on monitor layout.

rectthe SDL_Rect structure filled in with the display bounds.

SDL_GetDisplays
1056{
1057 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = SDL_GetVideoDisplay(displayID);
1058
1059 CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC(display, false);
1060
1061 if (!rect) {
1062 return SDL_InvalidParamError("rect");
1063 }
1064
1065 if (_this->GetDisplayBounds) {
1066 if (_this->GetDisplayBounds(_this, display, rect)) {
1067 return true;
1068 }
1069 }
1070
1071 // Assume that the displays are left to right
1072 if (displayID == SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay()) {
1073 rect->x = 0;
1074 rect->y = 0;
1075 } else {
1076 SDL_GetDisplayBounds(_this->displays[SDL_GetDisplayIndex(displayID) - 1]->id, rect);
1077 rect->x += rect->w;
1078 }
1079 rect->w = display->current_mode->w;
1080 rect->h = display->current_mode->h;
1081 return true;
1082}

◆ SDL_GetDisplayContentScale()

float SDL_GetDisplayContentScale ( SDL_DisplayID displayID)

Get the content scale of a display.

The content scale is the expected scale for content based on the DPI settings of the display. For example, a 4K display might have a 2.0 (200%) display scale, which means that the user expects UI elements to be twice as big on this display, to aid in readability.

After window creation, SDL_GetWindowDisplayScale() should be used to query the content scale factor for individual windows instead of querying the display for a window and calling this function, as the per-window content scale factor may differ from the base value of the display it is on, particularly on high-DPI and/or multi-monitor desktop configurations.

Parameters
displayIDthe instance ID of the display to query.
Returns
the content scale of the display, or 0.0f on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowDisplayScale
SDL_GetDisplays
1160{
1161 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = SDL_GetVideoDisplay(displayID);
1162
1163 CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC(display, 0.0f);
1164
1165 return display->content_scale;
1166}

References CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC, and SDL_GetVideoDisplay().

Referenced by SDL_CheckWindowDisplayScaleChanged().

Thread Safety

Since

See also
SDL_GetDisplayBounds
SDL_GetDisplays
1743{
1744 SDL_DisplayID displayID = 0;
1745
1746 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, 0);
1747
1748 /* sdl2-compat calls this function to get a display on which to make the window fullscreen,
1749 * so pass it the preferred fullscreen display ID in a property.
1750 */
1751 SDL_PropertiesID window_props = SDL_GetWindowProperties(window);
1752 SDL_VideoDisplay *fs_display = SDL_GetVideoDisplayForFullscreenWindow(window);
1753 if (fs_display) {
1754 SDL_SetNumberProperty(window_props, SDL_PROP_SDL2_COMPAT_WINDOW_PREFERRED_FULLSCREEN_DISPLAY, fs_display->id);
1755 } else {
1756 SDL_ClearProperty(window_props, SDL_PROP_SDL2_COMPAT_WINDOW_PREFERRED_FULLSCREEN_DISPLAY);
1757 }
1758
1759 // An explicit fullscreen display overrides all
1760 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) {
1761 displayID = window->current_fullscreen_mode.displayID;
1762 }
1763
1764 if (!displayID) {
1765 displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindowPosition(window);
1766 }
1767 return displayID;
1768}

◆ SDL_GetDisplayForWindowPosition()

SDL_DisplayID SDL_GetDisplayForWindowPosition ( SDL_Window * window)
1673{
1674 int x, y;
1675 SDL_DisplayID displayID = 0;
1676
1677 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, 0);
1678
1679 if (_this->GetDisplayForWindow) {
1680 displayID = _this->GetDisplayForWindow(_this, window);
1681 }
1682
1683 /* A backend implementation may fail to get a display for the window
1684 * (for example if the window is off-screen), but other code may expect it
1685 * to succeed in that situation, so we fall back to a generic position-
1686 * based implementation in that case. */
1687 SDL_RelativeToGlobalForWindow(window, window->x, window->y, &x, &y);
1688
1689 if (!displayID) {
1690 /* Fullscreen windows may be larger than the display if they were moved between differently sized
1691 * displays and the new position was received before the new size or vice versa. Using the center
1692 * of the window rect in this case can report the wrong display, so use the origin.
1693 */
1694 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) {
1695 displayID = GetDisplayForRect(x, y, 1, 1);
1696 } else {
1697 displayID = GetDisplayForRect(x, y, window->w, window->h);
1698 }
1699 }
1700 if (!displayID) {
1701 // Use the primary display for a window if we can't find it anywhere else
1702 displayID = SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay();
1703 }
1704 return displayID;
1705}
SDL_RelativeToGlobalForWindow
void SDL_RelativeToGlobalForWindow(SDL_Window *window, int rel_x, int rel_y, int *abs_x, int *abs_y)
Definition SDL_video.c:1604

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, GetDisplayForRect(), SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay(), SDL_RelativeToGlobalForWindow(), and SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN.

Referenced by SDL_CheckWindowDisplayChanged(), SDL_CheckWindowDisplayScaleChanged(), SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(), and SDL_OnWindowDisplayChanged().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_GetDisplayIndex()

int SDL_GetDisplayIndex ( SDL_DisplayID displayID)
1003{
1004 int display_index;
1005
1006 if (!_this) {
1007 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
1008 return -1;
1009 }
1010
1011 for (display_index = 0; display_index < _this->num_displays; ++display_index) {
1012 if (displayID == _this->displays[display_index]->id) {
1013 return display_index;
1014 }
1015 }
1016 SDL_SetError("Invalid display");
1017 return -1;
1018}

◆ SDL_GetDisplayName()

const char * SDL_GetDisplayName ( SDL_DisplayID displayID)

Get the name of a display in UTF-8 encoding.

Parameters
displayIDthe instance ID of the display to query.
Returns
the name of a display or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetDisplays

References CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC, NULL, and SDL_GetVideoDisplay().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_GetDisplayProperties()

SDL_PropertiesID SDL_GetDisplayProperties ( SDL_DisplayID displayID)

Get the properties associated with a display.

The following read-only properties are provided by SDL:

  • SDL_PROP_DISPLAY_HDR_ENABLED_BOOLEAN: true if the display has HDR headroom above the SDR white point. This is for informational and diagnostic purposes only, as not all platforms provide this information at the display level.

On KMS/DRM:

  • SDL_PROP_DISPLAY_KMSDRM_PANEL_ORIENTATION_NUMBER: the "panel orientation" property for the display in degrees of clockwise rotation. Note that this is provided only as a hint, and the application is responsible for any coordinate transformations needed to conform to the requested display orientation.

On Wayland:

  • SDL_PROP_DISPLAY_WAYLAND_WL_OUTPUT_POINTER: the wl_output associated with the display
Parameters
displayIDthe instance ID of the display to query.
Returns
a valid property ID on success or 0 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
1035{
1036 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = SDL_GetVideoDisplay(displayID);
1037
1038 CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC(display, 0);
1039
1040 if (display->props == 0) {
1041 display->props = SDL_CreateProperties();
1042 }
1043 return display->props;
1044}

◆ SDL_GetDisplays()

SDL_DisplayID * SDL_GetDisplays ( int * count)

Get a list of currently connected displays.

Parameters
counta pointer filled in with the number of displays returned, may be NULL.
Returns
a 0 terminated array of display instance IDs or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information. This should be freed with SDL_free() when it is no longer needed.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
946{
947 int i;
948 SDL_DisplayID *displays;
949
950 if (!_this) {
951 if (count) {
952 *count = 0;
953 }
954
955 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
956 return NULL;
957 }
958
959 displays = (SDL_DisplayID *)SDL_malloc((_this->num_displays + 1) * sizeof(*displays));
960 if (displays) {
961 if (count) {
962 *count = _this->num_displays;
963 }
964
965 for (i = 0; i < _this->num_displays; ++i) {
966 displays[i] = _this->displays[i]->id;
967 }
968 displays[i] = 0;
969 } else {
970 if (count) {
971 *count = 0;
972 }
973 }
974 return displays;
975}

◆ SDL_GetDisplayUsableBounds()

bool SDL_GetDisplayUsableBounds ( SDL_DisplayID displayID,
SDL_Rect * rect )

Get the usable desktop area represented by a display, in screen coordinates.

This is the same area as SDL_GetDisplayBounds() reports, but with portions reserved by the system removed. For example, on Apple's macOS, this subtracts the area occupied by the menu bar and dock.

Setting a window to be fullscreen generally bypasses these unusable areas, so these are good guidelines for the maximum space available to a non-fullscreen window.

Parameters
displayIDthe instance ID of the display to query.
rectthe SDL_Rect structure filled in with the display bounds.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetDisplayBounds
SDL_GetDisplays
1091{
1092 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = SDL_GetVideoDisplay(displayID);
1093
1094 CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC(display, false);
1095
1096 if (!rect) {
1097 return SDL_InvalidParamError("rect");
1098 }
1099
1100 if (displayID == SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay() && ParseDisplayUsableBoundsHint(rect)) {
1101 return true;
1102 }
1103
1104 if (_this->GetDisplayUsableBounds) {
1105 if (_this->GetDisplayUsableBounds(_this, display, rect)) {
1106 return true;
1107 }
1108 }
1109
1110 // Oh well, just give the entire display bounds.
1111 return SDL_GetDisplayBounds(displayID, rect);
1112}
ParseDisplayUsableBoundsHint

◆ SDL_GetFullscreenDisplayModes()

SDL_DisplayMode ** SDL_GetFullscreenDisplayModes ( SDL_DisplayID displayID,
int * count )

Get a list of fullscreen display modes available on a display.

The display modes are sorted in this priority:

  • w -> largest to smallest
  • h -> largest to smallest
  • bits per pixel -> more colors to fewer colors
  • packed pixel layout -> largest to smallest
  • refresh rate -> highest to lowest
  • pixel density -> lowest to highest
Parameters
displayIDthe instance ID of the display to query.
counta pointer filled in with the number of display modes returned, may be NULL.
Returns
a NULL terminated array of display mode pointers or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information. This is a single allocation that should be freed with SDL_free() when it is no longer needed.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetDisplays
1327{
1328 int i;
1329 int num_modes;
1330 SDL_DisplayMode **result;
1331 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = SDL_GetVideoDisplay(displayID);
1332
1333 if (count) {
1334 *count = 0;
1335 }
1336
1337 CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC(display, NULL);
1338
1339 SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes(display);
1340
1341 num_modes = display->num_fullscreen_modes;
1342 result = (SDL_DisplayMode **)SDL_malloc((num_modes + 1) * sizeof(*result) + num_modes * sizeof(**result));
1343 if (result) {
1344 SDL_DisplayMode *modes = (SDL_DisplayMode *)((Uint8 *)result + ((num_modes + 1) * sizeof(*result)));
1345 SDL_memcpy(modes, display->fullscreen_modes, num_modes * sizeof(*modes));
1346 for (i = 0; i < num_modes; ++i) {
1347 result[i] = modes++;
1348 }
1349 result[i] = NULL;
1350
1351 if (count) {
1352 *count = num_modes;
1353 }
1354 } else {
1355 if (count) {
1356 *count = 0;
1357 }
1358 }
1359 return result;
1360}
Uint8
uint8_t Uint8
Definition SDL_stdinc.h:425

References CHECK_DISPLAY_MAGIC, count, NULL, SDL_GetVideoDisplay(), SDL_malloc(), SDL_memcpy, and SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes().

◆ SDL_GetFullscreenModeMatch()

const SDL_DisplayMode * SDL_GetFullscreenModeMatch ( const SDL_DisplayMode * mode)
static
1216{
1217 SDL_VideoDisplay *display;
1218 SDL_DisplayMode fullscreen_mode;
1219
1220 if (mode->w <= 0 || mode->h <= 0) {
1221 // Use the desktop mode
1222 return NULL;
1223 }
1224
1225 SDL_memcpy(&fullscreen_mode, mode, sizeof(fullscreen_mode));
1226 if (fullscreen_mode.displayID == 0) {
1227 fullscreen_mode.displayID = SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay();
1228 }
1229 SDL_FinalizeDisplayMode(&fullscreen_mode);
1230
1231 mode = NULL;
1232
1233 display = SDL_GetVideoDisplay(fullscreen_mode.displayID);
1234 if (display) {
1235 SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes(display);
1236
1237 // Search for an exact match
1238 if (!mode) {
1239 for (int i = 0; i < display->num_fullscreen_modes; ++i) {
1240 if (SDL_memcmp(&fullscreen_mode, &display->fullscreen_modes[i], sizeof(fullscreen_mode)) == 0) {
1241 mode = &display->fullscreen_modes[i];
1242 break;
1243 }
1244 }
1245 }
1246
1247 // Search for a mode with the same characteristics
1248 if (!mode) {
1249 for (int i = 0; i < display->num_fullscreen_modes; ++i) {
1250 if (cmpmodes(&fullscreen_mode, &display->fullscreen_modes[i]) == 0) {
1251 mode = &display->fullscreen_modes[i];
1252 break;
1253 }
1254 }
1255 }
1256 }
1257 return mode;
1258}

References cmpmodes(), SDL_DisplayMode::displayID, SDL_DisplayMode::h, NULL, SDL_FinalizeDisplayMode(), SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay(), SDL_GetVideoDisplay(), SDL_memcmp(), SDL_memcpy, SDL_UpdateFullscreenDisplayModes(), and SDL_DisplayMode::w.

◆ SDL_GetNumVideoDrivers()

int SDL_GetNumVideoDrivers ( void )

Get the number of video drivers compiled into SDL.

Returns
the number of built in video drivers.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetVideoDriver
571{
572 static int num_drivers = -1;
573
574 if (num_drivers >= 0) {
575 return num_drivers;
576 }
577
578 num_drivers = 0;
579
580 // Build a list of unique video drivers.
581 for (int i = 0; bootstrap[i] != NULL; ++i) {
582 bool duplicate = false;
583 for (int j = 0; j < i; ++j) {
584 if (SDL_strcmp(bootstrap[i]->name, bootstrap[j]->name) == 0) {
585 duplicate = true;
586 break;
587 }
588 }
589
590 if (!duplicate) {
591 deduped_bootstrap[num_drivers++] = bootstrap[i];
592 }
593 }
594
595 return num_drivers;
596}

◆ SDL_GetVideoDisplayForFullscreenWindow()

SDL_VideoDisplay * SDL_GetVideoDisplayForFullscreenWindow ( SDL_Window * window)
1708{
1709 SDL_DisplayID displayID = 0;
1710
1711 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, 0);
1712
1713 // An explicit fullscreen display overrides all
1714 if (window->current_fullscreen_mode.displayID) {
1715 displayID = window->current_fullscreen_mode.displayID;
1716 }
1717
1718 /* This is used to handle the very common pattern of SDL_SetWindowPosition()
1719 * followed immediately by SDL_SetWindowFullscreen() to make the window fullscreen
1720 * desktop on a specific display. If the backend doesn't support changing the
1721 * window position, or an async window manager hasn't yet actually moved the window,
1722 * the current position won't be updated at the time of the fullscreen call.
1723 */
1724 if (!displayID) {
1725 // Use the pending position and dimensions, if available, otherwise, use the current.
1726 const int x = window->last_position_pending ? window->pending.x : window->x;
1727 const int y = window->last_position_pending ? window->pending.y : window->y;
1728 const int w = window->last_size_pending ? window->pending.w : window->w;
1729 const int h = window->last_size_pending ? window->pending.h : window->h;
1730
1731 displayID = GetDisplayForRect(x, y, w, h);
1732 }
1733 if (!displayID) {
1734 // Use the primary display for a window if we can't find it anywhere else
1735 displayID = SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay();
1736 }
1737 return SDL_GetVideoDisplay(displayID);
1738}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, GetDisplayForRect(), SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay(), and SDL_GetVideoDisplay().

Referenced by SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(), and SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode().

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ SDL_GetVideoDriver()

const char * SDL_GetVideoDriver ( int index)

Get the name of a built in video driver.

The video drivers are presented in the order in which they are normally checked during initialization.

The names of drivers are all simple, low-ASCII identifiers, like "cocoa", "x11" or "windows". These never have Unicode characters, and are not meant to be proper names.

Parameters
indexthe index of a video driver.
Returns
the name of the video driver with the given index, or NULL if index is out of bounds.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetNumVideoDrivers
599{
600 if (index >= 0 && index < SDL_GetNumVideoDrivers()) {
601 return deduped_bootstrap[index]->name;
602 }
603 SDL_InvalidParamError("index");
604 return NULL;
605}
SDL_GetNumVideoDrivers

Definition SDL_video.c:570

◆ SDL_GetWindowAspectRatio()

bool SDL_GetWindowAspectRatio ( SDL_Window * window,
float * min_aspect,
float * max_aspect )

Get the aspect ratio of a window's client area.

Parameters
windowthe window to query the width and height from.
min_aspecta pointer filled in with the minimum aspect ratio of the window, may be NULL.
max_aspecta pointer filled in with the maximum aspect ratio of the window, may be NULL.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetWindowAspectRatio
3098{
3099 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3100
3101 if (min_aspect) {
3102 *min_aspect = window->min_aspect;
3103 }
3104 if (max_aspect) {
3105 *max_aspect = window->max_aspect;
3106 }
3107 return true;
3108}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC.

◆ SDL_GetWindowBordersSize()

bool SDL_GetWindowBordersSize ( SDL_Window * window,
int * top,
int * left,
int * bottom,
int * right )

Get the size of a window's borders (decorations) around the client area.

Note: If this function fails (returns false), the size values will be initialized to 0, 0, 0, 0 (if a non-NULL pointer is provided), as if the window in question was borderless.

Note: This function may fail on systems where the window has not yet been decorated by the display server (for example, immediately after calling SDL_CreateWindow). It is recommended that you wait at least until the window has been presented and composited, so that the window system has a chance to decorate the window and provide the border dimensions to SDL.

This function also returns false if getting the information is not supported.

Parameters
windowthe window to query the size values of the border (decorations) from.
toppointer to variable for storing the size of the top border; NULL is permitted.
leftpointer to variable for storing the size of the left border; NULL is permitted.
bottompointer to variable for storing the size of the bottom border; NULL is permitted.
rightpointer to variable for storing the size of the right border; NULL is permitted.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowSize
3111{
3112 int dummy = 0;
3113
3114 if (!top) {
3115 top = &dummy;
3116 }
3117 if (!left) {
3118 left = &dummy;
3119 }
3120 if (!right) {
3121 right = &dummy;
3122 }
3123 if (!bottom) {
3124 bottom = &dummy;
3125 }
3126
3127 // Always initialize, so applications don't have to care
3128 *top = *left = *bottom = *right = 0;
3129
3130 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3131
3132 if (!_this->GetWindowBordersSize) {
3133 return SDL_Unsupported();
3134 }
3135
3136 return _this->GetWindowBordersSize(_this, window, top, left, bottom, right);
3137}
left
GLint GLenum GLsizei const GLvoid *pointer GLdouble left
Definition SDL_glfuncs.h:285
top
GLint GLenum GLsizei const GLvoid *pointer GLdouble GLdouble GLdouble GLdouble top
Definition SDL_glfuncs.h:285

References _this, bottom, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, left, right, SDL_Unsupported, and top.

◆ SDL_GetWindowDisplayScale()

float SDL_GetWindowDisplayScale ( SDL_Window * window)

Get the content display scale relative to a window's pixel size.

This is a combination of the window pixel density and the display content scale, and is the expected scale for displaying content in this window. For example, if a 3840x2160 window had a display scale of 2.0, the user expects the content to take twice as many pixels and be the same physical size as if it were being displayed in a 1920x1080 window with a display scale of 1.0.

Conceptually this value corresponds to the scale display setting, and is updated when that setting is changed, or the window moves to a display with a different scale setting.

Parameters
windowthe window to query.
Returns
the display scale, or 0.0f on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
1826{
1827 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, 0.0f);
1828
1829 return window->display_scale;
1830}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC.

◆ SDL_GetWindowFromID()

SDL_Window * SDL_GetWindowFromID ( SDL_WindowID id)

Get a window from a stored ID.

The numeric ID is what SDL_WindowEvent references, and is necessary to map these events to specific SDL_Window objects.

Parameters
idthe ID of the window.
Returns
the window associated with id or NULL if it doesn't exist; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowID
2766{
2767 SDL_Window *window;
2768
2769 if (!_this) {
2770 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
2771 return NULL;
2772 }
2773 if (id) {
2774 for (window = _this->windows; window; window = window->next) {
2775 if (window->id == id) {
2776 return window;
2777 }
2778 }
2779 }
2780 SDL_SetError("Invalid window ID");
2781 return NULL;
2782}

◆ SDL_GetWindowPixelDensity()

float SDL_GetWindowPixelDensity ( SDL_Window * window)

Get the pixel density of a window.

This is a ratio of pixel size to window size. For example, if the window is 1920x1080 and it has a high density back buffer of 3840x2160 pixels, it would have a pixel density of 2.0.

Parameters
windowthe window to query.
Returns
the pixel density or 0.0f on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowDisplayScale
1812{
1813 int window_w, window_h, pixel_w, pixel_h;
1814 float pixel_density = 1.0f;
1815
1816 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, 0.0f);
1817
1818 if (SDL_GetWindowSize(window, &window_w, &window_h) &&
1819 SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels(window, &pixel_w, &pixel_h)) {
1820 pixel_density = (float)pixel_w / window_w;
1821 }
1822 return pixel_density;
1823}
