◆ SDL_GetWindowPosition()

bool SDL_GetWindowPosition ( SDL_Window * window,
int * x,
int * y )

Get the position of a window.

This is the current position of the window as last reported by the windowing system.

If you do not need the value for one of the positions a NULL may be passed in the x or y parameter.

Parameters
windowthe window to query.
xa pointer filled in with the x position of the window, may be NULL.
ya pointer filled in with the y position of the window, may be NULL.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetWindowPosition
2925{
2926 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
2927
2928 // Fullscreen windows are always at their display's origin
2929 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) {
2930 SDL_DisplayID displayID;
2931
2932 if (x) {
2933 *x = 0;
2934 }
2935 if (y) {
2936 *y = 0;
2937 }
2938
2939 /* Find the window's monitor and update to the
2940 monitor offset. */
2941 displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(window);
2942 if (displayID != 0) {
2943 SDL_Rect bounds;
2944
2945 SDL_zero(bounds);
2946
2947 SDL_GetDisplayBounds(displayID, &bounds);
2948 if (x) {
2949 *x = bounds.x;
2950 }
2951 if (y) {
2952 *y = bounds.y;
2953 }
2954 }
2955 } else {
2956 const bool use_pending = (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) && window->last_position_pending;
2957 if (x) {
2958 *x = use_pending ? window->pending.x : window->x;
2959 }
2960 if (y) {
2961 *y = use_pending ? window->pending.y : window->y;
2962 }
2963 }
2964 return true;
2965}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, SDL_GetDisplayBounds(), SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(), SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN, SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN, SDL_zero, SDL_Rect::x, and SDL_Rect::y.

Referenced by SDL_BLooper::_HandleMouseMove(), and SDL_Fcitx_UpdateTextInputArea().

◆ SDL_GetWindowProperties()

SDL_PropertiesID SDL_GetWindowProperties ( SDL_Window * window)

Get the properties associated with a window.

The following read-only properties are provided by SDL:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_SHAPE_POINTER: the surface associated with a shaped window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_HDR_ENABLED_BOOLEAN: true if the window has HDR headroom above the SDR white point. This property can change dynamically when SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_HDR_STATE_CHANGED is sent.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_SDR_WHITE_LEVEL_FLOAT: the value of SDR white in the SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR colorspace. On Windows this corresponds to the SDR white level in scRGB colorspace, and on Apple platforms this is always 1.0 for EDR content. This property can change dynamically when SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_HDR_STATE_CHANGED is sent.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT: the additional high dynamic range that can be displayed, in terms of the SDR white point. When HDR is not enabled, this will be 1.0. This property can change dynamically when SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_HDR_STATE_CHANGED is sent.

On Android:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_ANDROID_WINDOW_POINTER: the ANativeWindow associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_ANDROID_SURFACE_POINTER: the EGLSurface associated with the window

On iOS:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_UIKIT_WINDOW_POINTER: the (__unsafe_unretained) UIWindow associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_UIKIT_METAL_VIEW_TAG_NUMBER: the NSInteger tag associated with metal views on the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_UIKIT_OPENGL_FRAMEBUFFER_NUMBER: the OpenGL view's framebuffer object. It must be bound when rendering to the screen using OpenGL.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_UIKIT_OPENGL_RENDERBUFFER_NUMBER: the OpenGL view's renderbuffer object. It must be bound when SDL_GL_SwapWindow is called.
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_UIKIT_OPENGL_RESOLVE_FRAMEBUFFER_NUMBER: the OpenGL view's resolve framebuffer, when MSAA is used.

On KMS/DRM:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_KMSDRM_DEVICE_INDEX_NUMBER: the device index associated with the window (e.g. the X in /dev/dri/cardX)
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_KMSDRM_DRM_FD_NUMBER: the DRM FD associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_KMSDRM_GBM_DEVICE_POINTER: the GBM device associated with the window

On macOS:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_COCOA_WINDOW_POINTER: the (__unsafe_unretained) NSWindow associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_COCOA_METAL_VIEW_TAG_NUMBER: the NSInteger tag assocated with metal views on the window

On OpenVR:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_OPENVR_OVERLAY_ID_NUMBER: the OpenVR Overlay Handle ID for the associated overlay window.

On Vivante:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_VIVANTE_DISPLAY_POINTER: the EGLNativeDisplayType associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_VIVANTE_WINDOW_POINTER: the EGLNativeWindowType associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_VIVANTE_SURFACE_POINTER: the EGLSurface associated with the window

On Windows:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WIN32_HWND_POINTER: the HWND associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WIN32_HDC_POINTER: the HDC associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WIN32_INSTANCE_POINTER: the HINSTANCE associated with the window

On Wayland:

Note: The xdg_* window objects do not internally persist across window show/hide calls. They will be null if the window is hidden and must be queried each time it is shown.

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_DISPLAY_POINTER: the wl_display associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_SURFACE_POINTER: the wl_surface associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_VIEWPORT_POINTER: the wp_viewport associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_EGL_WINDOW_POINTER: the wl_egl_window associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_XDG_SURFACE_POINTER: the xdg_surface associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_XDG_TOPLEVEL_POINTER: the xdg_toplevel role associated with the window
  • 'SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_XDG_TOPLEVEL_EXPORT_HANDLE_STRING': the export handle associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_XDG_POPUP_POINTER: the xdg_popup role associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_WAYLAND_XDG_POSITIONER_POINTER: the xdg_positioner associated with the window, in popup mode

On X11:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_X11_DISPLAY_POINTER: the X11 Display associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_X11_SCREEN_NUMBER: the screen number associated with the window
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_X11_WINDOW_NUMBER: the X11 Window associated with the window

On Emscripten:

  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_EMSCRIPTEN_CANVAS_ID_STRING: the id the canvas element will have
  • SDL_PROP_WINDOW_EMSCRIPTEN_KEYBOARD_ELEMENT_STRING: the keyboard element that associates keyboard events to this window
Parameters
windowthe window to query.
Returns
a valid property ID on success or 0 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
2792{
2793 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, 0);
2794
2795 if (window->props == 0) {
2796 window->props = SDL_CreateProperties();
2797 }
2798 return window->props;
2799}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, and SDL_CreateProperties().

◆ SDL_GetWindows()

SDL_Window **SDLCALL SDL_GetWindows ( int * count)

Get a list of valid windows.

Parameters
counta pointer filled in with the number of windows returned, may be NULL.
Returns
a NULL terminated array of SDL_Window pointers or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information. This is a single allocation that should be freed with SDL_free() when it is no longer needed.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
2197{
2198 if (count) {
2199 *count = 0;
2200 }
2201
2202 if (!_this) {
2203 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
2204 return NULL;
2205 }
2206
2207 SDL_Window *window;
2208 int num_added = 0;
2209 int num_windows = 0;
2210 for (window = _this->windows; window; window = window->next) {
2211 ++num_windows;
2212 }
2213
2214 SDL_Window **windows = (SDL_Window **)SDL_malloc((num_windows + 1) * sizeof(*windows));
2215 if (!windows) {
2216 return NULL;
2217 }
2218
2219 for (window = _this->windows; window; window = window->next) {
2220 windows[num_added++] = window;
2221 if (num_added == num_windows) {
2222 // Race condition? Multi-threading not supported, ignore it
2223 break;
2224 }
2225 }
2226 windows[num_added] = NULL;
2227
2228 if (count) {
2229 *count = num_added;
2230 }
2231 return windows;
2232}

◆ SDL_GetWindowSafeArea()

bool SDL_GetWindowSafeArea ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_Rect * rect )

Get the safe area for this window.

Some devices have portions of the screen which are partially obscured or not interactive, possibly due to on-screen controls, curved edges, camera notches, TV overscan, etc. This function provides the area of the window which is safe to have interactable content. You should continue rendering into the rest of the window, but it should not contain visually important or interactible content.

Parameters
windowthe window to query.
recta pointer filled in with the client area that is safe for interactive content.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
4175{
4176 if (rect) {
4177 SDL_zerop(rect);
4178 }
4179
4180 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
4181
4182 if (rect) {
4183 if (SDL_RectEmpty(&window->safe_rect)) {
4184 rect->w = window->w;
4185 rect->h = window->h;
4186 } else {
4187 SDL_copyp(rect, &window->safe_rect);
4188 }
4189 }
4190 return true;
4191}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, SDL_Rect::h, SDL_copyp, SDL_RectEmpty(), SDL_zerop, and SDL_Rect::w.

◆ SDL_GetWindowSize()

bool SDL_GetWindowSize ( SDL_Window * window,
int * w,
int * h )

Get the size of a window's client area.

The window pixel size may differ from its window coordinate size if the window is on a high pixel density display. Use SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels() or SDL_GetRenderOutputSize() to get the real client area size in pixels.

Parameters
windowthe window to query the width and height from.
wa pointer filled in with the width of the window, may be NULL.
ha pointer filled in with the height of the window, may be NULL.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

See also
SDL_CreateWindow
SDL_GetWindowSize
3140{
3141 int filter;
3142
3143 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3144
3145 if (!w) {
3146 w = &filter;
3147 }
3148
3149 if (!h) {
3150 h = &filter;
3151 }
3152
3153 if (_this->GetWindowSizeInPixels) {
3154 _this->GetWindowSizeInPixels(_this, window, w, h);
3155 } else {
3156 SDL_DisplayID displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(window);
3157 const SDL_DisplayMode *mode;
3158
3159 SDL_GetWindowSize(window, w, h);
3160
3161 if ((window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) && SDL_GetWindowFullscreenMode(window)) {
3162 mode = SDL_GetCurrentDisplayMode(displayID);
3163 } else {
3164 mode = SDL_GetDesktopDisplayMode(displayID);
3165 }
3166 if (mode) {
3167 *w = (int)SDL_ceilf(*w * mode->pixel_density);
3168 *h = (int)SDL_ceilf(*h * mode->pixel_density);
3169 }
3170 }
3171 return true;
3172}

◆ SDL_GetWindowSurface()

SDL_Surface * SDL_GetWindowSurface ( SDL_Window * window)

Get the SDL surface associated with the window.

A new surface will be created with the optimal format for the window, if necessary. This surface will be freed when the window is destroyed. Do not free this surface.

This surface will be invalidated if the window is resized. After resizing a window this function must be called again to return a valid surface.

You may not combine this with 3D or the rendering API on this window.

This function is affected by SDL_HINT_FRAMEBUFFER_ACCELERATION.

Parameters
windowthe window to query.
Returns
the surface associated with the window, or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_DestroyWindowSurface
SDL_WindowHasSurface
SDL_UpdateWindowSurface
SDL_UpdateWindowSurfaceRects

< Surface is referenced internally

< Surface is referenced internally

3552{
3553 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, NULL);
3554
3555 if (!window->surface_valid) {
3556 if (window->surface) {
3557 window->surface->internal_flags &= ~SDL_INTERNAL_SURFACE_DONTFREE;
3558 SDL_DestroySurface(window->surface);
3559 window->surface = NULL;
3560 }
3561
3562 window->surface = SDL_CreateWindowFramebuffer(window);
3563 if (window->surface) {
3564 window->surface_valid = true;
3565 window->surface->internal_flags |= SDL_INTERNAL_SURFACE_DONTFREE;
3566 }
3567 }
3568 return window->surface;
3569}

◆ SDL_GL_CreateContext()

SDL_GLContext SDL_GL_CreateContext ( SDL_Window * window)

Create an OpenGL context for an OpenGL window, and make it current.

Windows users new to OpenGL should note that, for historical reasons, GL functions added after OpenGL version 1.1 are not available by default. Those functions must be loaded at run-time, either with an OpenGL extension-handling library or with SDL_GL_GetProcAddress() and its related functions.

SDL_GLContext is opaque to the application.

Parameters
windowthe window to associate with the context.
Returns
the OpenGL context associated with window or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GL_DestroyContext
SDL_GL_MakeCurrent
5212{
5213 SDL_GLContext ctx = NULL;
5214 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, NULL);
5215
5216 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL)) {
5217 SDL_SetError(NOT_AN_OPENGL_WINDOW);
5218 return NULL;
5219 }
5220
5221 ctx = _this->GL_CreateContext(_this, window);
5222
5223 // Creating a context is assumed to make it current in the SDL driver.
5224 if (ctx) {
5225 _this->current_glwin = window;
5226 _this->current_glctx = ctx;
5227 SDL_SetTLS(&_this->current_glwin_tls, window, NULL);
5228 SDL_SetTLS(&_this->current_glctx_tls, ctx, NULL);
5229 }
5230 return ctx;
5231}

◆ SDL_GL_DeduceMaxSupportedESProfile()

void SDL_GL_DeduceMaxSupportedESProfile ( int * major,
int * minor )
4723{
4724// THIS REQUIRES AN EXISTING GL CONTEXT THAT HAS BEEN MADE CURRENT.
4725// Please refer to https://bugzilla.libsdl.org/show_bug.cgi?id=3725 for discussion.
4726#if defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL) || defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL_ES) || defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL_ES2)
4727 /* XXX This is fragile; it will break in the event of release of
4728 * new versions of OpenGL ES.
4729 */
4730 if (SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported("GL_ARB_ES3_2_compatibility")) {
4731 *major = 3;
4732 *minor = 2;
4733 } else if (SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported("GL_ARB_ES3_1_compatibility")) {
4734 *major = 3;
4735 *minor = 1;
4736 } else if (SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported("GL_ARB_ES3_compatibility")) {
4737 *major = 3;
4738 *minor = 0;
4739 } else {
4740 *major = 2;
4741 *minor = 0;
4742 }
4743#endif
4744}

◆ SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported()

bool SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported ( const char * extension)

Check if an OpenGL extension is supported for the current context.

This function operates on the current GL context; you must have created a context and it must be current before calling this function. Do not assume that all contexts you create will have the same set of extensions available, or that recreating an existing context will offer the same extensions again.

While it's probably not a massive overhead, this function is not an O(1) operation. Check the extensions you care about after creating the GL context and save that information somewhere instead of calling the function every time you need to know.

Parameters
extensionthe name of the extension to check.
Returns
true if the extension is supported, false otherwise.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
4631{
4632#if defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL) || defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL_ES) || defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL_ES2)
4633 PFNGLGETSTRINGPROC glGetStringFunc;
4634 const char *extensions;
4635 const char *start;
4636 const char *where, *terminator;
4637
4638 // Extension names should not have spaces.
4639 where = SDL_strchr(extension, ' ');
4640 if (where || *extension == '\0') {
4641 return false;
4642 }
4643 // See if there's a hint or environment variable override
4644 start = SDL_GetHint(extension);
4645 if (start && *start == '0') {
4646 return false;
4647 }
4648
4649 // Lookup the available extensions
4650
4651 glGetStringFunc = (PFNGLGETSTRINGPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetString");
4652 if (!glGetStringFunc) {
4653 return false;
4654 }
4655
4656 if (isAtLeastGL3((const char *)glGetStringFunc(GL_VERSION))) {
4657 PFNGLGETSTRINGIPROC glGetStringiFunc;
4658 PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC glGetIntegervFunc;
4659 GLint num_exts = 0;
4660 GLint i;
4661
4662 glGetStringiFunc = (PFNGLGETSTRINGIPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetStringi");
4663 glGetIntegervFunc = (PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetIntegerv");
4664 if ((!glGetStringiFunc) || (!glGetIntegervFunc)) {
4665 return false;
4666 }
4667
4668#ifndef GL_NUM_EXTENSIONS
4669#define GL_NUM_EXTENSIONS 0x821D
4670#endif
4671 glGetIntegervFunc(GL_NUM_EXTENSIONS, &num_exts);
4672 for (i = 0; i < num_exts; i++) {
4673 const char *thisext = (const char *)glGetStringiFunc(GL_EXTENSIONS, i);
4674 if (SDL_strcmp(thisext, extension) == 0) {
4675 return true;
4676 }
4677 }
4678
4679 return false;
4680 }
4681
4682 // Try the old way with glGetString(GL_EXTENSIONS) ...
4683
4684 extensions = (const char *)glGetStringFunc(GL_EXTENSIONS);
4685 if (!extensions) {
4686 return false;
4687 }
4688 /*
4689 * It takes a bit of care to be fool-proof about parsing the OpenGL
4690 * extensions string. Don't be fooled by sub-strings, etc.
4691 */
4692
4693 start = extensions;
4694
4695 for (;;) {
4696 where = SDL_strstr(start, extension);
4697 if (!where) {
4698 break;
4699 }
4700
4701 terminator = where + SDL_strlen(extension);
4702 if (where == extensions || *(where - 1) == ' ') {
4703 if (*terminator == ' ' || *terminator == '\0') {
4704 return true;
4705 }
4706 }
4707
4708 start = terminator;
4709 }
4710 return false;
4711#else
4712 return false;
4713#endif
4714}
GL_VERSION
#define GL_VERSION
Definition SDL_opengl.h:698
GLint
int GLint
Definition SDL_opengl.h:165
GL_EXTENSIONS
#define GL_EXTENSIONS
Definition SDL_opengl.h:699
PFNGLGETSTRINGIPROC
const GLubyte *(* PFNGLGETSTRINGIPROC)(GLenum name, GLuint index)
Definition SDL_opengl_glext.h:1474
GL_NUM_EXTENSIONS
#define GL_NUM_EXTENSIONS
Definition SDL_opengl_glext.h:1192
PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC
void(GL_APIENTRY * PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC)(GLenum pname, GLint *data)
Definition SDL_opengles2_gl2.h:427
PFNGLGETSTRINGPROC
const GLubyte *(GL_APIENTRY * PFNGLGETSTRINGPROC)(GLenum name)
Definition SDL_opengles2_gl2.h:435
SDL_strstr
SDL_DECLSPEC char *SDLCALL SDL_strstr(const char *haystack, const char *needle)
Definition SDL_string.c:1125
SDL_GL_GetProcAddress
SDL_FunctionPointer SDL_GL_GetProcAddress(const char *proc)
Definition SDL_video.c:4555

◆ SDL_GL_GetAttribute()

bool SDL_GL_GetAttribute ( SDL_GLAttr attr,
int * value )

Get the actual value for an attribute from the current context.

Parameters
attran SDL_GLAttr enum value specifying the OpenGL attribute to get.
valuea pointer filled in with the current value of attr.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GL_ResetAttributes
SDL_GL_SetAttribute
4940{
4941#if defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL) || defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL_ES) || defined(SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL_ES2)
4942 PFNGLGETERRORPROC glGetErrorFunc;
4943 GLenum attrib = 0;
4944 GLenum error = 0;
4945
4946 /*
4947 * Some queries in Core Profile desktop OpenGL 3+ contexts require
4948 * glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameteriv instead of glGetIntegerv. Note that
4949 * the enums we use for the former function don't exist in OpenGL ES 2, and
4950 * the function itself doesn't exist prior to OpenGL 3 and OpenGL ES 2.
4951 */
4952#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
4953 PFNGLGETSTRINGPROC glGetStringFunc;
4954 PFNGLGETFRAMEBUFFERATTACHMENTPARAMETERIVPROC glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameterivFunc;
4955 GLenum attachment = GL_BACK_LEFT;
4956 GLenum attachmentattrib = 0;
4957#endif
4958
4959 if (!value) {
4960 return SDL_InvalidParamError("value");
4961 }
4962
4963 // Clear value in any case
4964 *value = 0;
4965
4966 if (!_this) {
4967 return SDL_UninitializedVideo();
4968 }
4969
4970 switch (attr) {
4971 case SDL_GL_RED_SIZE:
4972#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
4973 attachmentattrib = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_RED_SIZE;
4974#endif
4975 attrib = GL_RED_BITS;
4976 break;
4977 case SDL_GL_BLUE_SIZE:
4978#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
4979 attachmentattrib = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_BLUE_SIZE;
4980#endif
4981 attrib = GL_BLUE_BITS;
4982 break;
4983 case SDL_GL_GREEN_SIZE:
4984#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
4985 attachmentattrib = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_GREEN_SIZE;
4986#endif
4987 attrib = GL_GREEN_BITS;
4988 break;
4989 case SDL_GL_ALPHA_SIZE:
4990#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
4991 attachmentattrib = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_ALPHA_SIZE;
4992#endif
4993 attrib = GL_ALPHA_BITS;
4994 break;
4995 case SDL_GL_DOUBLEBUFFER:
4996#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
4997 attrib = GL_DOUBLEBUFFER;
4998 break;
4999#else
5000 // OpenGL ES 1.0 and above specifications have EGL_SINGLE_BUFFER
5001 // parameter which switches double buffer to single buffer. OpenGL ES
5002 // SDL driver must set proper value after initialization
5003 *value = _this->gl_config.double_buffer;
5004 return true;
5005#endif
5006 case SDL_GL_DEPTH_SIZE:
5007#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
5008 attachment = GL_DEPTH;
5009 attachmentattrib = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_DEPTH_SIZE;
5010#endif
5011 attrib = GL_DEPTH_BITS;
5012 break;
5013 case SDL_GL_STENCIL_SIZE:
5014#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
5015 attachment = GL_STENCIL;
5016 attachmentattrib = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_STENCIL_SIZE;
5017#endif
5018 attrib = GL_STENCIL_BITS;
5019 break;
5020#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
5021 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_RED_SIZE:
5022 attrib = GL_ACCUM_RED_BITS;
5023 break;
5024 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_GREEN_SIZE:
5025 attrib = GL_ACCUM_GREEN_BITS;
5026 break;
5027 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_BLUE_SIZE:
5028 attrib = GL_ACCUM_BLUE_BITS;
5029 break;
5030 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_ALPHA_SIZE:
5031 attrib = GL_ACCUM_ALPHA_BITS;
5032 break;
5033 case SDL_GL_STEREO:
5034 attrib = GL_STEREO;
5035 break;
5036#else
5037 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_RED_SIZE:
5038 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_GREEN_SIZE:
5039 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_BLUE_SIZE:
5040 case SDL_GL_ACCUM_ALPHA_SIZE:
5041 case SDL_GL_STEREO:
5042 // none of these are supported in OpenGL ES
5043 *value = 0;
5044 return true;
5045#endif
5046 case SDL_GL_MULTISAMPLEBUFFERS:
5047 attrib = GL_SAMPLE_BUFFERS;
5048 break;
5049 case SDL_GL_MULTISAMPLESAMPLES:
5050 attrib = GL_SAMPLES;
5051 break;
5052 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR:
5053 attrib = GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR;
5054 break;
5055 case SDL_GL_BUFFER_SIZE:
5056 {
5057 int rsize = 0, gsize = 0, bsize = 0, asize = 0;
5058
5059 // There doesn't seem to be a single flag in OpenGL for this!
5060 if (!SDL_GL_GetAttribute(SDL_GL_RED_SIZE, &rsize)) {
5061 return false;
5062 }
5063 if (!SDL_GL_GetAttribute(SDL_GL_GREEN_SIZE, &gsize)) {
5064 return false;
5065 }
5066 if (!SDL_GL_GetAttribute(SDL_GL_BLUE_SIZE, &bsize)) {
5067 return false;
5068 }
5069 if (!SDL_GL_GetAttribute(SDL_GL_ALPHA_SIZE, &asize)) {
5070 return false;
5071 }
5072
5073 *value = rsize + gsize + bsize + asize;
5074 return true;
5075 }
5076 case SDL_GL_ACCELERATED_VISUAL:
5077 {
5078 // FIXME: How do we get this information?
5079 *value = (_this->gl_config.accelerated != 0);
5080 return true;
5081 }
5082 case SDL_GL_RETAINED_BACKING:
5083 {
5084 *value = _this->gl_config.retained_backing;
5085 return true;
5086 }
5087 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_MAJOR_VERSION:
5088 {
5089 *value = _this->gl_config.major_version;
5090 return true;
5091 }
5092 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_MINOR_VERSION:
5093 {
5094 *value = _this->gl_config.minor_version;
5095 return true;
5096 }
5097 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_FLAGS:
5098 {
5099 *value = _this->gl_config.flags;
5100 return true;
5101 }
5102 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_MASK:
5103 {
5104 *value = _this->gl_config.profile_mask;
5105 return true;
5106 }
5107 case SDL_GL_SHARE_WITH_CURRENT_CONTEXT:
5108 {
5109 *value = _this->gl_config.share_with_current_context;
5110 return true;
5111 }
5112 case SDL_GL_FRAMEBUFFER_SRGB_CAPABLE:
5113 {
5114 *value = _this->gl_config.framebuffer_srgb_capable;
5115 return true;
5116 }
5117 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_NO_ERROR:
5118 {
5119 *value = _this->gl_config.no_error;
5120 return true;
5121 }
5122 case SDL_GL_EGL_PLATFORM:
5123 {
5124 *value = _this->gl_config.egl_platform;
5125 return true;
5126 }
5127 default:
5128 return SDL_SetError("Unknown OpenGL attribute");
5129 }
5130
5131#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
5132 glGetStringFunc = (PFNGLGETSTRINGPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetString");
5133 if (!glGetStringFunc) {
5134 return false;
5135 }
5136
5137 if (attachmentattrib && isAtLeastGL3((const char *)glGetStringFunc(GL_VERSION))) {
5138 // glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameteriv needs to operate on the window framebuffer for this, so bind FBO 0 if necessary.
5139 GLint current_fbo = 0;
5140 PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC glGetIntegervFunc = (PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC) SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetIntegerv");
5141 PFNGLBINDFRAMEBUFFERPROC glBindFramebufferFunc = (PFNGLBINDFRAMEBUFFERPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glBindFramebuffer");
5142 if (glGetIntegervFunc && glBindFramebufferFunc) {
5143 glGetIntegervFunc(GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER_BINDING, &current_fbo);
5144 }
5145
5146 glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameterivFunc = (PFNGLGETFRAMEBUFFERATTACHMENTPARAMETERIVPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameteriv");
5147 if (glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameterivFunc) {
5148 if (glBindFramebufferFunc && (current_fbo != 0)) {
5149 glBindFramebufferFunc(GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, 0);
5150 }
5151 // glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameterivFunc may cause GL_INVALID_OPERATION when querying depth/stencil size if the
5152 // bits is 0. From the GL docs:
5153 // If the value of GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE is GL_NONE, then either no framebuffer is bound to target;
5154 // or a default framebuffer is queried, attachment is GL_DEPTH or GL_STENCIL, and the number of depth or stencil bits,
5155 // respectively, is zero. In this case querying pname GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_NAME will return zero, and all
5156 // other queries will generate an error.
5157 GLint fbo_type = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT;
5158 if (attachment == GL_DEPTH || attachment == GL_STENCIL) {
5159 glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameterivFunc(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachment, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE, &fbo_type);
5160 }
5161 if (fbo_type != GL_NONE) {
5162 glGetFramebufferAttachmentParameterivFunc(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachment, attachmentattrib, (GLint *)value);
5163 } else {
5164 *value = 0;
5165 }
5166 if (glBindFramebufferFunc && (current_fbo != 0)) {
5167 glBindFramebufferFunc(GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, current_fbo);
5168 }
5169 } else {
5170 return false;
5171 }
5172 } else
5173#endif
5174 {
5175 PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC glGetIntegervFunc = (PFNGLGETINTEGERVPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetIntegerv");
5176 if (glGetIntegervFunc) {
5177 glGetIntegervFunc(attrib, (GLint *)value);
5178 } else {
5179 return false;
5180 }
5181 }
5182
5183 glGetErrorFunc = (PFNGLGETERRORPROC)SDL_GL_GetProcAddress("glGetError");
5184 if (!glGetErrorFunc) {
5185 return false;
5186 }
5187
5188 error = glGetErrorFunc();
5189 if (error != GL_NO_ERROR) {
5190 if (error == GL_INVALID_ENUM) {
5191 return SDL_SetError("OpenGL error: GL_INVALID_ENUM");
5192 } else if (error == GL_INVALID_VALUE) {
5193 return SDL_SetError("OpenGL error: GL_INVALID_VALUE");
5194 }
5195 return SDL_SetError("OpenGL error: %08X", error);
5196 }
5197
5198 // convert GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR values back to SDL_GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR values
5199 if (attr == SDL_GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR) {
5200 *value = (*value == GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR_FLUSH) ? SDL_GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR_FLUSH : SDL_GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR_NONE;
5201 }
5202
5203 return true;
5204#else
5205 return SDL_Unsupported();
5206#endif // SDL_VIDEO_OPENGL
5207}

the currently active OpenGL context or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.

◆ SDL_GL_GetProcAddress()

SDL_FunctionPointer SDL_GL_GetProcAddress ( const char * proc)

Get an OpenGL function by name.

If the GL library is loaded at runtime with SDL_GL_LoadLibrary(), then all GL functions must be retrieved this way. Usually this is used to retrieve function pointers to OpenGL extensions.

There are some quirks to looking up OpenGL functions that require some extra care from the application. If you code carefully, you can handle these quirks without any platform-specific code, though:

  • On Windows, function pointers are specific to the current GL context; this means you need to have created a GL context and made it current before calling SDL_GL_GetProcAddress(). If you recreate your context or create a second context, you should assume that any existing function pointers aren't valid to use with it. This is (currently) a Windows-specific limitation, and in practice lots of drivers don't suffer this limitation, but it is still the way the wgl API is documented to work and you should expect crashes if you don't respect it. Store a copy of the function pointers that comes and goes with context lifespan.
  • On X11, function pointers returned by this function are valid for any context, and can even be looked up before a context is created at all. This means that, for at least some common OpenGL implementations, if you look up a function that doesn't exist, you'll get a non-NULL result that is NOT safe to call. You must always make sure the function is actually available for a given GL context before calling it, by checking for the existence of the appropriate extension with SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported(), or verifying that the version of OpenGL you're using offers the function as core functionality.
  • Some OpenGL drivers, on all platforms, will return NULL if a function isn't supported, but you can't count on this behavior. Check for extensions you use, and if you get a NULL anyway, act as if that extension wasn't available. This is probably a bug in the driver, but you can code defensively for this scenario anyhow.
  • Just because you're on Linux/Unix, don't assume you'll be using X11. Next-gen display servers are waiting to replace it, and may or may not make the same promises about function pointers.
  • OpenGL function pointers must be declared APIENTRY as in the example code. This will ensure the proper calling convention is followed on platforms where this matters (Win32) thereby avoiding stack corruption.
Parameters
procthe name of an OpenGL function.
Returns
a pointer to the named OpenGL function. The returned pointer should be cast to the appropriate function signature.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported
SDL_GL_LoadLibrary
SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary
4556{
4557 SDL_FunctionPointer func;
4558
4559 if (!_this) {
4560 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
4561 return NULL;
4562 }
4563 func = NULL;
4564 if (_this->GL_GetProcAddress) {
4565 if (_this->gl_config.driver_loaded) {
4566 func = _this->GL_GetProcAddress(_this, proc);
4567 } else {
4568 SDL_SetError("No GL driver has been loaded");
4569 }
4570 } else {
4571 SDL_SetError("No dynamic GL support in current SDL video driver (%s)", _this->name);
4572 }
4573 return func;
4574}

References _this, NULL, SDL_SetError(), and SDL_UninitializedVideo().

Referenced by SDL_GL_ExtensionSupported(), and SDL_GL_GetAttribute().

◆ SDL_GL_GetSwapInterval()

bool SDL_GL_GetSwapInterval ( int * interval)

Get the swap interval for the current OpenGL context.

If the system can't determine the swap interval, or there isn't a valid current context, this function will set *interval to 0 as a safe default.

Parameters
intervaloutput interval value. 0 if there is no vertical retrace synchronization, 1 if the buffer swap is synchronized with the vertical retrace, and -1 if late swaps happen immediately instead of waiting for the next retrace.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GL_SetSwapInterval
5358{
5359 if (!interval) {
5360 return SDL_InvalidParamError("interval");
5361 }
5362
5363 *interval = 0;
5364
5365 if (!_this) {
5366 return SDL_SetError("no video driver");
5367 } else if (SDL_GL_GetCurrentContext() == NULL) {
5368 return SDL_SetError("no current context");
5369 } else if (_this->GL_GetSwapInterval) {
5370 return _this->GL_GetSwapInterval(_this, interval);
5371 } else {
5372 return SDL_SetError("not implemented");
5373 }
5374}
interval
EGLint interval
Definition egl.h:177

References _this, NULL, SDL_GL_GetCurrentContext(), SDL_InvalidParamError, and SDL_SetError().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_GL_LoadLibrary()

bool SDL_GL_LoadLibrary ( const char * path)

Dynamically load an OpenGL library.

This should be done after initializing the video driver, but before creating any OpenGL windows. If no OpenGL library is loaded, the default library will be loaded upon creation of the first OpenGL window.

If you do this, you need to retrieve all of the GL functions used in your program from the dynamic library using SDL_GL_GetProcAddress().

Parameters
paththe platform dependent OpenGL library name, or NULL to open the default OpenGL library.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GL_GetProcAddress
SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary
4528{
4529 bool result;
4530
4531 if (!_this) {
4532 return SDL_UninitializedVideo();
4533 }
4534 if (_this->gl_config.driver_loaded) {
4535 if (path && SDL_strcmp(path, _this->gl_config.driver_path) != 0) {
4536 return SDL_SetError("OpenGL library already loaded");
4537 }
4538 result = true;
4539 } else {
4540 if (!_this->GL_LoadLibrary) {
4541 return SDL_DllNotSupported("OpenGL");
4542 }
4543 result = _this->GL_LoadLibrary(_this, path);
4544 }
4545 if (result) {
4546 ++_this->gl_config.driver_loaded;
4547 } else {
4548 if (_this->GL_UnloadLibrary) {
4549 _this->GL_UnloadLibrary(_this);
4550 }
4551 }
4552 return result;
4553}

◆ SDL_GL_MakeCurrent()

bool SDL_GL_MakeCurrent ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_GLContext context )

Set up an OpenGL context for rendering into an OpenGL window.

The context must have been created with a compatible window.

Parameters
windowthe window to associate with the context.
contextthe OpenGL context to associate with the window.

true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.

This function should only be called on the main thread.

This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GL_CreateContext
5234{
5235 bool result;
5236
5237 if (!_this) {
5238 return SDL_UninitializedVideo();
5239 }
5240
5241 if (window == SDL_GL_GetCurrentWindow() &&
5242 context == SDL_GL_GetCurrentContext()) {
5243 // We're already current.
5244 return true;
5245 }
5246
5247 if (!context) {
5248 window = NULL;
5249 } else if (window) {
5250 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
5251
5252 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL)) {
5253 return SDL_SetError(NOT_AN_OPENGL_WINDOW);
5254 }
5255 } else if (!_this->gl_allow_no_surface) {
5256 return SDL_SetError("Use of OpenGL without a window is not supported on this platform");
5257 }
5258
5259 result = _this->GL_MakeCurrent(_this, window, context);
5260 if (result) {
5261 _this->current_glwin = window;
5262 _this->current_glctx = context;
5263 SDL_SetTLS(&_this->current_glwin_tls, window, NULL);
5264 SDL_SetTLS(&_this->current_glctx_tls, context, NULL);
5265 }
5266 return result;
5267}

◆ SDL_GL_SetAttribute()

bool SDL_GL_SetAttribute ( SDL_GLAttr attr,
int value )

Set an OpenGL window attribute before window creation.

This function sets the OpenGL attribute attr to value. The requested attributes should be set before creating an OpenGL window. You should use SDL_GL_GetAttribute() to check the values after creating the OpenGL context, since the values obtained can differ from the requested ones.

Parameters
attran SDL_GLAttr enum value specifying the OpenGL attribute to set.
valuethe desired value for the attribute.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

4891 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_FLAGS:
4892 if (value & ~(SDL_GL_CONTEXT_DEBUG_FLAG |
4893 SDL_GL_CONTEXT_FORWARD_COMPATIBLE_FLAG |
4894 SDL_GL_CONTEXT_ROBUST_ACCESS_FLAG |
4895 SDL_GL_CONTEXT_RESET_ISOLATION_FLAG)) {
4896 result = SDL_SetError("Unknown OpenGL context flag %d", value);
4897 break;
4898 }
4899 _this->gl_config.flags = value;
4900 break;
4901 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_MASK:
4902 if (value != 0 &&
4903 value != SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_CORE &&
4904 value != SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_COMPATIBILITY &&
4905 value != SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_ES) {
4906 result = SDL_SetError("Unknown OpenGL context profile %d", value);
4907 break;
4908 }
4909 _this->gl_config.profile_mask = value;
4910 break;
4911 case SDL_GL_SHARE_WITH_CURRENT_CONTEXT:

4913 break;
4914 case SDL_GL_FRAMEBUFFER_SRGB_CAPABLE:

4916 break;
4917 case SDL_GL_CONTEXT_RELEASE_BEHAVIOR:

4919 break;

◆ SDL_GL_SetSwapInterval()

bool SDL_GL_SetSwapInterval ( int interval)

Set the swap interval for the current OpenGL context.

Some systems allow specifying -1 for the interval, to enable adaptive vsync. Adaptive vsync works the same as vsync, but if you've already missed the vertical retrace for a given frame, it swaps buffers immediately, which might be less jarring for the user during occasional framerate drops. If an application requests adaptive vsync and the system does not support it, this function will fail and return false. In such a case, you should probably retry the call with 1 for the interval.

Adaptive vsync is implemented for some glX drivers with GLX_EXT_swap_control_tear, and for some Windows drivers with WGL_EXT_swap_control_tear.

Read more on the Khronos wiki: https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Swap_Interval#Adaptive_Vsync

Parameters
interval0 for immediate updates, 1 for updates synchronized with the vertical retrace, -1 for adaptive vsync.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GL_GetSwapInterval
5345{
5346 if (!_this) {
5347 return SDL_UninitializedVideo();
5348 } else if (SDL_GL_GetCurrentContext() == NULL) {
5349 return SDL_SetError("No OpenGL context has been made current");
5350 } else if (_this->GL_SetSwapInterval) {
5351 return _this->GL_SetSwapInterval(_this, interval);
5352 } else {
5353 return SDL_SetError("Setting the swap interval is not supported");
5354 }
5355}

References _this, NULL, SDL_GL_GetCurrentContext(), SDL_SetError(), and SDL_UninitializedVideo().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_GL_SwapWindow()

bool SDL_GL_SwapWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Update a window with OpenGL rendering.

This is used with double-buffered OpenGL contexts, which are the default.

On macOS, make sure you bind 0 to the draw framebuffer before swapping the window, otherwise nothing will happen. If you aren't using glBindFramebuffer(), this is the default and you won't have to do anything extra.

Parameters
windowthe window to change.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
5377{
5378 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
5379
5380 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL)) {
5381 return SDL_SetError(NOT_AN_OPENGL_WINDOW);
5382 }
5383
5384 if (SDL_GL_GetCurrentWindow() != window) {
5385 return SDL_SetError("The specified window has not been made current");
5386 }
5387
5388 return _this->GL_SwapWindow(_this, window);
5389}

1630 SDL_Window *w;
1631
1632 if (SDL_WINDOW_IS_POPUP(window)) {
1633 // Convert absolute window coordinates to relative for a popup
1634 for (w = window->parent; w; w = w->parent) {
1635 abs_x -= w->x;
1636 abs_y -= w->y;
1637
1638 if (!SDL_WINDOW_IS_POPUP(w)) {
1639 break;

bool SDL_HideWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Parameters

true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.

SDL_ShowWindow
SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN
3293{
3294 SDL_Window *child;
3295 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3296
3297 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3298 window->restore_on_show = false;
3299 return true;
3300 }
3301
3302 // Hide all child windows
3303 for (child = window->first_child; child; child = child->next_sibling) {
3304 if (child->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3305 break;
3306 }
3307 SDL_HideWindow(child);
3308 child->restore_on_show = true;
3309 }
3310
3311 // Store the flags for restoration later.
3312 const SDL_WindowFlags pending_mask = (SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED | SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED | SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN | SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED | SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_GRABBED);
3313 window->pending_flags = (window->flags & pending_mask);
3314
3315 window->is_hiding = true;
3316 if (_this->HideWindow) {
3317 _this->HideWindow(_this, window);
3318 } else {
3319 SDL_SetMouseFocus(NULL);
3320 SDL_SetKeyboardFocus(NULL);
3321 }
3322 window->is_hiding = false;
3323 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_HIDDEN, 0, 0);
3324 return true;
3325}

◆ SDL_MaximizeWindow()

bool SDL_MaximizeWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Request that the window be made as large as possible.

Non-resizable windows can't be maximized. The window must have the SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE flag set, or this will have no effect.

On some windowing systems this request is asynchronous and the new window state may not have have been applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the window state changes, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED event will be emitted. Note that, as this is just a request, the windowing system can deny the state change.

When maximizing a window, whether the constraints set via SDL_SetWindowMaximumSize() are honored depends on the policy of the window manager. Win32 and macOS enforce the constraints when maximizing, while X11 and Wayland window managers may vary.

Parameters
windowthe window to maximize.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_MinimizeWindow
SDL_RestoreWindow
SDL_SyncWindow
3341{
3342 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3343 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3344
3345 if (!_this->MaximizeWindow) {
3346 return SDL_Unsupported();
3347 }
3348
3349 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE)) {
3350 return SDL_SetError("A window without the 'SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE' flag can't be maximized");
3351 }
3352
3353 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3354 window->pending_flags |= SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED;
3355 return true;
3356 }
3357
3358 _this->MaximizeWindow(_this, window);
3359 SDL_SyncIfRequired(window);
3360 return true;
3361}
SDL_SyncIfRequired
static void SDL_SyncIfRequired(SDL_Window *window)
Definition SDL_video.c:233
SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE
#define SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE
Definition SDL_video.h:200

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, SDL_SetError(), SDL_SyncIfRequired(), SDL_Unsupported, SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN, SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED, and SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE.

◆ SDL_Metal_CreateView()

SDL_MetalView SDL_Metal_CreateView ( SDL_Window * window)

Create a CAMetalLayer-backed NSView/UIView and attach it to the specified window.

On macOS, this does not associate a MTLDevice with the CAMetalLayer on its own. It is up to user code to do that.

The returned handle can be casted directly to a NSView or UIView. To access the backing CAMetalLayer, call SDL_Metal_GetLayer().

Parameters
windowthe window.
Returns
handle NSView or UIView.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_Metal_DestroyView
SDL_Metal_GetLayer
6099{
6100 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, NULL);
6101
6102 if (!_this->Metal_CreateView) {
6103 SDL_Unsupported();
6104 return NULL;
6105 }
6106
6107 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_METAL)) {
6108 // No problem, we can convert to Metal
6109 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) {
6110 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL;
6111 SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary();
6112 }
6113 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN) {
6114 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN;
6115 SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary();
6116 }
6117 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_METAL;
6118 }
6119
6120 return _this->Metal_CreateView(_this, window);
6121}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, NULL, SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary(), SDL_Unsupported, SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary(), SDL_WINDOW_METAL, SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL, and SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_Metal_DestroyView()

void SDL_Metal_DestroyView ( SDL_MetalView view)

6143}

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_MinimizeWindow()

bool SDL_MinimizeWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Request that the window be minimized to an iconic representation.

If the window is in a fullscreen state, this request has no direct effect. It may alter the state the window is returned to when leaving fullscreen.

On some windowing systems this request is asynchronous and the new window state may not have been applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the window state changes, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_MINIMIZED event will be emitted. Note that, as this is just a request, the windowing system can deny the state change.

Parameters
windowthe window to minimize.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_MaximizeWindow
SDL_RestoreWindow
SDL_SyncWindow
3364{
3365 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3366 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3367
3368 if (!_this->MinimizeWindow) {
3369 return SDL_Unsupported();
3370 }
3371
3372 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3373 window->pending_flags |= SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED;
3374 return true;
3375 }
3376
3377 _this->MinimizeWindow(_this, window);
3378 SDL_SyncIfRequired(window);
3379 return true;
3380}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, SDL_SyncIfRequired(), SDL_Unsupported, SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN, and SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED.

Referenced by ApplyWindowFlags(), SDL_CheckWindowDisplayChanged(), SDL_OnWindowFocusLost(), SDL_PromptAssertion(), SDL_SendKeyboardKeyInternal(), and SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode().

◆ SDL_OnApplicationDidEnterBackground()

void SDL_OnApplicationDidEnterBackground ( void )

Let iOS apps with external event handling report onApplicationDidEnterBackground.

This functions allows iOS apps that have their own event handling to hook into SDL to generate SDL events. This maps directly to an iOS-specific event, but since it doesn't do anything iOS-specific internally, it is available on all platforms, in case it might be useful for some specific paradigm. Most apps do not need to use this directly; SDL's internal event code will handle all this for windows created by SDL_CreateWindow!

Thread Safety
It is safe to call this function from any thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
5955{
5956 SDL_SendAppEvent(SDL_EVENT_DID_ENTER_BACKGROUND);
5957}
SDL_SendAppEvent
void SDL_SendAppEvent(SDL_EventType eventType)
Definition SDL_events.c:1911
SDL_EVENT_DID_ENTER_BACKGROUND
@ SDL_EVENT_DID_ENTER_BACKGROUND
Definition SDL_events.h:104

References SDL_EVENT_DID_ENTER_BACKGROUND, and SDL_SendAppEvent().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_OnWindowDisplayChanged()

void SDL_OnWindowDisplayChanged ( SDL_Window * window)
4072{
4073 // Don't run this if a fullscreen change was made in an event watcher callback in response to a display changed event.
4074 if (window->update_fullscreen_on_display_changed && (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN)) {
4075 const bool auto_mode_switch = SDL_GetHintBoolean(SDL_HINT_VIDEO_MATCH_EXCLUSIVE_MODE_ON_MOVE, true);
4076
4077 if (auto_mode_switch && (window->requested_fullscreen_mode.w != 0 || window->requested_fullscreen_mode.h != 0)) {
4078 SDL_DisplayID displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindowPosition(window);
4079 bool include_high_density_modes = false;
4080
4081 if (window->requested_fullscreen_mode.pixel_density > 1.0f) {
4082 include_high_density_modes = true;
4083 }
4084 const bool found_match = SDL_GetClosestFullscreenDisplayMode(displayID, window->requested_fullscreen_mode.w, window->requested_fullscreen_mode.h,
4085 window->requested_fullscreen_mode.refresh_rate, include_high_density_modes, &window->current_fullscreen_mode);
4086
4087 // If a mode without matching dimensions was not found, just go to fullscreen desktop.
4088 if (!found_match ||
4089 window->requested_fullscreen_mode.w != window->current_fullscreen_mode.w ||
4090 window->requested_fullscreen_mode.h != window->current_fullscreen_mode.h) {
4091 SDL_zero(window->current_fullscreen_mode);
4092 }
4093 } else {
4094 SDL_zero(window->current_fullscreen_mode);
4095 }
4096
4097 if (SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN_VISIBLE(window)) {
4098 SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(window, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_UPDATE, true);
4099 }
4100 }
4101
4102 SDL_CheckWindowPixelSizeChanged(window);
4103}
SDL_HINT_VIDEO_MATCH_EXCLUSIVE_MODE_ON_MOVE
#define SDL_HINT_VIDEO_MATCH_EXCLUSIVE_MODE_ON_MOVE

◆ SDL_OnWindowHidden()

void SDL_OnWindowHidden ( SDL_Window * window)
4060{
4061 /* Store the maximized and fullscreen flags for restoration later, in case
4062 * this was initiated by the window manager due to the window being unmapped
4063 * when minimized.
4064 */
4065 window->pending_flags |= (window->flags & (SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN | SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED));
4066
4067 // The window is already hidden at this point, so just change the mode back if necessary.
4068 SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(window, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_LEAVE, false);
4069}

◆ SDL_RaiseWindow()

bool SDL_RaiseWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Request that a window be raised above other windows and gain the input focus.

The result of this request is subject to desktop window manager policy, particularly if raising the requested window would result in stealing focus from another application. If the window is successfully raised and gains input focus, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_FOCUS_GAINED event will be emitted, and the window will have the SDL_WINDOW_INPUT_FOCUS flag set.

Parameters
windowthe window to raise.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
3328{
3329 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3330
3331 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3332 return true;
3333 }
3334 if (_this->RaiseWindow) {
3335 _this->RaiseWindow(_this, window);
3336 }
3337 return true;
3338}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, and SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN.

Referenced by SDL_ShowMessageBox().

Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ SDL_RecreateWindow()

bool SDL_RecreateWindow ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_WindowFlags flags )
2600{
2601 bool loaded_opengl = false;
2602 bool need_gl_unload = false;
2603 bool need_gl_load = false;
2604 bool loaded_vulkan = false;
2605 bool need_vulkan_unload = false;
2606 bool need_vulkan_load = false;
2607 SDL_WindowFlags graphics_flags;
2608
2609 // ensure no more than one of these flags is set
2610 graphics_flags = flags & (SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL | SDL_WINDOW_METAL | SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN);
2611 if (graphics_flags & (graphics_flags - 1)) {
2612 return SDL_SetError("Conflicting window flags specified");
2613 }
2614
2615 if ((flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) && !_this->GL_CreateContext) {
2616 return SDL_ContextNotSupported("OpenGL");
2617 }
2618 if ((flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN) && !_this->Vulkan_CreateSurface) {
2619 return SDL_ContextNotSupported("Vulkan");
2620 }
2621 if ((flags & SDL_WINDOW_METAL) && !_this->Metal_CreateView) {
2622 return SDL_ContextNotSupported("Metal");
2623 }
2624
2625 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL) {
2626 // Can't destroy and re-create external windows, hrm
2627 flags |= SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL;
2628 } else {
2629 flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL;
2630 }
2631
2632 // If this is a modal dialog, clear the modal status.
2633 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_MODAL) {
2634 SDL_SetWindowModal(window, false);
2635 }
2636
2637 // Restore video mode, etc.
2638 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL)) {
2639 const bool restore_on_show = window->restore_on_show;
2640 SDL_HideWindow(window);
2641 window->restore_on_show = restore_on_show;
2642 }
2643
2644 // Tear down the old native window
2645 SDL_DestroyWindowSurface(window);
2646
2647 if ((window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) != (flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL)) {
2648 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) {
2649 need_gl_load = true;
2650 } else {
2651 need_gl_unload = true;
2652 }
2653 } else if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL) {
2654 need_gl_unload = true;
2655 need_gl_load = true;
2656 }
2657
2658 if ((window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN) != (flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN)) {
2659 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN) {
2660 need_vulkan_load = true;
2661 } else {
2662 need_vulkan_unload = true;
2663 }
2664 } else if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN) {
2665 need_vulkan_unload = true;
2666 need_vulkan_load = true;
2667 }
2668
2669 if (need_gl_unload) {
2670 SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary();
2671 }
2672
2673 if (need_vulkan_unload) {
2674 SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary();
2675 }
2676
2677 if (_this->DestroyWindow && !(flags & SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL)) {
2678 _this->DestroyWindow(_this, window);
2679 }
2680
2681 if (need_gl_load) {
2682 if (!SDL_GL_LoadLibrary(NULL)) {
2683 return false;
2684 }
2685 loaded_opengl = true;
2686 }
2687
2688 if (need_vulkan_load) {
2689 if (!SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary(NULL)) {
2690 return false;
2691 }
2692 loaded_vulkan = true;
2693 }
2694
2695 window->flags = ((flags & CREATE_FLAGS) | SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN);
2696 window->is_destroying = false;
2697
2698 if (_this->CreateSDLWindow && !(flags & SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL)) {
2699 /* Reset the window size to the original floating value, so the
2700 * recreated window has the proper base size.
2701 */
2702 window->x = window->windowed.x = window->floating.x;
2703 window->y = window->windowed.y = window->floating.y;
2704 window->w = window->windowed.w = window->floating.w;
2705 window->h = window->windowed.h = window->floating.h;
2706
2707 if (!_this->CreateSDLWindow(_this, window, 0)) {
2708 if (loaded_opengl) {
2709 SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary();
2710 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL;
2711 }
2712 if (loaded_vulkan) {
2713 SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary();
2714 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN;
2715 }
2716 return false;
2717 }
2718 }
2719
2720 if (flags & SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL) {
2721 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL;
2722 }
2723
2724 if (_this->SetWindowTitle && window->title) {
2725 _this->SetWindowTitle(_this, window);
2726 }
2727
2728 if (_this->SetWindowIcon && window->icon) {
2729 _this->SetWindowIcon(_this, window, window->icon);
2730 }
2731
2732 if (_this->SetWindowMinimumSize && (window->min_w || window->min_h)) {
2733 _this->SetWindowMinimumSize(_this, window);
2734 }
2735
2736 if (_this->SetWindowMaximumSize && (window->max_w || window->max_h)) {
2737 _this->SetWindowMaximumSize(_this, window);
2738 }
2739
2740 if (_this->SetWindowAspectRatio && (window->min_aspect > 0.0f || window->max_aspect > 0.0f)) {
2741 _this->SetWindowAspectRatio(_this, window);
2742 }
2743
2744 if (window->hit_test) {
2745 _this->SetWindowHitTest(window, true);
2746 }
2747
2748 SDL_FinishWindowCreation(window, flags);
2749
2750 return true;
2751}

References _this, CREATE_FLAGS, NULL, SDL_ContextNotSupported(), SDL_DestroyWindowSurface(), SDL_FinishWindowCreation(), SDL_GL_LoadLibrary(), SDL_GL_UnloadLibrary(), SDL_HideWindow(), SDL_SetError(), SDL_SetWindowModal(), SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary(), SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary(), SDL_WINDOW_EXTERNAL, SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN, SDL_WINDOW_METAL, SDL_WINDOW_MODAL, SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL, and SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN.

Here is the call graph for this function:

1605{
1606 SDL_Window *w;
1607
1608 if (SDL_WINDOW_IS_POPUP(window)) {
1609 // Calculate the total offset of the popup from the parents
1610 for (w = window->parent; w; w = w->parent) {
1611 rel_x += w->x;
1612 rel_y += w->y;
1613
1614 if (!SDL_WINDOW_IS_POPUP(w)) {
1615 break;
1616 }
1617 }
1618 }
1619
1620 if (abs_x) {
1621 *abs_x = rel_x;
1622 }
1623 if (abs_y) {
1624 *abs_y = rel_y;
1625 }
1626}

◆ SDL_RestoreWindow()

bool SDL_RestoreWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Request that the size and position of a minimized or maximized window be restored.

If the window is in a fullscreen state, this request has no direct effect. It may alter the state the window is returned to when leaving fullscreen.

On some windowing systems this request is asynchronous and the new window state may not have have been applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the window state changes, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_RESTORED event will be emitted. Note that, as this is just a request, the windowing system can deny the state change.

Parameters
windowthe window to restore.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_MaximizeWindow
SDL_MinimizeWindow
SDL_SyncWindow
3383{
3384 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3385 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3386
3387 if (!_this->RestoreWindow) {
3388 return SDL_Unsupported();
3389 }
3390
3391 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3392 window->pending_flags &= ~(SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED | SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED);
3393 return true;
3394 }
3395
3396 _this->RestoreWindow(_this, window);
3397 SDL_SyncIfRequired(window);
3398 return true;
3399}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, SDL_SyncIfRequired(), SDL_Unsupported, SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN, SDL_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED, and SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED.

The screensaver is disabled by default.

1442 SDL_DisplayMode last_mode;
1443
1444 if (display->fullscreen_active) {
1445 // This is a temporary mode change, don't save the desktop mode
1446 return;
1447 }
1448
1449 SDL_copyp(&last_mode, &display->desktop_mode);
1450
1451 if (display->desktop_mode.internal) {
1452 SDL_free(display->desktop_mode.internal);
1453 }

1455 display->desktop_mode.displayID = display->id;
1456 SDL_FinalizeDisplayMode(&display->desktop_mode);
1457

◆ SDL_SetDisplayModeForDisplay()

bool SDL_SetDisplayModeForDisplay ( SDL_VideoDisplay * display,
SDL_DisplayMode * mode )
1505{
1506 /* Mode switching is being emulated per-window; nothing to do and cannot fail,
1507 * except for XWayland, which still needs the actual mode setting call since
1508 * it's emulated via the XRandR interface.
1509 */
1510 if (SDL_ModeSwitchingEmulated(_this) && SDL_strcmp(_this->name, "x11") != 0) {
1511 return true;
1512 }
1513
1514 if (!mode) {
1515 mode = &display->desktop_mode;
1516 }
1517
1518 if (mode == display->current_mode) {
1519 return true;
1520 }
1521
1522 // Actually change the display mode
1523 if (_this->SetDisplayMode) {
1524 bool result;
1525
1526 _this->setting_display_mode = true;
1527 result = _this->SetDisplayMode(_this, display, mode);
1528 _this->setting_display_mode = false;
1529 if (!result) {
1530 return false;
1531 }
1532 }
1533
1534 SDL_SetCurrentDisplayMode(display, mode);
1535
1536 return true;
1537}

◆ SDL_SetWindowAlwaysOnTop()

bool SDL_SetWindowAlwaysOnTop ( SDL_Window * window,
bool on_top )

Set the window to always be above the others.

This will add or remove the window's SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP flag. This will bring the window to the front and keep the window above the rest.

Parameters
windowthe window of which to change the always on top state.
on_toptrue to set the window always on top, false to disable.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowFlags
3007{
3008 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3009 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3010
3011 const bool want = (on_top != false); // normalize the flag.
3012 const bool have = ((window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP) != 0);
3013 if ((want != have) && (_this->SetWindowAlwaysOnTop)) {
3014 if (want) {
3015 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP;
3016 } else {
3017 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP;
3018 }
3019 _this->SetWindowAlwaysOnTop(_this, window, want);
3020 }
3021
3022 return true;
3023}
SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP
#define SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP
Definition SDL_video.h:211

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, and SDL_WINDOW_ALWAYS_ON_TOP.

◆ SDL_SetWindowAspectRatio()

bool SDL_SetWindowAspectRatio ( SDL_Window * window,
float min_aspect,
float max_aspect )

Request that the aspect ratio of a window's client area be set.

The aspect ratio is the ratio of width divided by height, e.g. 2560x1600 would be 1.6. Larger aspect ratios are wider and smaller aspect ratios are narrower.

If, at the time of this request, the window in a fixed-size state, such as maximized or fullscreen, the request will be deferred until the window exits this state and becomes resizable again.

On some windowing systems, this request is asynchronous and the new window aspect ratio may not have have been applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the window size changes, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_RESIZED event will be emitted with the new window dimensions. Note that the new dimensions may not match the exact aspect ratio requested, as some windowing systems can restrict the window size in certain scenarios (e.g. constraining the size of the content area to remain within the usable desktop bounds). Additionally, as this is just a request, it can be denied by the windowing system.

Parameters
windowthe window to change.
min_aspectthe minimum aspect ratio of the window, or 0.0f for no limit.
max_aspectthe maximum aspect ratio of the window, or 0.0f for no limit.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowAspectRatio
SDL_SyncWindow
3086{
3087 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3088
3089 window->min_aspect = min_aspect;
3090 window->max_aspect = max_aspect;
3091 if (_this->SetWindowAspectRatio) {
3092 _this->SetWindowAspectRatio(_this, window);
3093 }
3094 return SDL_SetWindowSize(window, window->floating.w, window->floating.h);
3095}
SDL_SetWindowSize
bool SDL_SetWindowSize(SDL_Window *window, int w, int h)
Definition SDL_video.c:3025

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, and SDL_SetWindowSize().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_SetWindowBordered()

bool SDL_SetWindowBordered ( SDL_Window * window,
bool bordered )

Set the border state of a window.

This will add or remove the window's SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS flag and add or remove the border from the actual window. This is a no-op if the window's border already matches the requested state.

You can't change the border state of a fullscreen window.

Parameters
windowthe window of which to change the border state.
borderedfalse to remove border, true to add border.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowFlags
2968{
2969 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
2970 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
2971
2972 const bool want = (bordered != false); // normalize the flag.
2973 const bool have = !(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS);
2974 if ((want != have) && (_this->SetWindowBordered)) {
2975 if (want) {
2976 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS;
2977 } else {
2978 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS;
2979 }
2980 _this->SetWindowBordered(_this, window, want);
2981 }
2982
2983 return true;
2984}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, and SDL_WINDOW_BORDERLESS.

3770{

3772
3773 const bool want = (focusable != false); // normalize the flag.
3774 const bool have = !(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_NOT_FOCUSABLE);
3775 if ((want != have) && (_this->SetWindowFocusable)) {
3776 if (want) {
3777 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_NOT_FOCUSABLE;
3778 } else {
3779 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_NOT_FOCUSABLE;
3780 }
3781 if (!_this->SetWindowFocusable(_this, window, want)) {
3782 return false;
3783 }
3784 }

3786 return true;

◆ SDL_SetWindowFullscreen()

bool SDL_SetWindowFullscreen ( SDL_Window * window,
bool fullscreen )

Request that the window's fullscreen state be changed.

By default a window in fullscreen state uses borderless fullscreen desktop mode, but a specific exclusive display mode can be set using SDL_SetWindowFullscreenMode().

On some windowing systems this request is asynchronous and the new fullscreen state may not have have been applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the window state changes, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_ENTER_FULLSCREEN or SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_LEAVE_FULLSCREEN event will be emitted. Note that, as this is just a request, it can be denied by the windowing system.

Parameters
windowthe window to change.
fullscreentrue for fullscreen mode, false for windowed mode.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowFullscreenMode
SDL_SetWindowFullscreenMode
SDL_SyncWindow
SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN
3402{
3403 bool result;
3404
3405 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3406 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3407
3408 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3409 if (fullscreen) {
3410 window->pending_flags |= SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN;
3411 } else {
3412 window->pending_flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN;
3413 }
3414 return true;
3415 }
3416
3417 if (fullscreen) {
3418 // Set the current fullscreen mode to the desired mode
3419 SDL_copyp(&window->current_fullscreen_mode, &window->requested_fullscreen_mode);
3420 }
3421
3422 result = SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(window, fullscreen ? SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_ENTER : SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_LEAVE, true);
3423
3424 if (!fullscreen || !result) {
3425 // Clear the current fullscreen mode.
3426 SDL_zero(window->current_fullscreen_mode);
3427 }
3428
3429 if (result) {
3430 SDL_SyncIfRequired(window);
3431 }
3432
3433 return result;
3434}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, SDL_copyp, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_ENTER, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_LEAVE, SDL_SyncIfRequired(), SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(), SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN, SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN, and SDL_zero.

Referenced by ApplyWindowFlags().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_SetWindowFullscreenMode()

bool SDL_SetWindowFullscreenMode ( SDL_Window * window,
const SDL_DisplayMode * mode )

Set the display mode to use when a window is visible and fullscreen.

This only affects the display mode used when the window is fullscreen. To change the window size when the window is not fullscreen, use SDL_SetWindowSize().

If the window is currently in the fullscreen state, this request is asynchronous on some windowing systems and the new mode dimensions may not be applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the new mode takes effect, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_RESIZED and/or an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_PIXEL_SIZE_CHANGED event will be emitted with the new mode dimensions.

Parameters
windowthe window to affect.
modea pointer to the display mode to use, which can be NULL for borderless fullscreen desktop mode, or one of the fullscreen modes returned by SDL_GetFullscreenDisplayModes() to set an exclusive fullscreen mode.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowFullscreenMode
SDL_SetWindowFullscreen
SDL_SyncWindow
2101{
2102 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
2103 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
2104
2105 if (mode) {
2106 if (!SDL_GetFullscreenModeMatch(mode)) {
2107 return SDL_SetError("Invalid fullscreen display mode");
2108 }
2109
2110 // Save the mode so we can look up the closest match later
2111 SDL_copyp(&window->requested_fullscreen_mode, mode);
2112 } else {
2113 SDL_zero(window->requested_fullscreen_mode);
2114 }
2115
2116 /* Copy to the current mode now, in case an asynchronous fullscreen window request
2117 * is in progress. It will be overwritten if a new request is made.
2118 */
2119 SDL_copyp(&window->current_fullscreen_mode, &window->requested_fullscreen_mode);
2120 if (SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN_VISIBLE(window)) {
2121 SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(window, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_UPDATE, true);
2122 SDL_SyncIfRequired(window);
2123 }
2124
2125 return true;
2126}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, SDL_copyp, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_UPDATE, SDL_GetFullscreenModeMatch(), SDL_SetError(), SDL_SyncIfRequired(), SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(), SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN_VISIBLE, and SDL_zero.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_SetWindowHitTest()

bool SDL_SetWindowHitTest ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_HitTest callback,
void * callback_data )

Provide a callback that decides if a window region has special properties.

Normally windows are dragged and resized by decorations provided by the system window manager (a title bar, borders, etc), but for some apps, it makes sense to drag them from somewhere else inside the window itself; for example, one might have a borderless window that wants to be draggable from any part, or simulate its own title bar, etc.

This function lets the app provide a callback that designates pieces of a given window as special. This callback is run during event processing if we need to tell the OS to treat a region of the window specially; the use of this callback is known as "hit testing."

Mouse input may not be delivered to your application if it is within a special area; the OS will often apply that input to moving the window or resizing the window and not deliver it to the application.

Specifying NULL for a callback disables hit-testing. Hit-testing is disabled by default.

Platforms that don't support this functionality will return false unconditionally, even if you're attempting to disable hit-testing.

Your callback may fire at any time, and its firing does not indicate any specific behavior (for example, on Windows, this certainly might fire when the OS is deciding whether to drag your window, but it fires for lots of other reasons, too, some unrelated to anything you probably care about and when the mouse isn't actually at the location it is testing). Since this can fire at any time, you should try to keep your callback efficient, devoid of allocations, etc.

Parameters
windowthe window to set hit-testing on.
callbackthe function to call when doing a hit-test.
callback_dataan app-defined void pointer passed to callback.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
5883{
5884 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
5885
5886 if (!_this->SetWindowHitTest) {
5887 return SDL_Unsupported();
5888 }
5889
5890 window->hit_test = callback;
5891 window->hit_test_data = callback_data;
5892
5893 return _this->SetWindowHitTest(window, callback != NULL);
5894}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, NULL, and SDL_Unsupported.

◆ SDL_SetWindowIcon()

bool SDL_SetWindowIcon ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_Surface * icon )

Set the icon for a window.

If this function is passed a surface with alternate representations added using SDL_AddSurfaceAlternateImage(), the surface will be interpreted as the content to be used for 100% display scale, and the alternate representations will be used for high DPI situations. For example, if the original surface is 32x32, then on a 2x macOS display or 200% display scale on Windows, a 64x64 version of the image will be used, if available. If a matching version of the image isn't available, the closest larger size image will be downscaled to the appropriate size and be used instead, if available. Otherwise, the closest smaller image will be upscaled and be used instead.

Parameters
windowthe window to change.
iconan SDL_Surface structure containing the icon for the window.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_AddSurfaceAlternateImage
2841{
2842 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
2843
2844 if (!icon) {
2845 return SDL_InvalidParamError("icon");
2846 }
2847
2848 SDL_DestroySurface(window->icon);
2849
2850 // Convert the icon into ARGB8888
2851 window->icon = SDL_ConvertSurface(icon, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB8888);
2852 if (!window->icon) {
2853 return false;
2854 }
2855
2856 if (!_this->SetWindowIcon) {
2857 return SDL_Unsupported();
2858 }
2859
2860 return _this->SetWindowIcon(_this, window, window->icon);
2861}

◆ SDL_SetWindowKeyboardGrab()

bool SDL_SetWindowKeyboardGrab ( SDL_Window * window,
bool grabbed )

Set a window's keyboard grab mode.

Keyboard grab enables capture of system keyboard shortcuts like Alt+Tab or the Meta/Super key. Note that not all system keyboard shortcuts can be captured by applications (one example is Ctrl+Alt+Del on Windows).

This is primarily intended for specialized applications such as VNC clients or VM frontends. Normal games should not use keyboard grab.

When keyboard grab is enabled, SDL will continue to handle Alt+Tab when the window is full-screen to ensure the user is not trapped in your application. If you have a custom keyboard shortcut to exit fullscreen mode, you may suppress this behavior with SDL_HINT_ALLOW_ALT_TAB_WHILE_GRABBED.

If the caller enables a grab while another window is currently grabbed, the other window loses its grab in favor of the caller's window.

Parameters
windowthe window for which the keyboard grab mode should be set.
grabbedthis is true to grab keyboard, and false to release.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowKeyboardGrab
SDL_SetWindowMouseGrab
3843{
3844 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3845 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3846
3847 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3848 if (grabbed) {
3849 window->pending_flags |= SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED;
3850 } else {
3851 window->pending_flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED;
3852 }
3853 return true;
3854 }
3855
3856 if (!!grabbed == !!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED)) {
3857 return true;
3858 }
3859 if (grabbed) {
3860 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED;
3861 } else {
3862 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED;
3863 }
3864 SDL_UpdateWindowGrab(window);
3865
3866 if (grabbed && !(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED)) {
3867 return false;
3868 }
3869 return true;
3870}

References CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, SDL_UpdateWindowGrab(), SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN, and SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED.

Referenced by ApplyWindowFlags().

◆ SDL_SetWindowMaximumSize()

int max_w,
int max_h )

Set the maximum size of a window's client area.

max_wthe maximum width of the window, or 0 for no limit.
max_hthe maximum height of the window, or 0 for no limit.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowMaximumSize
SDL_SetWindowMinimumSize
3217{
3218 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3219 if (max_w < 0) {
3220 return SDL_InvalidParamError("max_w");
3221 }
3222 if (max_h < 0) {
3223 return SDL_InvalidParamError("max_h");
3224 }
3225
3226 if ((max_w && max_w < window->min_w) ||
3227 (max_h && max_h < window->min_h)) {
3228 return SDL_SetError("SDL_SetWindowMaximumSize(): Tried to set maximum size smaller than minimum size");
3229 }
3230
3231 window->max_w = max_w;
3232 window->max_h = max_h;
3233
3234 if (_this->SetWindowMaximumSize) {
3235 _this->SetWindowMaximumSize(_this, window);
3236 }
3237
3238 // Ensure that window is not larger than maximal size
3239 int w = window->last_size_pending ? window->pending.w : window->floating.w;
3240 int h = window->last_size_pending ? window->pending.h : window->floating.h;
3241 w = window->max_w ? SDL_min(w, window->max_w) : w;
3242 h = window->max_h ? SDL_min(h, window->max_h) : h;
3243 return SDL_SetWindowSize(window, w, h);
3244}
SDL_min
#define SDL_min(x, y)

◆ SDL_SetWindowModal()

bool SDL_SetWindowModal ( SDL_Window * window,
bool modal )

Toggle the state of the window as modal.

To enable modal status on a window, the window must currently be the child window of a parent, or toggling modal status on will fail.

Parameters
windowthe window on which to set the modal state.
modaltrue to toggle modal status on, false to toggle it off.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetWindowParent
SDL_WINDOW_MODAL
3701{
3702 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3703 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3704
3705 if (!_this->SetWindowModal) {
3706 return SDL_Unsupported();
3707 }
3708
3709 if (modal) {
3710 if (!window->parent) {
3711 return SDL_SetError("Window must have a parent to enable the modal state; use SDL_SetWindowParent() to set the parent first.");
3712 }
3713 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_MODAL;
3714 } else if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_MODAL) {
3715 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_MODAL;
3716 } else {
3717 return true; // Already not modal, so nothing to do.
3718 }
3719
3720 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) {
3721 return true;
3722 }
3723
3724 return _this->SetWindowModal(_this, window, modal);
3725}

◆ SDL_SetWindowMouseRect()
