Confines the cursor to the specified area of a window.

Note that this does NOT grab the cursor, it only defines the area a cursor is restricted to when the window has mouse focus.

◆ SDL_SetWindowOpacity()

bool SDL_SetWindowOpacity ( SDL_Window * window,
float opacity )

Set the opacity for a window.

The parameter opacity will be clamped internally between 0.0f (transparent) and 1.0f (opaque).

This function also returns false if setting the opacity isn't supported.

Parameters
windowthe window which will be made transparent or opaque.
opacitythe opacity value (0.0f - transparent, 1.0f - opaque).
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowOpacity
3638{
3639 bool result;
3640
3641 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3642
3643 if (!_this->SetWindowOpacity) {
3644 return SDL_Unsupported();
3645 }
3646
3647 if (opacity < 0.0f) {
3648 opacity = 0.0f;
3649 } else if (opacity > 1.0f) {
3650 opacity = 1.0f;
3651 }
3652
3653 result = _this->SetWindowOpacity(_this, window, opacity);
3654 if (result) {
3655 window->opacity = opacity;
3656 }
3657
3658 return result;
3659}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, and SDL_Unsupported.

◆ SDL_SetWindowParent()

bool SDL_SetWindowParent ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_Window * parent )

Set the window as a child of a parent window.

If the window is already the child of an existing window, it will be reparented to the new owner. Setting the parent window to NULL unparents the window and removes child window status.

If a parent window is hidden or destroyed, the operation will be recursively applied to child windows. Child windows hidden with the parent that did not have their hidden status explicitly set will be restored when the parent is shown.

Attempting to set the parent of a window that is currently in the modal state will fail. Use SDL_SetWindowModal() to cancel the modal status before attempting to change the parent.

Popup windows cannot change parents and attempts to do so will fail.

Setting a parent window that is currently the sibling or descendent of the child window results in undefined behavior.

Parameters
windowthe window that should become the child of a parent.
parentthe new parent window for the child window.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetWindowModal
3669{
3670 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3671 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
3672
3673 if (parent) {
3674 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(parent, false);
3675 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(parent, false);
3676 }
3677
3678 if (window == parent) {
3679 return SDL_SetError("Cannot set the parent of a window to itself.");
3680 }
3681
3682 if (!_this->SetWindowParent) {
3683 return SDL_Unsupported();
3684 }
3685
3686 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_MODAL) {
3687 return SDL_SetError("Modal windows cannot change parents; call SDL_SetWindowModal() to clear modal status first.");
3688 }
3689
3690 if (window->parent == parent) {
3691 return true;
3692 }
3693
3694 const bool ret = _this->SetWindowParent(_this, window, parent);
3695 SDL_UpdateWindowHierarchy(window, ret ? parent : NULL);
3696
3697 return ret;
3698}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP, NULL, SDL_SetError(), SDL_Unsupported, SDL_UpdateWindowHierarchy(), and SDL_WINDOW_MODAL.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_SetWindowPosition()

bool SDL_SetWindowPosition ( SDL_Window * window,
int x,
int y )

Request that the window's position be set.

If the window is in an exclusive fullscreen or maximized state, this request has no effect.

This can be used to reposition fullscreen-desktop windows onto a different display, however, as exclusive fullscreen windows are locked to a specific display, they can only be repositioned programmatically via SDL_SetWindowFullscreenMode().

On some windowing systems this request is asynchronous and the new coordinates may not have have been applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the window position changes, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_MOVED event will be emitted with the window's new coordinates. Note that the new coordinates may not match the exact coordinates requested, as some windowing systems can restrict the position of the window in certain scenarios (e.g. constraining the position so the window is always within desktop bounds). Additionally, as this is just a request, it can be denied by the windowing system.

Parameters
windowthe window to reposition.
xthe x coordinate of the window, or SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED or SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED.
ythe y coordinate of the window, or SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED or SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowPosition
SDL_SyncWindow
2864{
2865 SDL_DisplayID original_displayID;
2866
2867 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
2868
2869 const int w = window->last_size_pending ? window->pending.w : window->windowed.w;
2870 const int h = window->last_size_pending ? window->pending.h : window->windowed.h;
2871
2872 original_displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(window);
2873
2874 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(x)) {
2875 x = window->windowed.x;
2876 }
2877 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED(y)) {
2878 y = window->windowed.y;
2879 }
2880 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(x) || SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(y)) {
2881 SDL_DisplayID displayID = original_displayID;
2882 SDL_Rect bounds;
2883
2884 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(x) && (x & 0xFFFF)) {
2885 displayID = (x & 0xFFFF);
2886 } else if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(y) && (y & 0xFFFF)) {
2887 displayID = (y & 0xFFFF);
2888 }
2889 if (displayID == 0 || SDL_GetDisplayIndex(displayID) < 0) {
2890 displayID = SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay();
2891 }
2892
2893 SDL_zero(bounds);
2894 if (!SDL_GetDisplayUsableBounds(displayID, &bounds) || w > bounds.w || h > bounds.h) {
2895 if (!SDL_GetDisplayBounds(displayID, &bounds)) {
2896 return false;
2897 }
2898 }
2899 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(x)) {
2900 x = bounds.x + (bounds.w - w) / 2;
2901 }
2902 if (SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED(y)) {
2903 y = bounds.y + (bounds.h - h) / 2;
2904 }
2905 }
2906
2907 window->pending.x = x;
2908 window->pending.y = y;
2909 window->undefined_x = false;
2910 window->undefined_y = false;
2911 window->last_position_pending = true;
2912
2913 if (_this->SetWindowPosition) {
2914 const bool result = _this->SetWindowPosition(_this, window);
2915 if (result) {
2916 SDL_SyncIfRequired(window);
2917 }
2918 return result;
2919 }
2920
2921 return SDL_Unsupported();
2922}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, SDL_Rect::h, SDL_GetDisplayBounds(), SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(), SDL_GetDisplayIndex(), SDL_GetDisplayUsableBounds(), SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay(), SDL_SyncIfRequired(), SDL_Unsupported, SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISCENTERED, SDL_WINDOWPOS_ISUNDEFINED, SDL_zero, SDL_Rect::w, SDL_Rect::x, and SDL_Rect::y.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_SetWindowRelativeMouseMode()

bool SDL_SetWindowRelativeMouseMode ( SDL_Window * window,
bool enabled )

Set relative mouse mode for a window.

While the window has focus and relative mouse mode is enabled, the cursor is hidden, the mouse position is constrained to the window, and SDL will report continuous relative mouse motion even if the mouse is at the edge of the window.

If you'd like to keep the mouse position fixed while in relative mode you can use SDL_SetWindowMouseRect(). If you'd like the cursor to be at a specific location when relative mode ends, you should use SDL_WarpMouseInWindow() before disabling relative mode.

This function will flush any pending mouse motion for this window.

Parameters
windowthe window to change.
enabledtrue to enable relative mode, false to disable.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowRelativeMouseMode
3952{
3953 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3954
3955 /* If the app toggles relative mode directly, it probably shouldn't
3956 * also be emulating it using repeated mouse warps, so disable
3957 * mouse warp emulation by default.
3958 */
3959 SDL_DisableMouseWarpEmulation();
3960
3961 if (enabled == SDL_GetWindowRelativeMouseMode(window)) {
3962 return true;
3963 }
3964
3965 if (enabled) {
3966 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_RELATIVE_MODE;
3967 } else {
3968 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_RELATIVE_MODE;
3969 }
3970 SDL_UpdateRelativeMouseMode();
3971
3972 return true;
3973}

◆ SDL_SetWindowResizable()

bool SDL_SetWindowResizable ( SDL_Window * window,
bool resizable )

Set the user-resizable state of a window.

This will add or remove the window's SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE flag and allow/disallow user resizing of the window. This is a no-op if the window's resizable state already matches the requested state.

You can't change the resizable state of a fullscreen window.

Parameters
windowthe window of which to change the resizable state.
resizabletrue to allow resizing, false to disallow.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowFlags
2987{
2988 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
2989 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false);
2990
2991 const bool want = (resizable != false); // normalize the flag.
2992 const bool have = ((window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE) != 0);
2993 if ((want != have) && (_this->SetWindowResizable)) {
2994 if (want) {
2995 window->flags |= SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE;
2996 } else {
2997 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE;
2998 SDL_copyp(&window->windowed, &window->floating);
2999 }
3000 _this->SetWindowResizable(_this, window, want);
3001 }
3002
3003 return true;
3004}

◆ SDL_SetWindowShape()

bool SDL_SetWindowShape ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_Surface * shape )

Set the shape of a transparent window.

This sets the alpha channel of a transparent window and any fully transparent areas are also transparent to mouse clicks. If you are using something besides the SDL render API, then you are responsible for drawing the alpha channel of the window to match the shape alpha channel to get consistent cross-platform results.

The shape is copied inside this function, so you can free it afterwards. If your shape surface changes, you should call SDL_SetWindowShape() again to update the window. This is an expensive operation, so should be done sparingly.

The window must have been created with the SDL_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT flag.

Parameters
windowthe window.
shapethe surface representing the shape of the window, or NULL to remove any current shape.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
5897{
5898 SDL_PropertiesID props;
5899 SDL_Surface *surface;
5900
5901 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
5902
5903 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT)) {
5904 return SDL_SetError("Window must be created with SDL_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT");
5905 }
5906
5907 props = SDL_GetWindowProperties(window);
5908 if (!props) {
5909 return false;
5910 }
5911
5912 surface = SDL_ConvertSurface(shape, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB32);
5913 if (!surface) {
5914 return false;
5915 }
5916
5917 if (!SDL_SetSurfaceProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_SHAPE_POINTER, surface)) {
5918 return false;
5919 }
5920
5921 if (_this->UpdateWindowShape) {
5922 if (!_this->UpdateWindowShape(_this, window, surface)) {
5923 return false;
5924 }
5925 }
5926 return true;
5927}
SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB32
@ SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB32

◆ SDL_SetWindowSize()

bool SDL_SetWindowSize ( SDL_Window * window,
int w,
int h )

Request that the size of a window's client area be set.

If the window is in a fullscreen or maximized state, this request has no effect.

To change the exclusive fullscreen mode of a window, use SDL_SetWindowFullscreenMode().

On some windowing systems, this request is asynchronous and the new window size may not have have been applied immediately upon the return of this function. If an immediate change is required, call SDL_SyncWindow() to block until the changes have taken effect.

When the window size changes, an SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_RESIZED event will be emitted with the new window dimensions. Note that the new dimensions may not match the exact size requested, as some windowing systems can restrict the window size in certain scenarios (e.g. constraining the size of the content area to remain within the usable desktop bounds). Additionally, as this is just a request, it can be denied by the windowing system.

Parameters
windowthe window to change.
wthe width of the window, must be > 0.
hthe height of the window, must be > 0.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowSize
SDL_SetWindowFullscreenMode
SDL_SyncWindow
3026{
3027 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3028
3029 if (w <= 0) {
3030 return SDL_InvalidParamError("w");
3031 }
3032 if (h <= 0) {
3033 return SDL_InvalidParamError("h");
3034 }
3035
3036 // It is possible for the aspect ratio constraints to not satisfy the size constraints.
3037 // The size constraints will override the aspect ratio constraints so we will apply the
3038 // the aspect ratio constraints first
3039 float new_aspect = w / (float)h;
3040 if (window->max_aspect > 0.0f && new_aspect > window->max_aspect) {
3041 w = (int)SDL_roundf(h * window->max_aspect);
3042 } else if (window->min_aspect > 0.0f && new_aspect < window->min_aspect) {
3043 h = (int)SDL_roundf(w / window->min_aspect);
3044 }
3045
3046 // Make sure we don't exceed any window size limits
3047 if (window->min_w && w < window->min_w) {
3048 w = window->min_w;
3049 }
3050 if (window->max_w && w > window->max_w) {
3051 w = window->max_w;
3052 }
3053 if (window->min_h && h < window->min_h) {
3054 h = window->min_h;
3055 }
3056 if (window->max_h && h > window->max_h) {
3057 h = window->max_h;
3058 }
3059
3060 window->last_size_pending = true;
3061 window->pending.w = w;
3062 window->pending.h = h;
3063
3064 if (_this->SetWindowSize) {
3065 _this->SetWindowSize(_this, window);
3066 SDL_SyncIfRequired(window);
3067 } else {
3068 return SDL_Unsupported();
3069 }
3070 return true;
3071}
SDL_roundf
SDL_DECLSPEC float SDLCALL SDL_roundf(float x)
Definition SDL_stdlib.c:403

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, SDL_InvalidParamError, SDL_roundf(), SDL_SyncIfRequired(), and SDL_Unsupported.

◆ SDL_SetWindowSurfaceVSync()

bool SDL_SetWindowSurfaceVSync ( SDL_Window * window,
int vsync )

Toggle VSync for the window surface.

When a window surface is created, vsync defaults to SDL_WINDOW_SURFACE_VSYNC_DISABLED.

The vsync parameter can be 1 to synchronize present with every vertical refresh, 2 to synchronize present with every second vertical refresh, etc., SDL_WINDOW_SURFACE_VSYNC_ADAPTIVE for late swap tearing (adaptive vsync), or SDL_WINDOW_SURFACE_VSYNC_DISABLED to disable. Not every value is supported by every driver, so you should check the return value to see whether the requested setting is supported.

Parameters
windowthe window.
vsyncthe vertical refresh sync interval.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowSurfaceVSync
3572{
3573 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3574
3575 if (!_this->SetWindowFramebufferVSync) {
3576 return SDL_Unsupported();
3577 }
3578 return _this->SetWindowFramebufferVSync(_this, window, vsync);
3579}

References _this, CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC, and SDL_Unsupported.

2813 if (title == window->title) {
2814 return true;
2815 }

◆ SDL_ShouldFocusPopup()

bool SDL_ShouldFocusPopup ( SDL_Window * window)
3747{
3748 SDL_Window *toplevel_parent;
3749 for (toplevel_parent = window->parent; SDL_WINDOW_IS_POPUP(toplevel_parent); toplevel_parent = toplevel_parent->parent) {
3750 }
3751
3752 SDL_Window *current_focus = toplevel_parent->keyboard_focus;
3753 bool found_higher_focus = false;
3754
3755 /* Traverse the window tree from the currently focused window to the toplevel parent and see if we encounter
3756 * the new focus request. If the new window is found, a higher-level window already has focus.
3757 */
3758 SDL_Window *w;
3759 for (w = current_focus; w != toplevel_parent; w = w->parent) {
3760 if (w == window) {
3761 found_higher_focus = true;
3762 break;
3763 }
3764 }
3765
3766 return !found_higher_focus || w == toplevel_parent;
3767}
SDL_Window::keyboard_focus
SDL_Window * keyboard_focus
Definition SDL_sysvideo.h:138

References SDL_Window::keyboard_focus, SDL_Window::parent, and SDL_WINDOW_IS_POPUP.

◆ SDL_ShouldMinimizeOnFocusLoss()

bool SDL_ShouldMinimizeOnFocusLoss ( SDL_Window * window)
static
4242{
4243 const char *hint;
4244
4245 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) || window->is_destroying) {
4246 return false;
4247 }
4248
4249#if defined(SDL_PLATFORM_MACOS) && defined(SDL_VIDEO_DRIVER_COCOA)
4250 if (SDL_strcmp(_this->name, "cocoa") == 0) { // don't do this for X11, etc
4251 if (Cocoa_IsShowingModalDialog(window)) {
4252 return false; // modal system dialogs can live over fullscreen windows, don't minimize.
4253 } else if (Cocoa_IsWindowInFullscreenSpace(window)) {
4254 return false;
4255 }
4256 }
4257#endif
4258
4259#ifdef SDL_PLATFORM_ANDROID
4260 {
4261 extern bool Android_JNI_ShouldMinimizeOnFocusLoss(void);
4262 if (!Android_JNI_ShouldMinimizeOnFocusLoss()) {
4263 return false;
4264 }
4265 }
4266#endif
4267
4268 // Real fullscreen windows should minimize on focus loss so the desktop video mode is restored
4269 hint = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_VIDEO_MINIMIZE_ON_FOCUS_LOSS);
4270 if (!hint || !*hint || SDL_strcasecmp(hint, "auto") == 0) {
4271 if (window->fullscreen_exclusive && !SDL_ModeSwitchingEmulated(_this)) {
4272 return true;
4273 } else {
4274 return false;
4275 }
4276 }
4277 return SDL_GetHintBoolean(SDL_HINT_VIDEO_MINIMIZE_ON_FOCUS_LOSS, false);
4278}
Android_JNI_ShouldMinimizeOnFocusLoss

◆ SDL_ShouldRelinquishPopupFocus()

bool SDL_ShouldRelinquishPopupFocus ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_Window ** new_focus )
3728{
3729 SDL_Window *focus = window->parent;
3730 bool set_focus = !!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_INPUT_FOCUS);
3731
3732 // Find the highest level window, up to the toplevel parent, that isn't being hidden or destroyed, and can grab the keyboard focus.
3733 while (SDL_WINDOW_IS_POPUP(focus) && ((focus->flags & SDL_WINDOW_NOT_FOCUSABLE) || focus->is_hiding || focus->is_destroying)) {
3734 focus = focus->parent;
3735
3736 // If some window in the chain currently had focus, set it to the new lowest-level window.
3737 if (!set_focus) {
3738 set_focus = !!(focus->flags & SDL_WINDOW_INPUT_FOCUS);
3739 }
3740 }
3741
3742 *new_focus = focus;
3743 return set_focus;
3744}

◆ SDL_ShowMessageBox()

bool SDL_ShowMessageBox ( const SDL_MessageBoxData * messageboxdata,
int * buttonid )

Create a modal message box.

If your needs aren't complex, it might be easier to use SDL_ShowSimpleMessageBox.

This function should be called on the thread that created the parent window, or on the main thread if the messagebox has no parent. It will block execution of that thread until the user clicks a button or closes the messagebox.

This function may be called at any time, even before SDL_Init(). This makes it useful for reporting errors like a failure to create a renderer or OpenGL context.

On X11, SDL rolls its own dialog box with X11 primitives instead of a formal toolkit like GTK+ or Qt.

Note that if SDL_Init() would fail because there isn't any available video target, this function is likely to fail for the same reasons. If this is a concern, check the return value from this function and fall back to writing to stderr if you can.

Parameters
messageboxdatathe SDL_MessageBoxData structure with title, text and other options.
buttonidthe pointer to which user id of hit button should be copied.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_ShowSimpleMessageBox
5700{
5701 int dummybutton;
5702 bool result = false;
5703 bool show_cursor_prev;
5704 SDL_Window *current_window;
5705 SDL_MessageBoxData mbdata;
5706
5707 if (!messageboxdata) {
5708 return SDL_InvalidParamError("messageboxdata");
5709 } else if (messageboxdata->numbuttons < 0) {
5710 return SDL_SetError("Invalid number of buttons");
5711 }
5712
5713 // in case either the title or message was a pointer from SDL_GetError(), make a copy
5714 // now, as we'll likely overwrite error state in here.
5715 bool titleisstack = false, msgisstack = false;
5716 char *titlecpy = NULL;
5717 char *msgcpy = NULL;
5718 if (messageboxdata->title) {
5719 const size_t slen = SDL_strlen(messageboxdata->title) + 1;
5720 titlecpy = SDL_small_alloc(char, slen, &titleisstack);
5721 if (!titlecpy) {
5722 return false;
5723 }
5724 SDL_memcpy(titlecpy, messageboxdata->title, slen);
5725 }
5726
5727 if (messageboxdata->message) {
5728 const size_t slen = SDL_strlen(messageboxdata->message) + 1;
5729 msgcpy = SDL_small_alloc(char, slen, &msgisstack);
5730 if (!msgcpy) {
5731 SDL_small_free(titlecpy, titleisstack);
5732 return false;
5733 }
5734 SDL_memcpy(msgcpy, messageboxdata->message, slen);
5735 }
5736
5737 (void)SDL_AtomicIncRef(&SDL_messagebox_count);
5738
5739 current_window = SDL_GetKeyboardFocus();
5740 SDL_UpdateMouseCapture(false);
5741 SDL_SetRelativeMouseMode(false);
5742 show_cursor_prev = SDL_CursorVisible();
5743 SDL_ShowCursor();
5744 SDL_ResetKeyboard();
5745
5746 if (!buttonID) {
5747 buttonID = &dummybutton;
5748 }
5749
5750 SDL_memcpy(&mbdata, messageboxdata, sizeof(*messageboxdata));
5751 mbdata.title = titlecpy;
5752 if (!mbdata.title) {
5753 mbdata.title = "";
5754 }
5755 mbdata.message = msgcpy;
5756 if (!mbdata.message) {
5757 mbdata.message = "";
5758 }
5759 messageboxdata = &mbdata;
5760
5761 SDL_ClearError();
5762
5763 if (_this && _this->ShowMessageBox) {
5764 result = _this->ShowMessageBox(_this, messageboxdata, buttonID);
5765 } else {
5766 // It's completely fine to call this function before video is initialized
5767 const char *driver_name = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_VIDEO_DRIVER);
5768 if (driver_name && *driver_name != 0) {
5769 const char *driver_attempt = driver_name;
5770 while (driver_attempt && (*driver_attempt != 0) && !result) {
5771 const char *driver_attempt_end = SDL_strchr(driver_attempt, ',');
5772 size_t driver_attempt_len = (driver_attempt_end) ? (driver_attempt_end - driver_attempt)
5773 : SDL_strlen(driver_attempt);
5774 for (int i = 0; bootstrap[i]; ++i) {
5775 if (bootstrap[i]->ShowMessageBox && (driver_attempt_len == SDL_strlen(bootstrap[i]->name)) &&
5776 (SDL_strncasecmp(bootstrap[i]->name, driver_attempt, driver_attempt_len) == 0)) {
5777 if (bootstrap[i]->ShowMessageBox(messageboxdata, buttonID)) {
5778 result = true;
5779 }
5780 break;
5781 }
5782 }
5783
5784 driver_attempt = (driver_attempt_end) ? (driver_attempt_end + 1) : NULL;
5785 }
5786 } else {
5787 for (int i = 0; bootstrap[i]; ++i) {
5788 if (bootstrap[i]->ShowMessageBox && bootstrap[i]->ShowMessageBox(messageboxdata, buttonID)) {
5789 result = true;
5790 break;
5791 }
5792 }
5793 }
5794 }
5795
5796 if (!result) {
5797 const char *error = SDL_GetError();
5798
5799 if (!*error) {
5800 SDL_SetError("No message system available");
5801 }
5802 } else {
5803 SDL_ClearError();
5804 }
5805
5806 (void)SDL_AtomicDecRef(&SDL_messagebox_count);
5807
5808 if (current_window) {
5809 SDL_RaiseWindow(current_window);
5810 }
5811
5812 if (!show_cursor_prev) {
5813 SDL_HideCursor();
5814 }
5815 SDL_UpdateRelativeMouseMode();
5816 SDL_UpdateMouseCapture(false);
5817
5818 SDL_small_free(msgcpy, msgisstack);
5819 SDL_small_free(titlecpy, titleisstack);
5820
5821 return result;
5822}

◆ SDL_ShowSimpleMessageBox()

bool SDL_ShowSimpleMessageBox ( SDL_MessageBoxFlags flags,
const char * title,
const char * message,
SDL_Window * window )

Display a simple modal message box.

If your needs aren't complex, this function is preferred over SDL_ShowMessageBox.

flags may be any of the following:

  • SDL_MESSAGEBOX_ERROR: error dialog
  • SDL_MESSAGEBOX_WARNING: warning dialog
  • SDL_MESSAGEBOX_INFORMATION: informational dialog

This function should be called on the thread that created the parent window, or on the main thread if the messagebox has no parent. It will block execution of that thread until the user clicks a button or closes the messagebox.

This function may be called at any time, even before SDL_Init(). This makes it useful for reporting errors like a failure to create a renderer or OpenGL context.

On X11, SDL rolls its own dialog box with X11 primitives instead of a formal toolkit like GTK+ or Qt.

Note that if SDL_Init() would fail because there isn't any available video target, this function is likely to fail for the same reasons. If this is a concern, check the return value from this function and fall back to writing to stderr if you can.

Parameters
flagsan SDL_MessageBoxFlags value.
titleUTF-8 title text.
messageUTF-8 message text.
windowthe parent window, or NULL for no parent.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_ShowMessageBox
5825{
5826#if defined(SDL_PLATFORM_3DS)
5827 errorConf errCnf;
5828 bool hasGpuRight;
5829
5830 // If the video subsystem has not been initialised, set up graphics temporarily
5831 hasGpuRight = gspHasGpuRight();
5832 if (!hasGpuRight)
5833 gfxInitDefault();
5834
5835 errorInit(&errCnf, ERROR_TEXT_WORD_WRAP, CFG_LANGUAGE_EN);
5836 errorText(&errCnf, message);
5837 errorDisp(&errCnf);
5838
5839 if (!hasGpuRight)
5840 gfxExit();
5841
5842 return true;
5843#else
5844 SDL_MessageBoxData data;
5845 SDL_MessageBoxButtonData button;
5846
5847 SDL_zero(data);
5848 data.flags = flags;
5849 data.title = title;
5850 data.message = message;
5851 data.numbuttons = 1;
5852 data.buttons = &button;
5853 data.window = window;
5854
5855 SDL_zero(button);
5856 button.flags |= SDL_MESSAGEBOX_BUTTON_RETURNKEY_DEFAULT;
5857 button.flags |= SDL_MESSAGEBOX_BUTTON_ESCAPEKEY_DEFAULT;
5858 button.text = "OK";
5859
5860 return SDL_ShowMessageBox(&data, NULL);
5861#endif
5862}

Show a window.

Parameters

Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_HideWindow
SDL_RaiseWindow
3259{
3260 SDL_Window *child;
3261 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3262
3263 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN)) {
3264 return true;
3265 }
3266
3267 // If the parent is hidden, set the flag to restore this when the parent is shown
3268 if (window->parent && (window->parent->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN)) {
3269 window->restore_on_show = true;
3270 return true;
3271 }
3272
3273 if (_this->ShowWindow) {
3274 _this->ShowWindow(_this, window);
3275 } else {
3276 SDL_SetMouseFocus(window);
3277 SDL_SetKeyboardFocus(window);
3278 }
3279 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_SHOWN, 0, 0);
3280
3281 // Restore child windows
3282 for (child = window->first_child; child; child = child->next_sibling) {
3283 if (!child->restore_on_show && (child->flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN)) {
3284 break;
3285 }
3286 SDL_ShowWindow(child);
3287 child->restore_on_show = false;
3288 }
3289 return true;
3290}

◆ SDL_ShowWindowSystemMenu()

bool SDL_ShowWindowSystemMenu ( SDL_Window * window,
int x,
int y )

Display the system-level window menu.

This default window menu is provided by the system and on some platforms provides functionality for setting or changing privileged state on the window, such as moving it between workspaces or displays, or toggling the always-on-top property.

On platforms or desktops where this is unsupported, this function does nothing.

Parameters
windowthe window for which the menu will be displayed.
xthe x coordinate of the menu, relative to the origin (top-left) of the client area.
ythe y coordinate of the menu, relative to the origin (top-left) of the client area.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
5870{
5871 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false)
5872 CHECK_WINDOW_NOT_POPUP(window, false)

5875 _this->ShowWindowSystemMenu(window, x, y);
5876 return true;
5877 }
5878
5879 return SDL_Unsupported();
5880}

◆ SDL_StartTextInput()

bool SDL_StartTextInput ( SDL_Window * window)

Start accepting Unicode text input events in a window.

This function will enable text input (SDL_EVENT_TEXT_INPUT and SDL_EVENT_TEXT_EDITING events) in the specified window. Please use this function paired with SDL_StopTextInput().

Text input events are not received by default.

On some platforms using this function shows the screen keyboard and/or activates an IME, which can prevent some key press events from being passed through.

Parameters
windowthe window to enable text input.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetTextInputArea
SDL_StartTextInputWithProperties
SDL_StopTextInput
SDL_TextInputActive
5559{
5560 return SDL_StartTextInputWithProperties(window, 0);
5561}
SDL_StartTextInputWithProperties
bool SDL_StartTextInputWithProperties(SDL_Window *window, SDL_PropertiesID props)
Definition SDL_video.c:5563

References SDL_StartTextInputWithProperties().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_StartTextInputWithProperties()

bool SDL_StartTextInputWithProperties ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_PropertiesID props )

Start accepting Unicode text input events in a window, with properties describing the input.

This function will enable text input (SDL_EVENT_TEXT_INPUT and SDL_EVENT_TEXT_EDITING events) in the specified window. Please use this function paired with SDL_StopTextInput().

Text input events are not received by default.

On some platforms using this function shows the screen keyboard and/or activates an IME, which can prevent some key press events from being passed through.

These are the supported properties:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTINPUT_TYPE_NUMBER - an SDL_TextInputType value that describes text being input, defaults to SDL_TEXTINPUT_TYPE_TEXT.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTINPUT_CAPITALIZATION_NUMBER - an SDL_Capitalization value that describes how text should be capitalized, defaults to SDL_CAPITALIZE_SENTENCES for normal text entry, SDL_CAPITALIZE_WORDS for SDL_TEXTINPUT_TYPE_TEXT_NAME, and SDL_CAPITALIZE_NONE for e-mail addresses, usernames, and passwords.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTINPUT_AUTOCORRECT_BOOLEAN - true to enable auto completion and auto correction, defaults to true.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTINPUT_MULTILINE_BOOLEAN - true if multiple lines of text are allowed. This defaults to true if SDL_HINT_RETURN_KEY_HIDES_IME is "0" or is not set, and defaults to false if SDL_HINT_RETURN_KEY_HIDES_IME is "1".

On Android you can directly specify the input type:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTINPUT_ANDROID_INPUTTYPE_NUMBER - the text input type to use, overriding other properties. This is documented at https://developer.android.com/reference/android/text/InputType
Parameters
windowthe window to enable text input.
propsthe properties to use.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetTextInputArea
SDL_StartTextInput
SDL_StopTextInput
SDL_TextInputActive
5564{
5565 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
5566
5567 if (window->text_input_props) {
5568 SDL_DestroyProperties(window->text_input_props);
5569 window->text_input_props = 0;
5570 }
5571
5572 if (props) {
5573 window->text_input_props = SDL_CreateProperties();
5574 if (!window->text_input_props) {
5575 return false;
5576 }
5577 if (!SDL_CopyProperties(props, window->text_input_props)) {
5578 return false;
5579 }
5580 }
5581
5582 if (_this->SetTextInputProperties) {
5583 _this->SetTextInputProperties(_this, window, props);
5584 }
5585
5586 // Show the on-screen keyboard, if desired
5587 if (AutoShowingScreenKeyboard() && !SDL_ScreenKeyboardShown(window)) {
5588 if (_this->ShowScreenKeyboard) {
5589 _this->ShowScreenKeyboard(_this, window, props);
5590 }
5591 }
5592
5593 if (!window->text_input_active) {
5594 // Finally start the text input system
5595 if (_this->StartTextInput) {
5596 if (!_this->StartTextInput(_this, window, props)) {
5597 return false;
5598 }
5599 }
5600 window->text_input_active = true;
5601 }
5602 return true;
5603}
SDL_CopyProperties
SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_CopyProperties(SDL_PropertiesID src, SDL_PropertiesID dst)
Definition SDL_properties.c:251

Stop receiving any text input events in a window.

If SDL_StartTextInput() showed the screen keyboard, this function will hide it.

Parameters
windowthe window to disable text input.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.

5613{

5615
5616 if (window->text_input_active) {
5617 // Stop the text input system
5618 if (_this->StopTextInput) {
5619 _this->StopTextInput(_this, window);
5620 }
5621 window->text_input_active = false;
5622 }
5623
5624 // Hide the on-screen keyboard, if desired
5625 if (AutoShowingScreenKeyboard() && SDL_ScreenKeyboardShown(window)) {
5626 if (_this->HideScreenKeyboard) {
5627 _this->HideScreenKeyboard(_this, window);
5628 }
5629 }
5630 return true;

◆ SDL_SyncWindow()

bool SDL_SyncWindow ( SDL_Window * window)

Block until any pending window state is finalized.

On asynchronous windowing systems, this acts as a synchronization barrier for pending window state. It will attempt to wait until any pending window state has been applied and is guaranteed to return within finite time. Note that for how long it can potentially block depends on the underlying window system, as window state changes may involve somewhat lengthy animations that must complete before the window is in its final requested state.

On windowing systems where changes are immediate, this does nothing.

Parameters
windowthe window for which to wait for the pending state to be applied.
Returns
true on success or false if the operation timed out before the window was in the requested state.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetWindowSize
SDL_SetWindowPosition
SDL_SetWindowFullscreen
SDL_MinimizeWindow
SDL_MaximizeWindow
SDL_RestoreWindow
SDL_HINT_VIDEO_SYNC_WINDOW_OPERATIONS
3437{
3438 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false)
3439
3440 if (_this->SyncWindow) {
3441 return _this->SyncWindow(_this, window);
3442 } else {
3443 return true;
3444 }
3445}

References _this, and CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC.

Referenced by SDL_SyncIfRequired().

◆ SDL_ToggleDragAndDropSupport()

void SDL_ToggleDragAndDropSupport ( void )
2186{
2187 if (_this && _this->AcceptDragAndDrop) {
2188 const bool enable = IsAcceptingDragAndDrop();
2189 SDL_Window *window;
2190 for (window = _this->windows; window; window = window->next) {
2191 _this->AcceptDragAndDrop(window, enable);
2192 }
2193 }
2194}

◆ SDL_UpdateDesktopBounds()

void SDL_UpdateDesktopBounds ( void )
790{
791 SDL_Rect rect;
792 SDL_zero(rect);
793
794 SDL_DisplayID *displays = SDL_GetDisplays(NULL);
795 if (displays) {
796 for (int i = 0; displays[i]; ++i) {
797 SDL_Rect bounds;
798 if (SDL_GetDisplayBounds(displays[i], &bounds)) {
799 if (i == 0) {
800 SDL_copyp(&rect, &bounds);
801 } else {
802 SDL_GetRectUnion(&rect, &bounds, &rect);
803 }
804 }
805 }
806 SDL_free(displays);
807 }
808 SDL_copyp(&_this->desktop_bounds, &rect);
809}
SDL_GetRectUnion

◆ SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode()

bool SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_FullscreenOp fullscreen,
bool commit )
1868{
1869 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = NULL;
1870 SDL_DisplayMode *mode = NULL;
1871 int i;
1872
1873 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
1874
1875 window->fullscreen_exclusive = false;
1876 window->update_fullscreen_on_display_changed = false;
1877
1878 // If we are in the process of hiding don't go back to fullscreen
1879 if (window->is_destroying || window->is_hiding) {
1880 fullscreen = SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_LEAVE;
1881 }
1882
1883 // Get the correct display for this operation
1884 if (fullscreen) {
1885 display = SDL_GetVideoDisplayForFullscreenWindow(window);
1886 if (!display) {
1887 // This should never happen, but it did...
1888 goto done;
1889 }
1890 } else {
1891 for (i = 0; i < _this->num_displays; ++i) {
1892 display = _this->displays[i];
1893 if (display->fullscreen_window == window) {
1894 break;
1895 }
1896 }
1897 if (!display || i == _this->num_displays) {
1898 // Already not fullscreen on any display
1899 display = NULL;
1900 }
1901 }
1902
1903 if (fullscreen) {
1904 mode = (SDL_DisplayMode *)SDL_GetWindowFullscreenMode(window);
1905 if (mode) {
1906 window->fullscreen_exclusive = true;
1907 } else {
1908 // Make sure the current mode is zeroed for fullscreen desktop.
1909 SDL_zero(window->current_fullscreen_mode);
1910 }
1911 }
1912
1913#if defined(SDL_PLATFORM_MACOS) && defined(SDL_VIDEO_DRIVER_COCOA)
1914 /* if the window is going away and no resolution change is necessary,
1915 do nothing, or else we may trigger an ugly double-transition
1916 */
1917 if (SDL_strcmp(_this->name, "cocoa") == 0) { // don't do this for X11, etc
1918 if (window->is_destroying && !window->last_fullscreen_exclusive_display) {
1919 window->fullscreen_exclusive = false;
1920 if (display) {
1921 display->fullscreen_window = NULL;
1922 }
1923 goto done;
1924 }
1925 if (commit) {
1926 // If we're switching between a fullscreen Space and exclusive fullscreen, we need to get back to normal first.
1927 if (fullscreen && Cocoa_IsWindowInFullscreenSpace(window) && !window->last_fullscreen_exclusive_display && window->fullscreen_exclusive) {
1928 if (!Cocoa_SetWindowFullscreenSpace(window, false, true)) {
1929 goto error;
1930 }
1931 } else if (fullscreen && window->last_fullscreen_exclusive_display && !window->fullscreen_exclusive) {
1932 for (i = 0; i < _this->num_displays; ++i) {
1933 SDL_VideoDisplay *last_display = _this->displays[i];
1934 if (last_display->fullscreen_window == window) {
1935 SDL_SetDisplayModeForDisplay(last_display, NULL);
1936 if (_this->SetWindowFullscreen) {
1937 _this->SetWindowFullscreen(_this, window, last_display, false);
1938 }
1939 last_display->fullscreen_window = NULL;
1940 }
1941 }
1942 }
1943
1944 if (Cocoa_SetWindowFullscreenSpace(window, !!fullscreen, syncHint)) {
1945 goto done;
1946 }
1947 }
1948 }
1949#endif
1950
1951 if (display) {
1952 // Restore the video mode on other displays if needed
1953 for (i = 0; i < _this->num_displays; ++i) {
1954 SDL_VideoDisplay *other = _this->displays[i];
1955 if (other != display && other->fullscreen_window == window) {
1956 SDL_SetDisplayModeForDisplay(other, NULL);
1957 other->fullscreen_window = NULL;
1958 }
1959 }
1960 }
1961
1962 if (fullscreen) {
1963 int mode_w = 0, mode_h = 0;
1964 bool resized = false;
1965
1966 // Hide any other fullscreen window on this display
1967 if (display->fullscreen_window &&
1968 display->fullscreen_window != window) {
1969 SDL_MinimizeWindow(display->fullscreen_window);
1970 }
1971
1972 display->fullscreen_active = window->fullscreen_exclusive;
1973
1974 if (!SDL_SetDisplayModeForDisplay(display, mode)) {
1975 goto error;
1976 }
1977 if (commit) {
1978 SDL_FullscreenResult ret = SDL_FULLSCREEN_SUCCEEDED;
1979 if (_this->SetWindowFullscreen) {
1980 ret = _this->SetWindowFullscreen(_this, window, display, fullscreen);
1981 } else {
1982 resized = true;
1983 }
1984
1985 if (ret == SDL_FULLSCREEN_SUCCEEDED) {
1986 // Window is fullscreen immediately upon return. If the driver hasn't already sent the event, do so now.
1987 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN)) {
1988 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_ENTER_FULLSCREEN, 0, 0);
1989 }
1990 } else if (ret == SDL_FULLSCREEN_FAILED) {
1991 display->fullscreen_active = false;
1992 goto error;
1993 }
1994 }
1995
1996 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) {
1997 display->fullscreen_window = window;
1998
1999 /* Android may not resize the window to exactly what our fullscreen mode is,
2000 * especially on windowed Android environments like the Chromebook or Samsung DeX.
2001 * Given this, we shouldn't use the mode size. Android's SetWindowFullscreen
2002 * will generate the window event for us with the proper final size.
2003 *
2004 * This is also unnecessary on Cocoa, Wayland, Win32, and X11 (will send SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_RESIZED).
2005 */
2006 if (!SDL_SendsFullscreenDimensions(_this)) {
2007 SDL_Rect displayRect;
2008
2009 if (mode) {
2010 mode_w = mode->w;
2011 mode_h = mode->h;
2012 SDL_GetDisplayBounds(mode->displayID, &displayRect);
2013 } else {
2014 mode_w = display->desktop_mode.w;
2015 mode_h = display->desktop_mode.h;
2016 SDL_GetDisplayBounds(display->id, &displayRect);
2017 }
2018
2019 if (window->w != mode_w || window->h != mode_h) {
2020 resized = true;
2021 }
2022
2023 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_MOVED, displayRect.x, displayRect.y);
2024
2025 if (resized) {
2026 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_RESIZED, mode_w, mode_h);
2027 } else {
2028 SDL_OnWindowResized(window);
2029 }
2030 }
2031
2032 // Restore the cursor position
2033 if (!SDL_DisableMouseWarpOnFullscreenTransitions(_this)) {
2034 SDL_RestoreMousePosition(window);
2035 }
2036 }
2037 } else {
2038 bool resized = false;
2039
2040 // Restore the desktop mode
2041 if (display) {
2042 display->fullscreen_active = false;
2043
2044 SDL_SetDisplayModeForDisplay(display, NULL);
2045 }
2046 if (commit) {
2047 SDL_FullscreenResult ret = SDL_FULLSCREEN_SUCCEEDED;
2048 if (_this->SetWindowFullscreen) {
2049 SDL_VideoDisplay *full_screen_display = display ? display : SDL_GetVideoDisplayForFullscreenWindow(window);
2050 if (full_screen_display) {
2051 ret = _this->SetWindowFullscreen(_this, window, full_screen_display, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_LEAVE);
2052 }
2053 } else {
2054 resized = true;
2055 }
2056
2057 if (ret == SDL_FULLSCREEN_SUCCEEDED) {
2058 // Window left fullscreen immediately upon return. If the driver hasn't already sent the event, do so now.
2059 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) {
2060 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_LEAVE_FULLSCREEN, 0, 0);
2061 }
2062 } else if (ret == SDL_FULLSCREEN_FAILED) {
2063 goto error;
2064 }
2065 }
2066
2067 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN)) {
2068 if (display) {
2069 display->fullscreen_window = NULL;
2070 }
2071
2072 if (!SDL_SendsFullscreenDimensions(_this)) {
2073 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_MOVED, window->windowed.x, window->windowed.y);
2074 if (resized) {
2075 SDL_SendWindowEvent(window, SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_RESIZED, window->windowed.w, window->windowed.h);
2076 } else {
2077 SDL_OnWindowResized(window);
2078 }
2079 }
2080
2081 // Restore the cursor position if we've exited fullscreen on a display
2082 if (display && !SDL_DisableMouseWarpOnFullscreenTransitions(_this)) {
2083 SDL_RestoreMousePosition(window);
2084 }
2085 }
2086 }
2087
2088done:
2089 window->last_fullscreen_exclusive_display = display && (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN) && window->fullscreen_exclusive ? display->id : 0;
2090 return true;
2091
2092error:
2093 if (fullscreen) {
2094 // Something went wrong and the window is no longer fullscreen.
2095 SDL_UpdateFullscreenMode(window, SDL_FULLSCREEN_OP_LEAVE, commit);
2096 }
2097 return false;
2098}
SDL_EVENT_WINDOW_ENTER_FULLSCREEN

◆ SDL_UpdateWindowGrab()

void SDL_UpdateWindowGrab ( SDL_Window * window)
3790{
3791 bool keyboard_grabbed, mouse_grabbed;
3792
3793 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_INPUT_FOCUS) {
3794 if (SDL_GetMouse()->relative_mode || (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_GRABBED)) {
3795 mouse_grabbed = true;
3796 } else {
3797 mouse_grabbed = false;
3798 }
3799
3800 if (window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED) {
3801 keyboard_grabbed = true;
3802 } else {
3803 keyboard_grabbed = false;
3804 }
3805 } else {
3806 mouse_grabbed = false;
3807 keyboard_grabbed = false;
3808 }
3809
3810 if (mouse_grabbed || keyboard_grabbed) {
3811 if (_this->grabbed_window && (_this->grabbed_window != window)) {
3812 // stealing a grab from another window!
3813 _this->grabbed_window->flags &= ~(SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_GRABBED | SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED);
3814 if (_this->SetWindowMouseGrab) {
3815 _this->SetWindowMouseGrab(_this, _this->grabbed_window, false);
3816 }
3817 if (_this->SetWindowKeyboardGrab) {
3818 _this->SetWindowKeyboardGrab(_this, _this->grabbed_window, false);
3819 }
3820 }
3821 _this->grabbed_window = window;
3822 } else if (_this->grabbed_window == window) {
3823 _this->grabbed_window = NULL; // ungrabbing input.
3824 }
3825
3826 if (_this->SetWindowMouseGrab) {
3827 if (!_this->SetWindowMouseGrab(_this, window, mouse_grabbed)) {
3828 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_GRABBED;
3829 }
3830 }
3831 if (_this->SetWindowKeyboardGrab) {
3832 if (!_this->SetWindowKeyboardGrab(_this, window, keyboard_grabbed)) {
3833 window->flags &= ~SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED;
3834 }
3835 }
3836
3837 if (_this->grabbed_window && !(_this->grabbed_window->flags & (SDL_WINDOW_MOUSE_GRABBED | SDL_WINDOW_KEYBOARD_GRABBED))) {
3838 _this->grabbed_window = NULL;
3839 }
3840}

◆ SDL_UpdateWindowHierarchy()

void SDL_UpdateWindowHierarchy ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_Window * parent )
static
241{
242 // Unlink the window from the existing parent.
243 if (window->parent) {
244 if (window->next_sibling) {
245 window->next_sibling->prev_sibling = window->prev_sibling;
246 }
247 if (window->prev_sibling) {
248 window->prev_sibling->next_sibling = window->next_sibling;
249 } else {
250 window->parent->first_child = window->next_sibling;
251 }
252
253 window->parent = NULL;
254 }
255
256 if (parent) {
257 window->parent = parent;
258
259 window->next_sibling = parent->first_child;
260 if (parent->first_child) {
261 parent->first_child->prev_sibling = window;
262 }
263 parent->first_child = window;
264 }
265}

SDL_Window * prev_sibling

◆ SDL_UpdateWindowSurface()

bool SDL_UpdateWindowSurface ( SDL_Window * window)

Copy the window surface to the screen.

This is the function you use to reflect any changes to the surface on the screen.

This function is equivalent to the SDL 1.2 API SDL_Flip().

Parameters
windowthe window to update.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowSurface
SDL_UpdateWindowSurfaceRects
3592{
3593 SDL_Rect full_rect;
3594
3595 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3596
3597 full_rect.x = 0;
3598 full_rect.y = 0;
3599 SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels(window, &full_rect.w, &full_rect.h);
3600
3601 return SDL_UpdateWindowSurfaceRects(window, &full_rect, 1);

◆ SDL_UpdateWindowSurfaceRects()

bool SDL_UpdateWindowSurfaceRects ( SDL_Window * window,
const SDL_Rect * rects,
int numrects )

Copy areas of the window surface to the screen.

This is the function you use to reflect changes to portions of the surface on the screen.

This function is equivalent to the SDL 1.2 API SDL_UpdateRects().

Note that this function will update at least the rectangles specified, but this is only intended as an optimization; in practice, this might update more of the screen (or all of the screen!), depending on what method SDL uses to send pixels to the system.

Parameters
windowthe window to update.
rectsan array of SDL_Rect structures representing areas of the surface to copy, in pixels.
numrectsthe number of rectangles.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetWindowSurface
SDL_UpdateWindowSurface
3606{
3607 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
3608
3609 if (!window->surface_valid) {
3610 return SDL_SetError("Window surface is invalid, please call SDL_GetWindowSurface() to get a new surface");
3611 }
3612
3613 SDL_assert(_this->checked_texture_framebuffer); // we should have done this before we had a valid surface.
3614
3615 return _this->UpdateWindowFramebuffer(_this, window, rects, numrects);
3616}
rects

◆ SDL_UpdateWindowTexture()

bool SDL_UpdateWindowTexture ( SDL_VideoDevice * _this,
SDL_Window * window,
const SDL_Rect * rects,
int numrects )
static
498{
499 SDL_WindowTextureData *data;
500 SDL_Rect rect;
501 void *src;
502 int w, h;
503
504 SDL_GetWindowSizeInPixels(window, &w, &h);
505
506 data = (SDL_WindowTextureData *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(SDL_GetWindowProperties(window), SDL_PROP_WINDOW_TEXTUREDATA_POINTER, NULL);
507 if (!data || !data->texture) {
508 return SDL_SetError("No window texture data");
509 }
510
511 // Update a single rect that contains subrects for best DMA performance
512 if (SDL_GetSpanEnclosingRect(w, h, numrects, rects, &rect)) {
513 src = (void *)((Uint8 *)data->pixels +
514 rect.y * data->pitch +
515 rect.x * data->bytes_per_pixel);
516 if (!SDL_UpdateTexture(data->texture, &rect, src, data->pitch)) {
517 return false;
518 }
519
520 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(data->renderer, data->texture, NULL, NULL)) {
521 return false;
522 }
523
524 SDL_RenderPresent(data->renderer);
525 }
526 return true;
527}
SDL_GetSpanEnclosingRect
bool SDL_GetSpanEnclosingRect(int width, int height, int numrects, const SDL_Rect *rects, SDL_Rect *span)

◆ SDL_VideoInit()

bool SDL_VideoInit ( const char * driver_name)

Initialize the video subsystem, optionally specifying a video driver.

This function initializes the video subsystem, setting up a connection to the window manager, etc, and determines the available display modes and pixel formats, but does not initialize a window or graphics mode.

If you use this function and you haven't used the SDL_INIT_VIDEO flag with either SDL_Init() or SDL_InitSubSystem(), you should call SDL_VideoQuit() before calling SDL_Quit().

It is safe to call this function multiple times. SDL_VideoInit() will call SDL_VideoQuit() itself if the video subsystem has already been initialized.

You can use SDL_GetNumVideoDrivers() and SDL_GetVideoDriver() to find a specific driver_name.

Parameters
driver_namethe name of a video driver to initialize, or NULL for the default driver
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
611{
612 SDL_VideoDevice *video;
613 bool init_events = false;
614 bool init_keyboard = false;
615 bool init_mouse = false;
616 bool init_touch = false;
617 bool init_pen = false;
618 int i = 0;
619
620 // Check to make sure we don't overwrite '_this'
621 if (_this) {
622 SDL_VideoQuit();
623 }
624
625 SDL_InitTicks();
626
627 // Start the event loop
628 if (!SDL_InitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_EVENTS)) {
629 goto pre_driver_error;
630 }
631 init_events = true;
632 if (!SDL_InitKeyboard()) {
633 goto pre_driver_error;
634 }
635 init_keyboard = true;
636 if (!SDL_PreInitMouse()) {
637 goto pre_driver_error;
638 }
639 init_mouse = true;
640 if (!SDL_InitTouch()) {
641 goto pre_driver_error;
642 }
643 init_touch = true;
644 if (!SDL_InitPen()) {
645 goto pre_driver_error;
646 }
647 init_pen = true;
648
649 // Select the proper video driver
650 video = NULL;
651 if (!driver_name) {
652 driver_name = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_VIDEO_DRIVER);
653 }
654 if (driver_name && *driver_name != 0) {
655 const char *driver_attempt = driver_name;
656 while (driver_attempt && *driver_attempt != 0 && !video) {
657 const char *driver_attempt_end = SDL_strchr(driver_attempt, ',');
658 size_t driver_attempt_len = (driver_attempt_end) ? (driver_attempt_end - driver_attempt)
659 : SDL_strlen(driver_attempt);
660
661 for (i = 0; bootstrap[i]; ++i) {
662 if (!bootstrap[i]->is_preferred &&
663 (driver_attempt_len == SDL_strlen(bootstrap[i]->name)) &&
664 (SDL_strncasecmp(bootstrap[i]->name, driver_attempt, driver_attempt_len) == 0)) {
665 video = bootstrap[i]->create();
666 if (video) {
667 break;
668 }
669 }
670 }
671
672 driver_attempt = (driver_attempt_end) ? (driver_attempt_end + 1) : NULL;
673 }
674 } else {
675 for (i = 0; bootstrap[i]; ++i) {
676 video = bootstrap[i]->create();
677 if (video) {
678 break;
679 }
680 }
681 }
682 if (video) {
683 SDL_DebugLogBackend("video", bootstrap[i]->name);
684 } else {
685 if (driver_name) {
686 SDL_SetError("%s not available", driver_name);
687 goto pre_driver_error;
688 }
689 SDL_SetError("No available video device");
690 goto pre_driver_error;
691 }
692
693 /* From this point on, use SDL_VideoQuit to cleanup on error, rather than
694 pre_driver_error. */
695 _this = video;
696 _this->name = bootstrap[i]->name;
697 _this->thread = SDL_GetCurrentThreadID();
698
699 // Set some very sane GL defaults
700 _this->gl_config.driver_loaded = 0;
701 _this->gl_config.dll_handle = NULL;
702 SDL_GL_ResetAttributes();
703
704 // Initialize the video subsystem
705 if (!_this->VideoInit(_this)) {
706 SDL_VideoQuit();
707 return false;
708 }
709
710 // Make sure some displays were added
711 if (_this->num_displays == 0) {
712 SDL_VideoQuit();
713 return SDL_SetError("The video driver did not add any displays");
714 }
715
716 SDL_AddHintCallback(SDL_HINT_VIDEO_SYNC_WINDOW_OPERATIONS, SDL_SyncHintWatcher, NULL);
717
718 /* Disable the screen saver by default. This is a change from <= 2.0.1,
719 but most things using SDL are games or media players; you wouldn't
720 want a screensaver to trigger if you're playing exclusively with a
721 joystick, or passively watching a movie. Things that use SDL but
722 function more like a normal desktop app should explicitly reenable the
723 screensaver. */
724 if (!SDL_GetHintBoolean(SDL_HINT_VIDEO_ALLOW_SCREENSAVER, false)) {
725 SDL_DisableScreenSaver();
726 }
727
728 SDL_PostInitMouse();
729
730 // We're ready to go!
731 return true;
732
733pre_driver_error:
734 SDL_assert(_this == NULL);
735 if (init_pen) {
736 SDL_QuitPen();
737 }
738 if (init_touch) {
739 SDL_QuitTouch();
740 }
741 if (init_mouse) {
742 SDL_QuitMouse();
743 }
744 if (init_keyboard) {
745 SDL_QuitKeyboard();
746 }
747 if (init_events) {
748 SDL_QuitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_EVENTS);
749 }
750 return false;
751}

#define SDL_HINT_VIDEO_ALLOW_SCREENSAVER

Definition SDL_video.c:228
SDL_VideoDevice
Definition SDL_sysvideo.h:213

References _this, bootstrap, NULL, SDL_AddHintCallback(), SDL_assert, SDL_DebugLogBackend(), SDL_DisableScreenSaver(), SDL_GetCurrentThreadID(), SDL_GetHint(), SDL_GetHintBoolean(), SDL_GL_ResetAttributes(), SDL_HINT_VIDEO_ALLOW_SCREENSAVER, SDL_HINT_VIDEO_DRIVER, SDL_HINT_VIDEO_SYNC_WINDOW_OPERATIONS, SDL_INIT_EVENTS, SDL_InitKeyboard(), SDL_InitPen(), SDL_InitSubSystem(), SDL_InitTicks(), SDL_InitTouch(), SDL_PostInitMouse(), SDL_PreInitMouse(), SDL_QuitKeyboard(), SDL_QuitMouse(), SDL_QuitPen(), SDL_QuitSubSystem(), SDL_QuitTouch(), SDL_SetError(), SDL_strchr(), SDL_strlen(), SDL_strncasecmp(), SDL_SyncHintWatcher(), and SDL_VideoQuit().

◆ SDL_VideoQuit()

void SDL_VideoQuit ( void )

Shut down the video subsystem, if initialized with SDL_VideoInit().

This function closes all windows, and restores the original video mode.

4481{
4482 int i;
4483
4484 if (!_this) {
4485 return;
4486 }
4487
4488 // Halt event processing before doing anything else
4489#if 0 // This was moved to the end to fix a memory leak
4490 SDL_QuitPen();
4491#endif
4492 SDL_QuitTouch();
4493 SDL_QuitMouse();
4494 SDL_QuitKeyboard();
4495 SDL_QuitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_EVENTS);
4496
4497 SDL_EnableScreenSaver();
4498
4499 // Clean up the system video
4500 while (_this->windows) {
4501 SDL_DestroyWindow(_this->windows);
4502 }
4503 _this->VideoQuit(_this);
4504
4505 for (i = _this->num_displays; i--; ) {
4506 SDL_VideoDisplay *display = _this->displays[i];
4507 SDL_DelVideoDisplay(display->id, false);
4508 }
4509
4510 SDL_assert(_this->num_displays == 0);
4511 SDL_free(_this->displays);
4512 _this->displays = NULL;
4513
4514 SDL_CancelClipboardData(0);
4515
4516 if (_this->primary_selection_text) {
4517 SDL_free(_this->primary_selection_text);
4518 _this->primary_selection_text = NULL;
4519 }
4520 _this->free(_this);
4521 _this = NULL;
4522
4523 // This needs to happen after the video subsystem has removed pen data
4524 SDL_QuitPen();
4525}

◆ SDL_Vulkan_CreateSurface()

bool SDL_Vulkan_CreateSurface ( SDL_Window * window,
VkInstance instance,
const struct VkAllocationCallbacks * allocator,
VkSurfaceKHR * surface )

Create a Vulkan rendering surface for a window.

The window must have been created with the SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN flag and instance must have been created with extensions returned by SDL_Vulkan_GetInstanceExtensions() enabled.

If allocator is NULL, Vulkan will use the system default allocator. This argument is passed directly to Vulkan and isn't used by SDL itself.

Parameters
windowthe window to which to attach the Vulkan surface.
instancethe Vulkan instance handle.
allocatora VkAllocationCallbacks struct, which lets the app set the allocator that creates the surface. Can be NULL.
surfacea pointer to a VkSurfaceKHR handle to output the newly created surface.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_Vulkan_GetInstanceExtensions
SDL_Vulkan_DestroySurface
6041{
6042 CHECK_WINDOW_MAGIC(window, false);
6043
6044 if (!(window->flags & SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN)) {
6045 return SDL_SetError(NOT_A_VULKAN_WINDOW);
6046 }
6047
6048 if (!instance) {
6049 return SDL_InvalidParamError("instance");
6050 }
6051
6052 if (!surface) {
6053 return SDL_InvalidParamError("surface");
6054 }
6055
6056 return _this->Vulkan_CreateSurface(_this, window, instance, allocator, surface);
6057}
NOT_A_VULKAN_WINDOW
#define NOT_A_VULKAN_WINDOW

◆ SDL_Vulkan_DestroySurface()

void SDL_Vulkan_DestroySurface ( VkInstance instance,
VkSurfaceKHR surface,
const struct VkAllocationCallbacks * allocator )

Destroy the Vulkan rendering surface of a window.

This should be called before SDL_DestroyWindow, if SDL_Vulkan_CreateSurface was called after SDL_CreateWindow.

The instance must have been created with extensions returned by SDL_Vulkan_GetInstanceExtensions() enabled and surface must have been created successfully by an SDL_Vulkan_CreateSurface() call.

If allocator is NULL, Vulkan will use the system default allocator. This argument is passed directly to Vulkan and isn't used by SDL itself.

Parameters
instancethe Vulkan instance handle.
surfacevkSurfaceKHR handle to destroy.
allocatora VkAllocationCallbacks struct, which lets the app set the allocator that destroys the surface. Can be NULL.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_Vulkan_GetInstanceExtensions
SDL_Vulkan_CreateSurface
6062{
6063 if (_this && instance && surface && _this->Vulkan_DestroySurface) {
6064 _this->Vulkan_DestroySurface(_this, instance, surface, allocator);
6065 }
6066}

References _this.

◆ SDL_Vulkan_GetInstanceExtensions()

char const *const * SDL_Vulkan_GetInstanceExtensions ( Uint32 * count)

Get the Vulkan instance extensions needed for vkCreateInstance.

This should be called after either calling SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary() or creating an SDL_Window with the SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN flag.

On return, the variable pointed to by count will be set to the number of elements returned, suitable for using with VkInstanceCreateInfo::enabledExtensionCount, and the returned array can be used with VkInstanceCreateInfo::ppEnabledExtensionNames, for calling Vulkan's vkCreateInstance API.

You should not free the returned array; it is owned by SDL.

Parameters
counta pointer filled in with the number of extensions returned.
Returns
an array of extension name strings on success, NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_Vulkan_CreateSurface
6033{
6034 return _this->Vulkan_GetInstanceExtensions(_this, count);
6035}

References _this, and count.

queueFamilyIndexa valid queue family index for the given physical device.
Returns
true if supported, false if unsupported or an error occurred.

6093 * as it is always supported.

◆ SDL_Vulkan_GetVkGetInstanceProcAddr()

SDL_FunctionPointer SDL_Vulkan_GetVkGetInstanceProcAddr ( void )

Get the address of the vkGetInstanceProcAddr function.

This should be called after either calling SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary() or creating an SDL_Window with the SDL_WINDOW_VULKAN flag.

The actual type of the returned function pointer is PFN_vkGetInstanceProcAddr, but that isn't available because the Vulkan headers are not included here. You should cast the return value of this function to that type, e.g.

vkGetInstanceProcAddr = (PFN_vkGetInstanceProcAddr)SDL_Vulkan_GetVkGetInstanceProcAddr();

Returns
the function pointer for vkGetInstanceProcAddr or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
6004{
6005 if (!_this) {
6006 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
6007 return NULL;
6008 }
6009 if (!_this->vulkan_config.loader_loaded) {
6010 SDL_SetError("No Vulkan loader has been loaded");
6011 return NULL;
6012 }
6013 return (SDL_FunctionPointer)_this->vulkan_config.vkGetInstanceProcAddr;
6014}

References _this, NULL, SDL_SetError(), and SDL_UninitializedVideo().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary()

bool SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary ( const char * path)

Dynamically load the Vulkan loader library.

This should be called after initializing the video driver, but before creating any Vulkan windows. If no Vulkan loader library is loaded, the default library will be loaded upon creation of the first Vulkan window.

SDL keeps a counter of how many times this function has been successfully called, so it is safe to call this function multiple times, so long as it is eventually paired with an equivalent number of calls to SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary. The path argument is ignored unless there is no library currently loaded, and and the library isn't actually unloaded until there have been an equivalent number of calls to SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary.

It is fairly common for Vulkan applications to link with libvulkan instead of explicitly loading it at run time. This will work with SDL provided the application links to a dynamic library and both it and SDL use the same search path.

If you specify a non-NULL path, an application should retrieve all of the Vulkan functions it uses from the dynamic library using SDL_Vulkan_GetVkGetInstanceProcAddr unless you can guarantee path points to the same vulkan loader library the application linked to.

On Apple devices, if path is NULL, SDL will attempt to find the vkGetInstanceProcAddr address within all the Mach-O images of the current process. This is because it is fairly common for Vulkan applications to link with libvulkan (and historically MoltenVK was provided as a static library). If it is not found, on macOS, SDL will attempt to load vulkan.framework/vulkan, libvulkan.1.dylib, MoltenVK.framework/MoltenVK, and libMoltenVK.dylib, in that order. On iOS, SDL will attempt to load libMoltenVK.dylib. Applications using a dynamic framework or .dylib must ensure it is included in its application bundle.

On non-Apple devices, application linking with a static libvulkan is not supported. Either do not link to the Vulkan loader or link to a dynamic library version.

Parameters
paththe platform dependent Vulkan loader library name or NULL.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function is not thread safe.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_Vulkan_GetVkGetInstanceProcAddr
SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary
5980{
5981 bool result;
5982
5983 if (!_this) {
5984 return SDL_UninitializedVideo();
5985 }
5986 if (_this->vulkan_config.loader_loaded) {
5987 if (path && SDL_strcmp(path, _this->vulkan_config.loader_path) != 0) {
5988 return SDL_SetError("Vulkan loader library already loaded");
5989 }
5990 result = true;
5991 } else {
5992 if (!_this->Vulkan_LoadLibrary) {
5993 return SDL_DllNotSupported("Vulkan");
5994 }
5995 result = _this->Vulkan_LoadLibrary(_this, path);
5996 }
5997 if (result) {
5998 _this->vulkan_config.loader_loaded++;
5999 }
6000 return result;
6001}

References _this, SDL_DllNotSupported(), SDL_SetError(), SDL_strcmp(), and SDL_UninitializedVideo().

◆ SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary()

void SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary ( void )

Unload the Vulkan library previously loaded by SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary().

SDL keeps a counter of how many times this function has been called, so it is safe to call this function multiple times, so long as it is paired with an equivalent number of calls to SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary. The library isn't actually unloaded until there have been an equivalent number of calls to SDL_Vulkan_UnloadLibrary.

Once the library has actually been unloaded, if any Vulkan instances remain, they will likely crash the program. Clean up any existing Vulkan resources, and destroy appropriate windows, renderers and GPU devices before calling this function.

Thread Safety
This function is not thread safe.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_Vulkan_LoadLibrary
6017{
6018 if (!_this) {
6019 SDL_UninitializedVideo();
6020 return;
6021 }
6022 if (_this->vulkan_config.loader_loaded > 0) {
6023 if (--_this->vulkan_config.loader_loaded > 0) {
6024 return;
6025 }
6026 if (_this->Vulkan_UnloadLibrary) {
6027 _this->Vulkan_UnloadLibrary(_this);
6028 }
6029 }
6030}

References _this, and SDL_UninitializedVideo().

◆ ShouldAttemptTextureFramebuffer()

bool ShouldAttemptTextureFramebuffer ( void )
static
3448{
3449 const char *hint;
3450 bool attempt_texture_framebuffer = true;
3451
3452 // The dummy driver never has GPU support, of course.
3453 if (_this->is_dummy) {
3454 return false;
3455 }
3456
3457 // See if there's a hint override
3458 hint = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_FRAMEBUFFER_ACCELERATION);
3459 if (hint && *hint) {
3460 if (*hint == '0' || SDL_strcasecmp(hint, "false") == 0 || SDL_strcasecmp(hint, SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER) == 0) {
3461 attempt_texture_framebuffer = false;
3462 } else {
3463 attempt_texture_framebuffer = true;
3464 }
3465 } else {
3466 // Check for platform specific defaults
3467#ifdef SDL_PLATFORM_LINUX
3468 // On WSL, direct X11 is faster than using OpenGL for window framebuffers, so try to detect WSL and avoid texture framebuffer.
3469 if ((_this->CreateWindowFramebuffer) && (SDL_strcmp(_this->name, "x11") == 0)) {
3470 struct stat sb;
3471 if ((stat("/proc/sys/fs/binfmt_misc/WSLInterop", &sb) == 0) || (stat("/run/WSL", &sb) == 0)) { // if either of these exist, we're on WSL.
3472 attempt_texture_framebuffer = false;
3473 }
3474 }
3475#endif
3476#if defined(SDL_PLATFORM_WIN32) || defined(SDL_PLATFORM_WINGDK) // GDI BitBlt() is way faster than Direct3D dynamic textures right now. (!!! FIXME: is this still true?)
3477 if (_this->CreateWindowFramebuffer && (SDL_strcmp(_this->name, "windows") == 0)) {
3478 attempt_texture_framebuffer = false;
3479 }
3480#endif
3481#ifdef SDL_PLATFORM_EMSCRIPTEN
3482 attempt_texture_framebuffer = false;
3483#endif
3484 }
3485 return attempt_texture_framebuffer;
3486}

References _this, SDL_GetHint(), SDL_HINT_FRAMEBUFFER_ACCELERATION, SDL_SOFTWARE_RENDERER, SDL_strcasecmp(), and SDL_strcmp().

Referenced by SDL_CreateWindowFramebuffer().

Here is the caller graph for this function:
